Reviews.Title: “Average choice”
Reviews.Author: chayato
Reviews.Content: Ideally located on N. Michigan Avenue Facing the Apple store and walking distance from main shopping areas, The Allerton is an aging hotel with an average service. Standards rooms are ridiculously small and starting to look a bit old and the hotel offers free wi-fi only in the main lobby area. The charge is about 10$ for in room internet connection and the reception in my room was extremely poor and random. When I said this to the lady at the front office she responded "no one else has told me this before" and offered no technical support. However she reversed the 10$ charge and I was left not being able to work from my room. Free coffee is served in the Morning at main lobby and breakfast is served at hotel restaurant but it is ridiculously expensive for this type of hotels. They have an extremely convenient check-in system for major US flights and boarding pass printer. They also have a nice yet very low ceiling gym at 26th floor.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good rate...”
Reviews.Author: roamingseppo
Reviews.Content: I didn't know anything about this hotel prior to booking and reading some of the other reviews I was a bit worried. Worries were quashed when I got to my room. I had a great corner room on a high floor giving me two different lake glimpses. Bathroom was very small, but functional enough. Very comfortable room. Amazing location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: bandks
Reviews.Content: 3 couples 3 suites 1 great time! We had an easy and fast check in when we got there. The conciarge was very helpful with some special requests for our friends birthday and the doorman was always helpful. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were lovely. there is a Gino's pizza directly behind the hotel that is very good also. We all enjoyed this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: WiscoMick
Reviews.Content: Small cramped room, Dust bunnies on the floor. Television was not HD, You have to pay for internet. I would have expected much more for them price we paid. You are totally paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for what you want.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff H
Reviews.Content: I've noticed in the past year or so you have all these online companies offering cheap rates and packages for hotel rooms. Most of the people you see staying in some of what would be your nicer hotels in downtown Chicago like the Allerton wouldn't normally be able to afford it. Groupon and Living Social are two of the big ones. I always try and pay for what I want in service and quality. However what I am seeing is a decline in hotel clientel because of these thrift companies offering rates as low as 49.00 a night to stay in the some of the really nice hotels. Based on a study my daughter did in her Sociology class most of these guest are usually compulsive complainers and non-tippers. Many eye soars during my stay I say be done with these companies and maintain the reputation of your hotels. If you can't afford to travel then don't. My stay was great because I paid for top service and didn't have to expect awesome service at a road side rate.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL but nice; Customer Service skills can use some work...”
Reviews.Author: lycheesatsuma
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 3-star hotel. Rooms are very small but clean. The staff is pretty rude. For example, there was a coffee-maker in my room. I called to ask for some coffee to be brought up; I was told they would make an exception *this time*, but that I should know that I "shouldn't even have the coffee-maker in there" and "shouldn't be calling for coffee". They repeated this over & over again and hung up. Later, I asked the Concierge for some information; he just looked at me blankly and when he finally did reply he was really condescending. Lastly, I asked for a late check-out and was told it was fine but they didnâ€™t note it; they then asked me to vacate the room soon because they needed it. The experience was 5 out of 10. For a few bucks more one may get a bigger room, and perhaps more courteous service.

Reviews.Title: “Small but quaint”
Reviews.Author: afelric1
Reviews.Content: It was smaller than I thought, but it was still great. The service was great, good food, and a nice enough room. It's in a great location, just a little difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Julie G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely nice and we got it for a great price especially since it is right downtown on the Magnificent Mile. We could walk everywhere and the staff were very helpful in giving us suggestions for restaurants. Valet parking is expensive and you can easily park down the street for half the price. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Alex L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellently located on the Magnificent Mile across from Zara and the Apple store. Check in was quick and easy. Hotel also had a great lounge for cocktails. Rooms were a little small but very comfortable and stylish. Great late night food service. Parking in adjacent garage was pricey at $50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great room”
Reviews.Author: leland9552
Reviews.Content: Our Living Social deal was a fantastic value already, enhanced by the friendly efficient service and lovely surroundings of the Allerton Hotel. Check-in was quick, even though there was a line. The bell boys got us cabs quickly and our car was retrieved in 1/2 the time we were told to expect. I love a hotel where the rooms are not cookie-cutters, and this was the case at the Allerton. My only complaints were a noisy heating system when it cycled on and less-than-luxurious towels.

Reviews.Title: “A Chicago Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ANR113
Reviews.Content: I love modern hotels. This is definitely one. The location is ideal if you want to enjoy downtown Chicago for a few days. My stay was nice, however the weekend I visited the hotel was solid booked so there were a number of people being serviced in the lobby during check-in and check-out and during check-in there were only two receptionists. I would have enjoyed my stay better if the person who occupied the room prior to my stay did not smoke in their room, however the hotel did accommodate my compliant and quickly resolved the smell in my room (offered to move me to another room, but the hotel was booked). The room service was definitely quicker than the estimated wait which was great. The day I checked out my train did not leave until the evening and having my luggage being stored for free all day was a great plus. This is definitely a hotel I will stay at again when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything !”
Reviews.Author: jaylbay
Reviews.Content: Older hotel with smaller rooms, but very clean and efficient. The price is right and the location is perfect for shopping and dining. I would recommend for people looking for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice, and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: AMSMike08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alerton for a couple of nights while I was in town for business. I have no complaints. I was upgraded to a king room that was spacious and wonderful, everything was clean, and every staff member I spoke with was friendly. The view from the window wasn't much, but the space and feel of the room was great. If you don't want to deal with traffic or taxis, the hotel is very easy to get to from either airport via the Red Line.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok....”
Reviews.Author: Pierre1999
Reviews.Content: I was not real impressed with the hotel, despite its pretty good reviews. I arrived to find that while the common areas were well appointed, my room was worn and small. The heater/ac was very loud, a large gap under the door, where the light shown through all night, and an extremely small bathroom with dirty grout, a couple pubic hairs or two, and cheap, crooked towel bars that looked like they had been knocked off the walls several times, probably considering the very limited space. I requested another room for the rest of my visit, to wit this room was even smaller, but cleaner and quieter. Received a little bit of attitude front the front desk due to the request to move. Oh well, I'm paying for the room, right? I didn't feel the price and size of the room was a good value, considering how many choices there are in the Magnificent Mile area. No coffee maker, useful refrigerator, or any economical breakfast choices rounded out my disappointment. The topper was a $15/day minimum fee to use wifi--are they kidding in today's day and age? Look elsewhere for a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “would not pay the rack rate”
Reviews.Author: raindr0p82
Reviews.Content: this is an ok hotel. i paid $80 on hotwire and had to remind myself of how much (little) i had paid in order to stop myself from complaining. this place is not a 4-star hotel but for the location, and the price, can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “good place, good location”
Reviews.Author: yeti1975
Reviews.Content: Booked this room on hot-wire.com. It does have a great location and the place is in overall good condition considering its age. The only issue i had with the place was the size of the bed. but thats wasn't that big of deal. Check in was smooth and fast. People working at the hotel were freindly

Reviews.Title: “Grand Chicago Weekend”
Reviews.Author: COJOSwOhio
Reviews.Content: From Dayton, Ohio to Chicago makes a great 3 day weekend road trip - 300 miles with good roads all the way. The Allerton, is a grand old hotel in the perfect location on the Magnificent Mile. Shopping, tourist attractions, the lake, the theatre district and world famous restaurants are all within walking distance. Parking rates are shocking. The lot next to the hotel charged $50 a night. We found it a few blocks away for $35. With our Group-On discount coupon for the hotel we received complimentary glasses of wine on our first night there. For round trip gasoline, hotel, parking, tips and tolls we spent only $150 each. Dining and shopping were luxury extras! All in all, a grand weekend - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID if using GROUPON”
Reviews.Author: mindip37360
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing about my stay with the Allerton was its location. And honestly, I don't know that it was worth the trouble. I made reservations using my groupon discount that I got. When we arrived at the hotel at 6:00 pm, we had to wait over 45 minutes in the check-in line. As I stood there with my husband and three and five-year-old, the lobby was overrun with people standing and sitting everywhere as well. The longer I stood there it came to my attention that everyone else was waiting for a room. Some had been waiting for hours. It seems that Allerton could not handle the groupon deals well. Despite it being almost 7 o'clock, they still had no clean rooms available. There was no offer to discount our room, refund our room, give us a complimentary breakfast, and they couldn't help pay with parking because it is a separate business that runs the parking garage. We ended up having to wait until 8:00 pm until our room was available. The elevators did not work well. We had to push the button to call the elevator five times before one finally came. The light kept going off for elevator call. The room was small and the beds were short (not sure how they were two queen beds. My husband, at 5'7", had his feet hanging over the end). The next morning at check-out, we had a 45 minute wait for our car to be brought to us from the valet. Despite the cost of the room (which I believe should have been comped because of our ridiculous wait), we paid $50 for parking + $18 for other fees (taxes?), I felt totally ripped off for the money I paid. I will definitely NOT be recommending this hotel to anyone. They made no effort to compensate us for our inconvenience. I have stayed in Chicago over 15 times, and this was by FAR the worst experience I had ever had. I would definitely recommend Avenue, St. James, Hotel Allegro, W, or Conrad over this place any day! The staff acted with courteous detachment and seemed to make little effort to make us happy. Oh, we did get a voucher for two glasses of wine. However, I don't drink, and I had two small children with me. Not really worth it at all. Avoid! Particularly if using with a groupon or living social discount. They can't handle the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: SineNomine69
Reviews.Content: Anchored on its south end by the Intercontinental (its latest reincarnation) and the Drake on its north end (it's always been The Drake!), Chicago's Magnificent Mile is a classy strip of high-end stores, hotels, boutiques and restaurants. Located at its mid-point is the Allerton, surely one of the best bargains on this pricey thoroughfare. The Allerton's neighboring hotels include the more luxurious and expensive Peninsula, the Affina, the Park Hyatt, and the Omni. I got a great deal here on Hotwire. As an older property, rooms tend to be on the small side. Mine was furnished with a queen-sized bed (a king would never have fit), a minimalist thin table/desk pushed against a heating unit under a window (but compensated for with an excellent ergonomic swivel chair), a small closet of little use because the floor-mounted safe took up most of its space, and a bathroom with a full window view and a commodious marble tiled walk-in shower with a rainshower head and an abundance of hot water. Towels, etc. were plentiful and of good quality. There was a small shelf above the sink and toilet which is probably adequate for a male guest, but a female guest might have trouble finding enough room on it to accommodate all her toiletries and what-not. The room was supplied with four GLASS glasses (how I hate plastic cups wrapped in plastic -- something one finds all too often even in "better" hotels) which were replaced daily. There was a wall-mounted flatscreen TV which you could really only watch from bed owing to its stationary positioning. The bed was very comfortable, the white linens sparkling. There were an abundance of electrical outlets in the room, but many of them already in use and the free ones inconveniently placed for my Bi-Pap breathing machine. So, I sacrificed the use of a bedside lamp to plug it in. The bedside table was miniscule - so small, in fact, that the alarm clock was on the table/desk on the opposite wall. But the view? WOW! I had two full windows in this corner room and another full window in the bathroom. From my 12th floor aerie, two of them looked north down Michigan Ave. overlooking the historic Water Tower and on to Lake Michigan and the Oak Street Beach. With the exception of the occasional fire engine or police siren, the room was amazingly and peacefully quiet. There's shopping galore (even if only gazing in windows) nearby. There's a Brooks Brothers on the ground level of the hotel, a multi-storey indoor mall across the street anchored by a Saks Fifth Ave, a Neiman-Marcus on the next block and a Bloomingdale's further down the street. There's also a Polo Ralph Lauren store and Tiffany's is right there too! For regular, last-minute needs, there's a Walgreen's just steps away. The neighborhood has an array of very easy-on-the-pocketbook eateries. M Burger (think In-and-Out or Five Guys) has only 7 stools, so plan on carry-out. It's across the street from the hotel. On the same block, head east to Elephant and Castle. Gino's East (originators of classic deep-dish pizza) has an outpost just a few blocks away. Even Walgreen's has a huge selection of good food items - sushi, even! I got a veggie tray, a fruit cup, pita chips and hummus, and a yogurt parfait there along with soft drinks. Given the area's eating options, the Allerton's restaurant is serviceable but uneven and expensive with sporadic hours at dinner. I got an excellent reuben sandwich and lobster bisque from room service one night. However, the yolks on the eggs benedict one morning in the restaurant were hard-boiled, not runny. Another day at lunch downstairs, I repeated the reuben sandwich (go with a winner) with their excellent shoestring potatoes and a top-notch generous bowl of cream of mushroom soup. The $9 apple tart for dessert (which had been obviously nuked) did not come with the advertised ice cream but only a sliced, fanned-out strawberry. The menu featured "a trio of gelato's (sic) and sorbetto's (sic)." So much for proof-reading and basic grammatical knowledge, a sad sign of the times, alas. My 12th floor hallway would have benefitted from a thorough vaccuuming, but overall the physical appearance of the Allerton is very good from its motor entrance to the lobby, restaurant, and other public areas including my room. Many of the meeting rooms are named after noteworthy architects associated with Chicago such as Burnham, Wright, Sullivan, van der Rohe et al which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible terrible stay twice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aahnsiobhan
Reviews.Content: awful!!! Stayed in a family room with our 2 kids someone came in our room around 9pm, scary they said they were delivering toothpaste!! Stayed again in a family room last night came home around 12.30 am to a party in the room next door we complained twice to management awful!!! There must have being 10 people in the room partying hard!!never will I stay in this hotel again 2 bad experiences is enough for me!! Glad I didn't bring my kids last night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in another era and although refurbished, retains its old world elegance. Staff were helpful and friendly. The room was on the small side but quite clean and comfortable. This is on the Mile and very convenient for shopping, bars and restaurant and transport. There is a drugstore chain nearby if you need to pick up small items and the Water Tower with great shopping. Even though you have options for eating out in the surrounding streets, the hotel restaurant prices should be more competitive. I recommend this hotel since it is in the middle of the action.and easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: JTmsu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allerton for 2 nights with groupons. The room was contemporary, comfortable, and of good size. The location is great, right on the MM. A few cons to the stay were that there was little space for clothes - one medium sized closet with a couple of hangers, and the refrigerator has no room for personal items. Also, upon arrival the attendant would not let me take my own luggage to my room. For some reason it had to be brought up to my room for me. He was very persistant and I didn't feel like arguing as I did not have anything of high value in my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: nervoustravelor
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in the service and the star rating of this hotel! We booked with an online discounted service that we have used many times in the past and never had a problem. I felt we were treated like second class citizens. The room was so small there was maybe a foot on each side of the double bed and the bathroom could only fit a shower. When I asked if another room was available the clerk told me there would be an additional charge which I was not willing to pay because of the service and the condition of the hotel. The staff at the front door didn't even greet you as you were coming and going. When we booked we clearly indicated that the reservation was for two people but we were given a room with one double bed, which by the way was very uncomfortable. In the lobby was a sign advertising a brunch the next day but when we went to breakfast we were informed that the hotel occupancy was low so they were not serving brunch. If that were so, then why were we given such a petite room?? I would think they would much rather keep their customers happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frenchievern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allerton on a Saturday night in early January. We purchased a suite through Groupon for about $150.00 and it was well worth it for the space alone. We checked in on a Saturday afternoon and the process was very quick. We decided to valet and the $50 were charged to our room. The view was gorgeous, the location was right smack in the middle of entertainment and dinning. The biggest problem with this hotel is that it's an old hotel. The walls and windows are very thin, everything can be heard. When we opened the curtains, we felt the cold draft come into our room right away. Throughout the night we were unable to keep the room warm and just ended up closing all the curtains, unable to join the wonderful view. We also realized when we went to get ice from the ice machine that you do not want a room near that machine, it's extremely loud! The walls are very thin and the hotel has a very narrow hallways, everything can be heard! If you decide to get a room in this hotel, insist on having a room away from the ice machine and away from all elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: lblake87
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Allerton on a Saturday night. We had a Groupon, so we stayed in a suite that was huge. Everything was very clean and comfy and we had a great view of the skyline. The best part of the hotel is the location- walking distance to Water Tower, tons of restaurants, and public transportation (we did not drive). We spent time in the lobby bar and really liked the intimate ambiance with the fireplace, bowls of spicy snacks, etc. Only issue we had was that check-in took a long time and they seemed to be understaffed- but I guess it's to be expected at check-in time on a Saturday night. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “2012 ASHRAE Convention, 2 nights Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jeff M
Reviews.Content: Two nights at the Allerton was very pleasant. Purchased on Hotwire for $58 per night while many friends paid $100 more for other hotels in area. Bed was very very comfortable and bath & shower were very nice. Only negative was bath not having shelf or area for toiletries. Business Center with free printing, unheard of today but true. Paid valet parking for $50 per night & cabbed or bus but better then driving in Chicago. Would recommend to anyone wanting romantic escape or family vacation. Close to Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Room on common wall with service elevator”
Reviews.Author: madisondr
Reviews.Content: On check in we specifically requested a room away from the elevator banks. We checked in early so there we still many rooms to choose from. When we went to sleep it sounded like a snow plow was operating in our room - we realized it was the service elevator. This went on the entire night. It turned out that our room and the bed were on a common wall to the back side of the service elevator. It was too late to change rooms. It was the worst night I have ever spent in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, boutique hotel on Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: viajadora59
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a neat hotel! I would not have chosen the Allerton had it not been for a Groupon offering last month. Iâ€™m so glad for that because the Allerton is such a lovely boutique hotel right in the heart of the Mag Mile. We arrived right before the little snowstorm of Jan. 20 and got our car valet-parked so that we could then just walk wherever we needed to go. Water Tower place is just a few blocks north of the hotel and there are so many restaurants within walking distance (Ginoâ€™s East, Weber Grill, and West Egg CafÃ©, to name a few that we chose). Our corner suite was great! Very spacious, with beautiful views of a snowy Chgo. landscape (fun to observe from our 21st floor rooms). Bed was super comfortable. Nice shower (dessert plate-sized shower head). [The only negative was a dirty glass (lots of smudgy fingerprints and something caked on it) by the ice bucket â€“ that was kind of gross â€“ I wonder if the glasses go to the kitchen dishwasher or if they are cleaned right in the roomâ€¦] All around cozy place. The bar (we received 2 glasses of complimentary wine) in the late evening was relaxed and inviting with the fire blazing in the fireplace/firepit. There is a large workout room on the 25th floor, with lots of machines and equipment! No trouble logging into the complimentary Wi-Fi. Yes, there were sirens a few times, but, heck, youâ€™re in downtown Chgo. â€“ to be expected! Adds to the aura of the big city â˜º Yes, you enter on Huron St., although the address is Michigan Avenue. Yes, parking is appx. $50 per day (one thing I hate about downtown Chgo. period! Grrrrr!) Just a heads up that the hotel REQUIRES a paper printout of your Groupon, which was not communicated ahead of time, and I did not have one. It took some time to get it taken care of, but the front desk person was extremely patient and it all worked out fine. This was the only problem I had.

Reviews.Title: “Location with history”
Reviews.Author: afn10694
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay in Kingsize room on 18th floor with veiw of Magnificent Mile and Watertower. No problem with elevator waits but never could get connected to web. Got a decent rate with Groupon deal. Location was ideal. Reasonable walking distance from the subway system with 1 connection from airport (a 3 day pass was great deal for everything we needed and prevented high parking prices). Lots of places close to eat. We were trying out the Chicago Pizza (It is good as pizza always is to me, but not anything super special). Walgreens in same block. Very enjoyable stay. Especially recomend the Mayors office sponsored free tours with volunteer greeters. Nobel Horse Theater was unusual fine in downtown Chicago to those with Equine interests. Lots to do--will go back in warmer weather next time. Was nice for us Floridians to have one day of snow though

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Allerton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JACQUELINE B
Reviews.Content: My stay there was not really pleasant, for the Price that they normally charge, I did not expect the Wallpaper to be loose and starting to come of the wall. Also in the refrigerator was food left from a former Guest and when I discovered that and went to the front Desk, the Receptionist aced as If I was lying.Also I had called ahead to find out the price for valet parking and was told it would be $ 40.00 a Night but then I was charged $ 50.00 and again the Front Desk receptionist acted as If I was lying. This was our 1 Wedding Anniversary and as far as the Hotel goes we where totally disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: kayoung1
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in on a Saturday morning around 10 a.m. Front desk was very helpful and even upgraded our room from a petite to a Queen. Glad they did that as this room was adequate but I would hate to know how small a petite is. The room looked as though it had been recently redone. Large glass shower in bathroom. Flat Screen TV. Only a few steps to Michicagn Ave. Bar was nice and modern. The only negative was there were many sirens you could hear throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at one of Chicago's historic hotels”
Reviews.Author: jnj2003
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 10th floor was nicely renovated and appointed with a queen-sized bed, and a partial view of the old water tower and the Hancock building. Although it was very close to the elevators, we didn't hear them at all. The bathroom was larger than I expected, and had a full tub - not just a stall shower, and good water pressure. While there isn't an in-room coffee maker, there is really good coffee available in the lobby in the morning. The location for shopping on the Mag Mile can't be beat. Contrary to other reviews I read, we didn't experience any long wait times for the elevators, and found the check in/out process painless. Yes, the rooms are small. But that's to be expected with an historic city hotel. Short of combining two rooms into one, there's not much they can do to make the circa 1920 rooms any larger. Overall, it was a nice stay, and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: EO33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allerton on New Year's Eve this year. Our first obstacle was finding the place! We usually use public transport when staying in the city, but decided to drive this time because we needed to be somewhere the next day - our mistake! The address is Michigan Ave., but the hotel entrance is on the side street, not on Michigan. From Michigan, you only see the Brooks Brothers store that occupies the bottom floor of the building. We had our GPS guiding us, but missed the hotel and had to loop back around to get to the hotel entrance. We dropped off our car at the valet garage next door ($48 for the night) and were able to check in quickly. We were given the choice of a standard room overlooking Mich. Ave. or a queen room with no view. We chose the queen room in hopes of a bigger bed, but I swear the bed in there was only a full. We knew going in that the rooms would be tiny, and they certainly lived up to that expectation. We had enough room to move around, but just barely. When we checked in, I thought the clerk had said there was complimentary Wifi, but when I tried to log on, there was a charge. When I called the front desk to clarify, I was immediately put on hold. After over 5 minutes on hold, I got tired of waiting and hung up. The hotel fulfilled the purpose of having a place to stay downtown on New Year's Eve, but the atmosphere of the hotel itself didn't offer much. Once you find it, the location is great. It is very convenient to all of the Michigan Ave. shopping, dining, etc. It was fine, but I have had better stays at other hotels in the area. Nothing terrible about it, but nothing outstanding either.

Reviews.Title: “Allerton chicago”
Reviews.Author: Anaispins
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a classic building with a renovated touch. The furnishings are modern, visually appealing and comfortable. The rooms for Downtown Chicago felt spacious though they are not and are appointed with a workspace, Ipod docks, closets, individual room temp controls, tv, a nook for the suitcase and lovely bathrooms. The bed was heavenly. It was within walking distance of a number of restaurants, bars, The Feinberg School of Medicine (perhaps only relevant to me) and the hotel bar was not so "hotel" that one would not be opposed to meeting there. Breakfast was included for our group and was a fine mix of offerings with friendly service in a high ceiling, open feel restaurant. I did not sample their dinner offerings but imagine they would be up to par. The only thing I did not like was the smaller business center (unmanned two computers and a printer) but there is a FedEx up the street in the Marriott. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Anniebonnie
Reviews.Content: I too purchased a Living Social coupon for the Allerton. I had stayed there before, a number of years ago. We did not have to wait for check in, BUT a paper copy of the coupon was required, necessitating a trip to the business center and a wait for others to finish using the two computers available. If restaurants can use the number from my phone, why can't the Allerton? Or at least specify this in advance. But our suite was lovely, we got two drinks in the lounge, and the location is unsurpassed., The two young ladies who accompanied us, my granddaughter and a friend, slept on the pull out sofa and complained bitterly about the discomfort. The King bed in the bedroom was quite comfortable. Wonderful views of Michigan Avenue. The staff was very helpful upon check-out, checking our bags and later retrieving them and loading them into our taxi. I would recommend it and will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, high extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Ayhan N
Reviews.Content: Don't go to this hotel. The staff isn't very helpful. The charges for the minibar are way too high. They even charge you $25 if you use the minibar for your own drinks!!! What a service!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: nada01234
Reviews.Content: Downtown Chicago is a routine trip for my family of four and each time we select a new hotel downtown to enjoy. This time it was the Allerton Hotel and we were very excited about the chance to stay on the Magnificent Mile near Water Tower Place. The view alone should have been remarkable given the hotel's location. Too bad that wasn't the case. Foremost, entry to the hotel is at the ground level to a drab and unwelcoming baggage claim area. You are instructed to take the elevator to the 2nd floor lobby. These items alone should be immediate warnings that you are about to be disappointed - as you will be. The elevators that you will get on are capable of holding five or maybe six people at maximum - there are closets in Brooklyn that are larger. To add to it, the number of elevators is quite small. 3 total service the 20+ floors of guests. 1 elevator (of same size) services just the first three floors. Oh, and they crawl like snails. You will have to wait overly long for one, and I hope you're not closterphobic as you will be on it for a while. Encountering the lobby is like visiting a cave. It is dark - black desk, black walls, not well lit, and has the feel of a Bosnian regional airport terminal check-in. You're hoping that you can catch the next flight and leave quickly. Here the staff were courtious and friendly - this was one positive I saw throughout the hotel (including bag handlers, maids, and maintenance personnel). A bar / lounge is positioned next to the conceriege. It too was black and drab and never had anyone in it in the times we were there. On to the rooms. Once we were finally delivered to our floor (with those elevators it took quite some time), we opened the door to our assigned room. Let me be perfectly blunt - I was appauled. While it was clean, those closets in Brooklyn were still chuckling and I think walk-in closets in Cleveland were snickering. Two double beds along with a desk and chair had been stuffed into a long and narrow room. The decor was okay, but little else was. There was literally 10 inches of space between the desk and wall in which to squeeze by to enter the space. Luggage had to be picked up and carried over top the desk as there was absolutely no way it would clear the narrow confines otherwise. The curtains were open to the view that would be ours for our three night stay. There was no sunlight but instead a complete and total view of the side of a brick building some 10 feet away. Literally no sunlight in, and no view out - just bricks and mortar to add to drab and dreary. A Bosnia airport terminal would have have more of a view. The bathroom was ample with large sink and a single shower stall with clear glass sliding doors. If you'd rather not be seen in your birthday suit during a shower, don't plan to allow the spouse in the bathroom to simultaniously work at the sink. Oh, and the flush handle of the toilet sticks right out in the walkway - you're sure to flush it on the way to the shower if you're not careful. The only redeeming qualities of the bathroom were a great shower head and water pressure that gave a wonderful shower and the conditioner that the Allerton offered. Ready to go to sleep? I hope not. While the beds look nice, they really aren't beds, but rather trampolines. Seriously, the bounce on these things was incredible. I'm surprised they didn't just bounce themselves out into the trash bin. They made for the worst sleep ever. The beds were tremendously uncomfortable. It's especially obvious how bad they are when my children (both under 10) complain that their backs hurt after a night on the bed. I'd have been more comfortable sleeping on the floor. The only positive was that the sheets and pillows were of good quality - not premium, but acceptable. There is one last dig I have to make on the Allerton and it concerns WiFi. Most downtown Chicago hotels understand that WiFi is important to their guests and willinging provide it freely. It is afterall terribly inexpensive to operate and maintain. However, the Allerton would rather charge you for use to the tune of $10 per day. Talk about nickel and diming to death! The one fortune we found was that a couple of the stores on Michigan Avenue in the near vacinity of the Allerton did freely offer WiFi to their clients and the WiFi signal was strong enough to be used from the room. We had full internet capability through their signal without having to dip into our pockets to laiden the Allerton with more profits. Their stealing a good night's rest from us on the attrocious beds was punishment enough. If you are looking to stay in downtown Chicago and want to be in the area of the Allerton let me strongly suggest the Affinia Hotel instead - one block over. Our experience at that hotel was rather positive. The Allerton was horrid and we shall not return.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: carol v
Reviews.Content: We have nevered stay at the Allerton before, but decided to take a chance on a Michigan Ave. Hotel, Since this was the second weekend in Dec. thought the price would be over the top, but it was not. We arrived early (9:00 a.m.) thought we would just check our luggage, but was able to check into the hotel!! How great!! Room was small, but very clean and a very nice bathroom. Staff was friendly and helpful. Coffee was down in the check out area, but that was ok with us, because it was great coffee, much better that the pots of coffee you make yourself in the room! Only thing I would say could be fixed were the elevators. There is a long wait to get one, but this would not keep me from staying there again! Great location to stay especially if your shopping. Allerton, thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed...terrible communication”
Reviews.Author: MikeR V
Reviews.Content: Like similar reviewers, I headed to Chicago with a groupon. My wife and I make Chicago our regular "easy vacation" spot since we live in Michigan; we've stayed in various hotels in or around downtown, etc. The hotel interior itself was very nice. It was clean with old-style character. Strange to not have a coffee maker in each room, but not that big of a deal to go down and get some cups in the lobby. We bought the suite groupon and were impressed with the view and the room...when we finally made it there... Upon making the reservation I was told by staff to "call whenever you arrive and see if the room is available." We did this as we were heading to the hotel and were told that the room would be available "later in the day." We had our car valet parked at the hotel and had our bags stored until check-in. At this point we were again told by the valet that the rooms "often are ready before 3pm so go on upstairs and see if it is ready now." Again we were told "later in the day." So we happily walked around Chicago for a while and came back around 2:30pm. The staff said "the room will be ready soon, it is almost done being cleaned." Fine, because room check-in WAS at 3 pm and we were early. So we said we'd wait in the lobby. As another reviewer stated, there were many families waiting to check-in. At about 3:15, I checked again and was told "the rooms aren't ready yet. They are nearly oversold and not cleaned." This time I directly asked when they would be ready and if we could have our bags brought up to the lobby. The bags needed to be taken to the room, she said, and the room would be ready soon...they would come get us in the lobby... We sat down. At about 3:45 my wife asked the front desk for some kind of estimate...the front desk said they would try to call the cleaning staff. My wife stood near the desk waiting for 10 minutes with no call from cleaning, no apology or anything from the front desk. At this point an irate middle-aged woman who arrived about 20 minutes after us and was waiting in the lobby like us came up to the desk demanding her suite be ready and asked for a late check-out and amazingly the room was ready and the front desk granted her a 2 pm checkout. My wife and I [we are in our 20s] inquired why her suite suddenly was available and miraculously our room was suddenly available, too. My wife said "we would like a late check-out as well and the front desk woman said "I can do one o'clock." No, that lady in front of us just was given 2 pm check-out. So we had our keys and up to the room. The end, right? No... We waited for our bags for about 25 minutes and then I called to ask and was told "I'll call the valet, sorry." 35 minutes in, we get a knock with a valet worker with someone else's bags "are these your bags?" 45 minutes I call again. "Valet should bring your bags up shortly." Our bags were over an hour late to our room when the front desk said they would be up in "about 15 minutes." The thing is, if they would've said "we're totally swamped because of the groupon" or "we've been granting late check-outs for days because of poor service" and then told us directly that we wouldn't be able to check in until four or even later, my wife and I would not have cared. We were in Chicago. There are places to go. It's just the "be ready soon" "not sure, I'll call the cleaning person" nonsense that pushes your buttons. Dear Allerton management, don't set up a groupon if you can't handle the numbers. Too bad because I would definitely recommend people go there if not for all this nonsense.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price; good location”
Reviews.Author: Dustin H
Reviews.Content: We chose the Allerton this time because we thought it would be cool to stay at a hotel with character and a little history. Overall it's nice hotel and was clean etc. Downside is that old-renovated hotels tend to have that stuffy enclosed feeling as it seems every time they renovate the spaces get smaller. The hallways were narrow and really hot with short ceilings (maybe 8-9ft). Our room was clean and had a nice view down Michigan Ave. The room was very small (approx 14x14) however with the door only 4 ft from the bed. The bathroom was below par. It was lined with pseudo gray marblish stuff. It was super small. The shower was old and the faucet handle was so loose I was afraid it was going to break off. After returning from dinner we hung out at the lobby bar which had great service and a nice atmosphere with comfortable chairs and subdued lighting. We ordered room service for breakfast, via the door tag, and it was delivered right on time. The breakfast was well done; however, we quickly realized that our little room provided no where to sit and eat so we ended up using the foot of our bed as a "table". (again, small room). If you drive to the hotel, parking is available in the garage next door and costs over $40 per 24hrs (ouch!; but common in the city). Next stay, we will probably choose a more modern hotel within the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: summerbeachmom
Reviews.Content: My stay here was fine. My first room was very small and next to the elevator, so I asked to be moved. The next room was huge and far from the elevator so very quiet. It seemed like it could have been more clean-I found trash from previous guests under some furniture. The service at breakfast in the hotel was not great-I asked for decaf coffee several times and never got it. The elevators were small and often crowded, and the exercise room was not ideal. The location was excellent, though, and the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Allerton”
Reviews.Author: dgthe3rd
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting Chicago, and I booked the Allerton through Hotels.com. The hotel is in a perfect location on the Magnificent Mile. We walked pretty much everywhere we went. There is an L station a few blocks away. The room was not huge, but it's a big city and it's expected. The room was very clean, bed very comfortable and the bathroom was great. The lobby is not on the bottom floor, which is a little awkward. However, the bell men are great and ensure you get your luggage to the right place. The lobby was nice, with a firepit and a great bar to relax in at the end of the day. I didn't interact with the staff all too much, but when I did, they were very friendly and helpful. I couldn't see any reason not to recommend staying here for your trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: eafalendysz
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I usually do not stay in hotels this expensive. However, I have had the opportunity to stay at a few others of this calibur and found the Allerton to be more refined than the others. I disovered the Allerton through Groupon (and thus could afford to stay here in the first place). I was intrigued by the idea of staying in a historical hotel because I love to learn more about Chicago's history every time I go. We got a King Junior suite and it was absolutely stunning and very comfortable. The room was a perfect blend of 20's era decor with modern amenities. The bed was very comfortable and we had two tvs and a couch in our room as well (however, our friends did not get the same couch and 2nd tv even though they also bought the groupon). The location was perfect for sight seeing and our room even had a partial view of Michigan Avenue. It sounds trivial but I was surprised that the mini bar was no more expensive than food or drinks in an airport. There were two small negatives: One of the hotel staff members was a little gruff at the front desk but the others were very cordial and helpful. Secondly, don't forget to factor in the cost of parking. I was lead to believe that parking was included when I made the reservation, but I could have just misunderstood. A full day of parking is $48, but there is a lovely motor lounge with helpful valets and bellhops so you don't have to wait for your car in the cold. If you can afford it, I think the Allerton is totally worth it. It was great for a romantic weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Average..”
Reviews.Author: romaroma_x
Reviews.Content: I have mixed reviews about this hotel, on the good side it is in an absolutely fantastic location on the magnificent mile, close to all the shopping and sights in Chicago. I gathered the staff were very friendly and polite from the little interaction I had with them, you don't seem to see them around much as the lobby isn't located on the ground floor. The bed was extremely comfortable, I got a very good nights sleep with no interruptions. I wouldn't expect the room to be big as this is a huge (1930's?) hotel, quite old fashioned, very old elevators, however the rooms are modernly furnished with an lcd tv, ipod dock, safe, iron & ironing board, mini bar. I couldn't believe that there wasn't a coffee machine in the room. I've never been to a hotel without one- even budget hotels have them, this annoyed me a bit. There was also no bath in my room and it was very small. The bathroom didn't have any space to put my toiletries and whenever the light was on it made a very loud noise. I would definitely stay here again as it is a lovely, clean hotel in a fantastic location, but next time I would ask for a larger room with a tub.

Reviews.Title: “Literally a "stinky" experience”
Reviews.Author: sle516
Reviews.Content: We too used a Groupon to book our room. We live in the suburbs and were taking the train downtown. I called ahead to see if we could have early check in and were told that a 1:00 check in would be fine. We got there at 2:00 and were told(with quite an attitude) that check in was not til 3 but they would call my cell phone if it were ready earlier. So we checked our luggage and went walking around the city. At 3:00 we went back to the desk to see if the room was ready. We were told "Oh, your room has been ready". We went up to our room and as soon as we opened the door we could smell urine. There was no way we could stay in this room. We called down to the front desk and they said to come back down and we would get a new room. At the front desk we were given a new room key but it seemed they were the ones inconvenienced, not us. When we finally settled in to our room it was fine. It was quite small but comfortable. It has a great location, right on the Mag Mile but there are many other hotels in the city with a good location and a nicer room with much better service

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary European beauty in an awkward spot”
Reviews.Author: Urbane_Hoosier
Reviews.Content: You need to know what you're getting into here. There are a number of mixed reviews on this hotel and I can understand why. First: note this is a NOT a hotel for a family visit, unless your family is European or is quite adventuresome and doesn't mind smallish rooms and looking elsewhere for breakfast. A number of other reviews provide details on the location, etc. so let's move on. This is a very nice, contemporary european hotel, with ecclectic color palettes, textures and styles - but it works. The hallways have nice character with some rooms down short hallways and not directly off the main hallway. The lighting in the rooms and hallways is subdued - again, very European. The rooms themselves are decidedly small. Request an upgrade to a King room if you need a lot of space or are planning to stay more than one night (or want a tub). The marbled bathroom (floor included) is a nice touch - quite classy, but again, doesn't provide any "counter top" space (pedestal sink). The beds looked flat & lumpy, but were adequate and slept okay. The breakfast "buffet" is random - it's only a buffet depending on the level of occupancy in the hotel. I'd skip it and try West Egg Cafe or Panera Bread, both only a few minutes walk from the hotel. Also, the $25 cleaning fee for even using the refrigerator is an unnecessary inconvenience - we walked to our car to store leftover foods from great Chicago restaurantes. (Good thing it was December!) The service was generally friendly and competent. We had problems with a very noisy neighbor one night and the hotel staff handled the situation with authority giving confidence that they want to maintain a high-quality establishment. This leads to the awkward spot comment. This hotel seems to do a lot of business with discount travel sites, which with its exorbitent breakfast, refrigerator fees & parking ($48/night) - I can understand why. However, this seems to breed the type of clientele that make the hotel less desirable. I would recommend the hotel make a few changes: Improve mattress quality; change the mini-bar fee to be on par with the rest of the (American hotel) world; provide a buffet daily "regardless of occupancy" and include more variety in it; after all those changes are made, increase hotel prices by 20% and still work with discounters. You will provide more value at your rack rates and will maintain and perhaps improve your clientele staying via discounters. Ultimately, your ratings will improve.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just not much room.”
Reviews.Author: MichellefromClevelan
Reviews.Content: We booked on Hotwire and got a rate of about 1/2 off. Receptionist upgraded us when she learned it was my husband's birthday. Room was still small. Would hate to see original room! Location was great! Right in the middle of everything, 2 blocks from water tower and close to all public transit. Parking is $48 so if you can leave the car at home, do so. There was no coffee maker. Fridge was prestocked and if you removed anything you were automatically charged. Walgreens 2 blocks away was a blessing for snacks since there was no vending machines. Hotel was nice but definately could use a spring cleaning to get rid of the cob webs and keep up with it's 4 star rating. Would stay again if the price was right but definately not worth the $159 rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “smallest room”
Reviews.Author: Kim G
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through a groupon i had purchased which stated a queen room and when we arrived it was the smallest room I have ever stayed in by far..... there was absolutely no way the bed was a queen size bed and there wasn't even enough room to walk around the foot of the bed as there was maybe 12 inches between the foot of the bed and the wall. I literally would lose my balance and fall on the bed when i tried to get around to my side of the bed. I will not stay here again ....... although the location was great there needs to be a little room to get around even if you are only staying one night. Also it was noisy late at night where you can clearly hear the people outside in the hallway...... And that is another problem the physical space for the hallway made it feel like the walls were closing in on you it was so small... will never stay here again...... i even had called ahead to see if i could upgrade to a suite as the person i was traveling with just had surgery and the reservationist was not helpful and stated that he can only check when we arrive and could not handle that request over the phone?? Have no idea why this would be such a problem! Either there was a suite available or there wasn't ??? not helpful at all

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rori74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allerton Hotel for a girlâ€™s weekend. The hotel is in great location on Michigan Avenue so you are right in the middle of great restaurants and shopping. When we walked in the door of our room it smelled as if someone had been smoking so on our way out I stopped at the front desk to ask if perhaps we were put in the wrong room because I had asked for nonsmoking. The clerk said that the room was a nonsmoking room and asked if I would mind moving to another room. This was a good thing because the room we had at first did not have a closet and was very small. The next room was a bit larger and was very nice. Just as an FYI neither room had a tub so if you are looking to take a bath make sure you ask if there is a tub in your room. We did have a few drinks at the hotel bar which was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Old charm, just like the city ...”
Reviews.Author: ThomasFromBelgium
Reviews.Content: Very nice building in the middle of "The Magnificent Mile" where all the stores are. Chicago is an older city (Al Capone lived there :-)) with a lot of not that skyhigh brick buildings. Not the average American city of concrete. This old charm you can find in a lot of buildings, including in the Allerton. The Allerton has an income hall at grond level, the only thing to see is the elevater to the lobby at the 3-th floor. Lobby is small and cosy. Staff is friendly and helpful. I stayed on the 24-th floor. Rather small corridors, room is clean and well equiped but small according to US norms. I had little storage space in the closet. Bathroom was clean but dated from Al Capones youth. Good housekeeping. Nice breakfast, friendly staff. We had a meeting in the ballroom. Technical support and equipment was more than average. Very good place to stay for work.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, crappy deal...”
Reviews.Author: LMAH12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allerton for 2 nights last weekend. I booked a deal off of RueLala for $129/night for a King room which included free wi-fi, 2 complementary drinks per night and "continental breakfast for 2 (up to a $30 value)" each day. The rate was a little higher than I had hoped for, but I figured since we were getting $30 worth of breakfast per day, I'd do it. Well, first of all- we only got 1 breakfast ticket (instead of 2). Then, when we go downstairs the waitress wasn't certain about the terms of the deal and had to go ask, which took 10+ minutes. Then we find out that this $30 worth of breakfast ($15 for each person), is only for the cold buffet. If we wanted to upgrade to the hot buffet we'd have to pay an extra $7-8 each. And this card wasn't good toward food on their actual menu. I was very hungry so I decided to just deal with the free breakfast. Lo and behold, this consisted of 3 cereal selections, lukewarm milk, sub-par croissants and muffins, picked-over fruit salad (only honeydew left) and apples, banana or oranges. It sucked. Biggest rip-off ever. Before I booked, I tried calling the reservations department to ask about the terms of this free breakfast and no one was able to answer my question. It's my own fault for booking, but had I know the breakfast was so crappy I wouldn't have booked. That would have worked to my advantage because the next week I saw a similar deal for the Allerton on Groupon without breakfast or drinks for $99. I sadly couldn't exchange. Oh well. The hotel itself was nice though. Beautiful room and bathroom, comfortable beds. The people that worked there were very nice, as well. We came to check in before 3, expecting to have to check our bags but they were able to give us a room immediately, which was great. Also, it's only a short walk to the Chicago Red subway stop. Very good location. The only other complaints I have are that the elevators are horrible. There were 5 available and were very small. We stayed on the 21st floor and every time we took the elevator it took a long time to get to us. It also felt like we stopped on every other floor to pick up people on the way down. It got to the point that there was no more room for people on the elevators below the 12th floor or so. So if you get a room that isn't on the top of the hotel you were sheet out of luck. The bathroom was beautiful, all marble- but it was constantly freezing in there- even if we left the door open. It was uncomfortable going barefoot in there. Also, we checked our bags on the ground floor the day we were supposed to check out, since our flight didn't leave until 7. We had to wait about 20 minutes to get our bags. Luckily, we had some time to kill, but if we were trying to get out of there in a hurry it would have been a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but very small”
Reviews.Author: Ontarioannie
Reviews.Content: Located on North Michigan Avenue the hotel is in a great location on the Magnificent Mile. The rooms are clean but very small. The bed dipped in the middle and was very squeaky. The room did not have a coffee maker or a fridge, however, our view was of Michigan Avenue was impressive. The elevators are small and VERY slow. Having said these things, the price was right - our rate was reasonable for a room in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November, 2011 and were not disappointed. The hotel ran a special rate that was significantly less than other Magnificent Mile hotels and it was as nice as any hotel you'll find. The staff was attentive, the hotel was very clean and nicely decorated. The location can't be beat. Right in the middle of the Magnificent mile, it was a short walk to shops, restaurants, and the Hancock building. If the price is right, jump on any deal you see offered by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden costs & slow”
Reviews.Author: etaylorlaw
Reviews.Content: We were just here for 3 days this past weekend using our Groupon. The room was small, not much room for 2 people, but overall clean and comfy. We have a couple small complaints but a huge issue with the refrigerator in the room, that had drinks pre-stocked in it. 1.) It took too long to get the bill for breakfast, even though it was a buffet. We ate breakfast all 3 days we were there. We were never given a bill at the table, though we waited with empty plates and coffee cups for 5 to 10 minutes each day. We had to go to the hostess station after breakfast and request our bill and wait another 5 minutes to get the bill from the server. 2.) Upon check out, the man helping me at the desk got as far as getting my name and room number, and then took a call that lasted at least 5 minutes. What was more frustrating that that was he could not do 2 things at once. The caller was asking general information but the desk clerk could not even pull my room info up while he was on the phone. In the meantime, a long line of people began forming behind me, waiting to check out. 3.) The Groupon included free internet â€“ however they charged me for it. I didnâ€™t notice it at check out (due to the daggers coming from the people in the long line behind me) I had to call back to have it removed. 3.) The whole in-room refrigerator deal was a fiasco and total rip off. Apparently there was a 6x6 note on a fridge that was at knee level on the door stating there is a restocking fee, however we never read the sign because we assumed that it was a price list for the contents inside. We didnâ€™t drink anything, but we did put in our own water. Not until check out were we told that the refrigerator is weight sensitive AND that had we wanted to put our own water in the fridge, we could have called housekeeping to have one brought up to the room (did I mention the room was small? Where would they even put it?) They stated that even though we did not drink anything, there was a $25 restocking fee (everything was in its original place) and will not remove it from my bill. This is totally absurd and these are the types of things that need to be relayed to the guests upon check in and not on a small, knee level note on the fridge door. 4.) The elevators are terribly small. I travel to Chicago a few times of year and I will never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid C”
Reviews.Author: Traveler09
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™d give it a solid C grade. The location canâ€™t be beat, half a block from Michigan Ave, 2 blocks from Water Tower Place, a short cab ride to the loop (or a short bus ride). The room was OK, the beds werenâ€™t super comfortable and the sheets were kind of scratchy. There was a small hole in the wall and the lampshade had a few holes in it. No big deal, except they try to come across as high end. The bathroom is very nice, very pretty. Stay away from the breakfast buffet â€“ the food was bad and it was cold. The eggs were runny and the pancakes were crunchy (and cold, of course). My friend had to ask 3 times before someone brought her a glass of water. TIP: If leaving a bag before getting into your room, check it a the bell desk on the 1st floor. The elevators are slow so you will save time having to backtrack to check them. Later, they brought them up to our room within 10 minutes of checking in. Iâ€™d say if you can get a good price, go for it. If you have to pay full price, stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: We go to Chicago several times a year and like to stay in a different hotel each time for comparison. This was our first time at the Allerton. The doorman who greeted us at our vehicle was very friendly, courteous, and helpful. Very good start in that department. The front desk staff was very professional and allowed us to check in several hours early because they had a room ready for us. We booked our room through Expedia. It was a larger room with a king size bed. The view of Michigan Ave we were supposed to have amounted to a peek hole more or less between two buildings and a fire escape. Oh, well. No big deal.The room appeared clean until I entered the bathroom and noticed a few hairs in the tub and a few more on the floor under the sink. I also noticed right away that there was no bar soap in the bathroom. There was only shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion. There were two bath towels, one hand towel, no washcloths. I am in Chicago among lots of people. After a day of touching door handles, elevator buttons, escalator railings, the hotel TV remote...etc. I want to wash my hands, We called housekeeping to get soap and washcloths. After we left the room someone dropped off two wascloths. Still no soap. I used the shampoo to wash my hands, My husband went down the hall, found a maid and she gave him some soap. Later that evening we pulled the sheets back to see several dark red spots and streaks on the white sheets which appeared to be old dried blood stains. Apparently the hotel laundry process had not been very effective in removing the blood stains. Still, how can a housekeeper put clean sheets on a bed and not notice these obvious stains?? Yuck. It was late, we were exhausted, and not wanting to hassle with waiting for housekeeping again, we pulled the top sheet over the stains and went to bed, So, the hotel itself was nice enough for an older boutique type hotel, which we like,. Staff was friendly, but I would say housekeeping needs to step it up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Good to go!”
Reviews.Author: kalowk
Reviews.Content: The Allerton is a great hotel if you're going to spend most of your time out enjoying the city. The location is PERFECT, and the rooms are comfortable enough. There's relatively few onsite amenities (like a day spa), but there's plenty around the area. We had a few issues with our stay. First, upon arriving at the hotel at 4:30ish, we found our room wasn't ready. Second, we were supposed to receive two glasses of wine with our stay. We were slipped a coupon for these under our door in the middle of the night, which did us no good, because we werent going to start drinking before check out the next morning. (we should have received the coupon at check in.). For both issues the staff was helpful and accommodating. We received a phone call a half hour after arrival that our room was ready, and received a portion off our bill to comp for the wine. In SUMMARY.... PROs: 1) LOCATION 2) kind staff 3) punctual room service 4) quiet, despite downtown setting (not much road noise at all) CONs: 1) room service and parking are horribly expensive. KNOW: 1) the entrance is easy to miss (just east of Michigan Ave) and isn't much to look at. Check in desk is very lack luster, and oppressively warm (by fireplace). 2) rooms are comfortable, but not luxurious. I found the decor a bit odd, but not distracting. Could use some updating. 3) it's a little bit of a walk to the El, but there'll be hundreds of cabs at your disposal. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No need to search any further”
Reviews.Author: Menz75
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Chicago, a little tired and fraught after a frantic few days in New York. Cannot fault this hotel, great room, spankingly clean, good location and friendly and welcoming staff. We are coming back to Chicago and will definitely stay here again. Our stay was during the Chicago marathon and even though the hotel was reasonably full, it was calm, well run and an all round lovely stay. The only thing that we regret is not putting this review on earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too small....”
Reviews.Author: HemlockMan
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the clerk stated we were in the smallest room in the place and said she'd upgrade us, if we didn't mind.. Who could object to such an offer? The new room was small but adequate for our needs.. The staff was always very nice to us from the desk clerks to the doormen and housekeeping. In particular a desk manager listened most attentively that the face-bowl and shower drains were very s-l-o-w and we were in standing water during our shower. As I turned to leave the desk I heard him requesting maintenance call him. We left for the day and all was well on our return. I presume the problem was fixed in a matter of minutes. I was blown away. In most other places this would have only been noted in some work order and passed on as convenient. Here it was priority. When we asked directions it was not a bother. When we asked about leaving our luggage after checking out and catching our train, it was attended to immediately. Here the prevailing attitude seemed to be 'Why not?'. WiFi was included in our package. There normally is a charge and, again, the desk made the needed inquiries and got us on-line. There is coffee on the 2nd floor in the morning. We walked to the attractions we were interested in; Lincoln Park Zoo, Millennium Park, Second City, shopping, Contemporary Art... We will stay at this hotel on our future visits to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT Base Camp for a Few Days Downtown”
Reviews.Author: traliz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allerton for a few days in June as part of a larger train trip and it was the perfect central location. I was able to hop on and off the bus line that runs down Michigan Aveune and easily get to Millenium Park and all the museums in that area. Train stops within a few blocks which allowed easy access to the suburbs and the airport. TONS of restaurants in the area, easy to just walk out the door and explore until you find a good place to eat. I suppose the room was small, but it had a nice big bed and room for my suitcase. Large bathroom as well which is always a plus. Perfect room to use just for sleeping at the end of the day, for people who typically don't spend much time hanging out in their rooms. I didn't dine or drink onsite so I can't speak to that at all. I thought the service was just fine, checking in and out was relatively easy, and the front desk was really helpful with information on public trainsportation. Overall, I think this is a really great hotel for a solo traveler or couple, might be hard for a groups of friends of a family if you aren't booking more than one room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small rooms & bad staff”
Reviews.Author: MLWssm
Reviews.Content: We recently spend a weekend in Chicago at the Allerton Hotel. The location is fantastic, right in the middle of everything (shopping, eating, etc). Unfortuately, the room size was extremely small for the price. Also, the staff was unacceptable on many occasions. For example: It took over 1 hour for them to bring our bags up to us from the lobby after they told us many times when we called that they were "one their way". I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, convenient!”
Reviews.Author: lightinggrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in June - extremely convenient location for short walk to shopping and great dining. Nice view, very good service, and we got a great rate for a downtown hotel. Room was small, but very nicely furnished with modern decor, and plenty of room for a single business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and clean, excellent location - great value.”
Reviews.Author: IAmDoraExplora
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very charming and pleasant. I consider myself to be a realistic traveler, and for the location on Michigan avenue, the price (through SniqueAway) was spectacular. The room we stayed in was a "standard" and was quite small. That said, this is a historic property, and travelers expected smaller rooms when this hotel was built. The room was very cozy and clean, and we lucked out and got a spectacular view (probably by chance...). The bed was very comfortable as well. I was impressed with the staff, who went out of their way to be polite and curteous (we got a nice "good morning" with a smile from the housekeeping staff each morning). If hotel management is reading this, kudos to your staff on the 21st floor 11/20-11/22/11, they deserve it. The hotel elevators are tiny and slow, but only reflect the age of the property. I do not recall having to wait very long, though I expected to, so maybe the hotel wasn't full? The location is fantastic for shopping or sightseeing, and is close to the subway and bus lines. A short walk to the EL also. I imagine it would be comfortable walking distance to Navy Pier as well. I would definately recommend this hotel to my friends, value and location are standouts!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, romantic but not very kid friendly.”
Reviews.Author: mrscatalano
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best location you can find for Chicago..it is actually next to the best shopping venues..we had water tower a couple of mins away, american girl place, tourist information board, museum of contemporary art etc but the room we got (through sinque away) was actually facing a brick wall and was tiny! the hotel is designed beautifully and the staff were very professional, but it was difficult to handle the children, especially since the elevators were always busy and the prices at the hotel itself were really high! a cup of tea and biscuits came to to over 20 dollars.. there is free coffee on the reception floor and people even came in pyjamas to get it because i suspect nobody could afford hotel breakfast! but there are so many places to eat within 5 mins of the hotel that this didn't matter. i would definitely come again as a couple without small children to constantly "shush"

Reviews.Title: “Vintage, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: burgesslake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allerton for a Girls' Shopping Weekend. There were two of us, and we got a queen-sized room. The view was over Michigan Ave. The room was small, like I had read online here, and older, but it was clean, well-appointed, and the location was fabulous for our shopping trip. Load up on packages on Michigan Ave, then drop them off at the hotel, before heading out again. The bell staff was great, very friendly. The elevators were slower than most people are used to in a big city, but not so bad for anyone from a small town. There were times it took a while to get up to our room on the 22nd floor, but we met a lot of nice people. We were up and down the elevators MANY times, and it was fine. The 22nd floor was really WARM in the hallways because of the heating system, but we were able to keep the room at a comfortable temperature. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Allerton not so great for the money”
Reviews.Author: kimdurst
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, clean, friendly, but 100 bucks to park for two days, rooms are extremely small, we didn't feel we got our moneys worth at all. We won't stay again. Paid over 500 for 2 nights plus parking.......yikes

Reviews.Title: “Hip vibe, though small”
Reviews.Author: globetrekr
Reviews.Content: The room was a lot smaller than expected so felt a bit cramped. The 2 beds were really just full sized beds. Although the beds were comfortable, it looked like it sagged in the middle which is not a good thing. We thought they would be queen size beds. Nice bathroom amenities. Good location on the Miracle Mile. Overall, nicely decorated with a hip vibe. It's several blocks from the train station so no need to take an expensive cab ride from O'hare. Only about $2.50 on the CTA.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: catherinejoywilson
Reviews.Content: We visited in April and although the room we had was a touch smaller than we might have hoped it was a beautiful hotel and the service was excellent. I thoroughly enjoyed my time in Chicago and the hotel was a great base. It was a REALLY good price and a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: MileyandFofo
Reviews.Content: I suprised my wife with an anniversary trip to Chicago and wanted a hotel in a great location at a great price (419 with all taxes and fees for two nights). The Allerton hit the mark. The hotel is located on the Mag Mile. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Water Tower Place was a 5 minute walk. There was a Walgreens two blocks away which was convenient for picking up water and snacks before hitting the city every day. The room served it purpose. It was clean and comfortable. The water pressure and hot water were perfect. I wish it would have had a fridge. There was a mini bar, but we didn't use it. My only complaint was when we arrived at 4:00 to check in, our room was not ready. The hotel was a host hotel for the Chicago Marathon, so they were quite busy. We were able to drop our bags off at the concierge.They had a room ready for us at 5:30 and gave us a queen bed upgrade. We did not eat or visit the hotel restaurants with so many other options. I would definitely stay at the Allerton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, though rooms are small.”
Reviews.Author: Wandrew
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed here while attending a trade show in Chicago. The hotel is very nice and the location is perfect for Michigan Ave restaurants and shops. Every staff member was pleasant and professional. They morning buffet breakfast was perfect. On the downside, in-room internet is an up-charge (however the nice desk lady comp'd it for us) and the basic rooms, while swanky, are very small. The "Petite Classic" room is fine for a single traveler - but I wouldn't want to have a family of four in there. However, this is a boutique hotel in a historic building so small rooms were not a surprise. I would stay again on business.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, excellent service, perfect location... what else do you need?”
Reviews.Author: Kelly3475
Reviews.Content: I had a quit trip to Chicago, and decided to try a hotel I have heard about, but never had an opportunity to visit: The Allerton Hotel. What a great decision I made. My first impression was that the hotel staff was there to make my life easier. I was greated at my cab and the service was top notch from then on. There was a long line for check in, but instead of making people wait, additional staff came to help (LOVED THIS). Before bringing my bags up, they called to make sure it was a "good time for me".... a simple task, but was appreciated. From directions from the bellman, to service at the lounge, it was one of the best experiences of service I have had. Oh, and by the way, the rooms are beautifully decorated, cozy and had everything I needed. No need to mention that its a great location. I love staying at a hotel where I can walk everywhere, I only needed a cab to get me back to the airport. For work travel or leisure, this place makes travel easy and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: shwanee
Reviews.Content: Great location in the northern end of Michigan Avenue. We chose the Allerton because of a previous good experience. This time, very disappointing: Entrance is small but cozy. This is a classic older "vintage" hotel so there are some things that deserve grace. Here are specifics: Reception - good, attentive, quick Elevators: VERY inefficient, bring a book or a scarf to knit, you will need something to do as you wait. They are extremely small so if your group is larger than 5 or more than a carry-on luggage you will need two. Hallways: carpets need replacing - old, stained, dingy. Understand the vintage decor, but the carpeting still needs updating. Room: We were given the guest room of a suite. Way to small for our foursome. We shimmied our way around the luggage and packages all weekend. No closet, no coffee-maker, no iron or board - very annoying to be so cramped. Beds were comfortable, room temp good. The view of the alley was disappointing and the dumpster noice and talking in the alley all night long was terrible. The windows are so thing it seemed like they were open. The sirens from emergency vehicles drowned out the dumpter sounds. Bathroom: Amazing how a architect could accurately design the door to be about 1/16 of an inch from the basin countertop! I've never seen such precision! SMALL. An overweight person would have trouble getting in that bathroom - seriously.
