The shower was roomy, clean, immediate hot water, nice big shower head and good pressure. Towels were old/used. Restaurant: They only serve breakfast and lunch - plan ahead to make reservations somewhere else. Breakfast menu was good. We had the buffet - eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes, oatmeal, variety of cereals, nice variety of fresh fruit medley, bananas, apples, oranges. JUice, coffee and feshly made toast included. Cost ~ $15. Servers were excellent - very attentive. Overall impression: a 2 out of a 1-5 scale with 5 being best. Some things a 1. I would stay somewhere else. Stay one or two blocks off Michigan in a better hotel and for less. Value - 1 out of 5. For $300 we should have requested another room.

Reviews.Title: “Small room - but lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: bradbel
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap (but classy) place to stay while in Chicago. While some might be taken aback by the size of some rooms (like the ones reserved at a very low price) the quality of room is very high. I have a video on my review here-->http://youtu.be/5vGtEUet3fg

Reviews.Title: “Chicago stopover”
Reviews.Author: PKn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days recently, good room, shame about the view which was a brick wall, very depressing. Hoped to eat there one night but the restaurant was closed & there are not many decent restaurants within walking distance, we only found a couple. A good meal in house would have made all the difference. Staff were very helpful & attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: NBHabsfan
Reviews.Content: Realized when the cab from the airport dropped me off that I'd stayed here 15 years or so ago, but had forgotten the name. It's an on older place with the smallest elevators I've seen in a hotel (but they have 5 or 6 of 'em I think). My room apparently was bigger than those of my colleagues, but the bathroom was very small. When sitting on the toilet, I leaned against the shower door, & if I was a big guy, I may have had to be wedged onto the seat. No tub, just a glassed in shower stall, but much more then adequate for me. There was an in room safe, & was quiet although I'd also heard from colleagues that they could hear everything in thier neighbours bathrooms when they were in their own, I was OK, in my room, I heard nothing. Bed at first looked like it was going to be disapointing but turned out to be quite comfortable. Complimentary coffee available in the reception area in the morning (although ran out of "buzz" one morning. Only 1 door away from Michigan Ave is what this place is all about, location, location, location. I'll stay here again now that I remember the name.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CoryJones
Reviews.Content: The Allerton Hotel's location it's best asset. The hotel itself has a certain charm that comes from it's age but it's age also creates some issues. The rooms are very small. Most of the new hotels of the same price range have much larger rooms. Although they are small the rooms are nice. The beds was very comfortable and the room was clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Would I recommend the Allerton, yes. Would I stay here again, yes. But again it's simply for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Monica F
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in mid-October while attending a conference at Northwestern Medical Center. The magnificent mile location was great for the conference and shopping, plus easily accessible to other attractions and great restaurants. I was surprised by how large the hotel was thinking it was more of a small boutique hotel. Our first room was kind of small, as a number of other reviews have mentioned. It was nicely decorated and certainly adequate. It probably helped that I was prepared for this as well as the small elevators that we sometimes had to wait for. But we never waited more than 2-3 minutes. Both seemed like reasonable trade-offs for a modernized hotel that kept a lot of the original charm of the building. After a wedding party and guests checked out, we were able to upgrade to a HUGE room! The bedroom area was probably about the size of the original room we had. The bathroom was larger and there was a separate lounge area with two comfortable chairs and a second TV. Given the size of the room, comfort, decor and great location, we thought it was well worth the roughly $300 a night, including taxes, to stay there. Particularly since it was work related and reimbursable!

Reviews.Title: “Old style Europeanesque”
Reviews.Author: Gee557
Reviews.Content: The Allerton is in a great location. Parking is super expensive. Great Restaurants nearby although not in the hotel. If you fancy old style European hotels--ie somewhat dated tiny rooms with minute bathrooms and tiny elevators, then you will love the Allerton. If you don't you won't. Simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: asuleyma
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay at this superior hotel in Chicago. Everything was nearby and we walked. Rooms are clean and nice decorated and furnished. 50" LCD on the wall with lots of TV channels. Great location. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “On the MAG mile”
Reviews.Author: kataTexas
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location if you want to be on the magnificent mile for shopping; several great resturants close by like the Purple Pig, Bandera, and a close Irish pub on the corner to the left (can't remember the name, sorry).....I usually stay at the Congress Plaza Hotel but it's far from the Mag mile and was very pleasantly suprised how nice this hotel was; beds were very comfy, bar and breakfast great in hotel, entrance staff always smiled and helpful !! It is also only about 3 blocks to the L-train so easy to get to; Hancock towers only 4 blocks away! by the way, the little la appetito coffee/lunch resturant is fantastic!! and great wines too! I go to Chicago alot and will definately stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad accommodations, even worse service”
Reviews.Author: jpmerk7
Reviews.Content: I am not one to complain, and rarely do I voice my opinions on forums such as these, but the Allerton fell way below expectations. We were thrown into a "petite" room, which resembled more of a college dormitory than a hotel room that boasts 4 stars on travel websites. The bed was awful...one of the worst night's sleeps I've had in a while. Customer service was horrible and it's as though the staff view customers as numbers - they didn't even manage to ask how my stay was at the end. On top of it all, the Allerton probably has the slowest elevators I've ever experienced, not to mention they were incredibly small so at times our wait to even be able to fit in an elevator took nearly 10 minutes. I will NOT stay here again nor would I recommend this hotel to any type of traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ravi F
Reviews.Content: Just arriving from Europe we thought the Allerton Hotel was an incredibly high building, untill we were on the Sears Tower and we saw deep down among all kind of much higher buildings our hotel! When we arrived from the airport after a long journey at around 18.00, our rooms were not yet available, so we had to wait some time in the (beautiful) lounge where they offered us a drink from the hotel. The room was nice, not big, but with 2 big beds which was great. The hotel itself is very big, but (although renovated) it has a nice 1920/1930 style. But (very modern!) with an iPod dockstation in the room, so we could listen to Frank Sinatra's "Chicago, Chicago". You have to go to the Tip Top Tap ballroom (only the name made me go up to see what this was) and enjoy the magnificent view! The location is great, right in the centre of town. By the way, the second day we tried to have breakfast (which was not included in our price) in the hotel, it was not cheap, but what a luxurious breakfast! We could walk all day on that!

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious Customer Service, Cramped Loud Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pam O
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel experiences in the past few years. The staff of this aging smelly hotel is completely unhelpful. I stood in front of the hostess desk for 10 minutes before the reception staff finally spoke up. Apparently, even though a patron was seated, the restaurant closes early (before 6:30 pm!!). I was told to go to the lounge (ie. Bar) that was packed to capacity. At checkin I stood in front of one set of elevators for what seemed like forever before realizing I needed a different set. There was no sign and the reception desk staff said nothing during the entire wait. My room smelled musty and like someone had been smoking in the room. Strange since it is a no smoking hotel. The walls are paper thin and you can hear the water running in the neighbors room, doors closing and just about anything going on. Room service got my order wrong. Elevators take forever. I rarely take the time to put in a review, but patrons who shell out almost $200/night should be aware of what they are getting. Will make sure I stay elsewhere during my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mercedesEpping_Essex
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very well situated on the Magnificent Mile. The room offered to us was very small and we upgraded for $20 per night. Whilst there I left a jacket in the business suite. I have to say that the desk staff were not very helpful and when I asked for a 2nd check to be made to see if it had been handed in the girl shrugged her shoulders and said she had done all she could!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service needs work...”
Reviews.Author: Megan T
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Chicago last minute and were only going to be in town for less than 48 hours. The two hotels we usually stay at in the city were fully booked and we were referred by a friend to stay at the Allerton Hotel. They spoke great things about their recent stay so we thought we would have nothing to worry about. They must have stayed when this hotel was having a good week. Check - in was a breeze and the easiest part of our stay here. The female at the desk was nice and accommodating considering the line of guests she was trying to get through. It then went downhill from here. We arrived in our room to unpack and get ready for the dinner reservations we had at a prime steakhouse that is almost next to impossible to get when we found that the shower was not functioning properly. A pipe above the shower head was spraying water all over the entire bathroom when we attempted to turn the shower on. We called maintenance and they arrived within 5 minutes, just like they quoted us. They were polite and apologetic and determined to fix the shower so that we could continue on with our evening. One hour later, shower still broken, the front desk called up and asked us if the issue had been resolved. My Husband explained what was going on and all the operator said was OK. She did not even mention the possibility of switching rooms. In the meantime I was able to go online to see if there were other rooms available and found that the Allerton was booked solid for the entire weekend. We remained patient in hopes that the shower would be fixed and we would still make it to dinner on time. Now yes, we could have just changed and gone to dinner without a shower but A.)Who is comfortable after 8 hours of travel? B.) How could that be done with 3 maintenance men coming and going in and out of your room? After two hours of this, one of the maintenance men asked if we would like to have our rooms switched. We did not think this was an option since the front desk never mentioned it and the hotel was booked. Of course we said yes, and the maintenance man went down to the desk to have our room switched. Take note - the best service came from the 3 men working on our shower, NOT from anyone else working in the hotel. If you are wondering if we made our dinner reservation I can tell you we did not. And we could not even get in the following evening either. This was a huge disappointment for my Husband who talks about this steakhouse like none other exist. Upon checking out the following day we voiced our concern to the front desk. The gentleman that checked us out was of no help whatsoever. He stared at my Husband like he had two heads and his solution was he would have one of the two managers call us when they came in at 8am. Eight more long hours of travel home and we never received a phone call. Once home, my Husband called the hotel back to speak to a manager. After nine minutes on hold (nine minutes is a long time) he was connected and then disconnected. After another follow up call he was then connected to the manager on duty. The manager expressed his apologies and offered to give us a credit, on the first night cost of the room. A credit? Yes, a credit that was not even half the cost of the first night stay. He also offered to "put us up" the next time we visited Chicago but never offered to take our information in order to follow through with this offer. In the end, my Husband and I will never stay with The Allerton Hotel again, which is a shame since it is centrally located on N Michigan Ave and a short walk to pretty much everywhere. When we come to Chicago we only stay for a short amount of time so we do not think it is too much to ask that we enjoy that short amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel .”
Reviews.Author: Lesley Y
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a family of three, for 4 nights.. I had the single room which was excellent plenty of room and very comfortable. My son and his girlfriend shared, their room was very small compared to mine. The Hotel was very clean and inviting, staff very helpful. The hotel is in a fantasic location, we couldnt of wished for anything better, everything was in walking distance . We would definitely stay at the Allerton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_An
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights and appreciated the central location for ease of getting to work appointments. The king room was good - bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large with marble tiles and a bath. There are no tea-coffee making facilities in the room, which was missed, and you aren't 'allowed' to use the in-room fridge to store your own supplies. The room service/restaurant food was OK and most of the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable\Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: ahills11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in July 2011. The Allerton is in a super location within walking distance of EVERYTHING! I was able to take the subway from the airport into downtown and walk a few blocks to the hotel. Great staff and comfortable, clean rooms for a great price. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Tobyyy
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this property for 5 nights. While some of the rooms are indeed small, ours had a convienient since. The room was in a very good condition and had a fantastic view on Michigan Avenue along with Trump Tower. The hotel's location is more than excellent, it is right on Michigan Avenue and only a few blocks from the closest metro station. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful assisting us with our travel plans and all other kinds of questions. There is free coffee in the morning and lemonade in the afternoon in the lobby (on 2nd level). You can also print your boarding passes for free if you are travelling by airplane. Internet in the hotel room was available for a charge. I would definitely recommend this hotel for everybody who wants to stay in the heart of downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: adrianamh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Allerton the last week of Sep 2011. We were in Chicago for 4 days on a mini vacation. We stayed in a room with a queen-sized bed. This hotel has a great location, right on N Michigan Ave in the heart of all the Mag Mile shops. It is about 2 blocks away from an L station (Chicago) which makes it easy to get to from Midway (where we flew into). The staff was very friendly as well. I've read some reviews that said the room is small but honestly, we had more than enough room for the 2 of us to get ready in the morning. The room fan was a little noisy at times, but the bed was comfortable and we didn't hear a thing from the outside world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: LordPocho
Reviews.Content: The general look of the hotel is quite nice. What I didn't like is that the room was very small, it didn't even have drawers to put the clothes in. On the other hand both room and bathroom were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: wetravelalot4fun
Reviews.Content: I was on the 18th floor of this hotel facing the magnificient mile. The hotel is in an absolute perfect location. Not much view as there are lots of tall buildings all around. A few things I didn't like about the hotel: The hotel is very close to a major hospital. Lots of ambulances go by with sirens blasting. Also lots of horns honking given the traffic. Even on the 18th floor the room was noisy because of street noise. The room is very small. The bathroom is super small. The bathroom had a shower, toilet and sink, and not much more. If I had to guesstimate the size of the bathroom it would be 5 X 5. If you are sharing the washroom, no chance. I also found housekeeping to not be to detailed...some days no replacements of coffee cups, missed spots on vacuuming, etc. The room is modern and bright. Inviting and comfortable. I got charged for parking, but didn't even have a car. Got that taken off bill, but stuff like that shouldn't happen. Also we had comp wifi as part of our package, but we had to ask for this and not given details of how we would access. Front desk was inconsistent in terms of service. I had a drink at M? bar....it was ok. Also had some apps in the same bar and those were ok as well. Lots of great deep dish pizza nearby. My fav was Giordanno's...... P.S. There is no pool at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: QUIZZER01
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5day visit to chicago,stayed at the Allerton Hotel,its very central for shopping and sight seeing,staff friendly and helpful.We got upgraded to a suite as we wanted to be near our friends,at no extra cost.Only downside,the lifts are really,really slow.We were on 15th floor,and most days had to wait at least 5mins for a lift. would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service was poor and the hotel is showing it's age.”
Reviews.Author: ADwerker
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago 2 or 3 times a year... On a recent 5day/4 night visit to Chicago I stayed at the Allerton for my first time. What struck me immediately was that the doorman was more concerned with directing traffic than helping us out of the car and into the hotel. It turns out that was the kind of service we would get throughout our stay. Here are a few of the problems. The elevators are very small and very slow. When the hotel is full allow 10 minutes to get from the 20th floor to the ground. At breakfast in the restaurant the server offered menus but kept suggesting the buffet until we gave in. On another morning, room service was slow, they told me 30 minutes and it took more than 45. Twice we had to ask for more towels. We never had more than 1 bar of soap. No newspapers are available in the hotel. They really just failed at all of the little things. The bartender was very good, but he couldn't make up for the rest of the staff. The first time I was told "Thanks for staying with us" was when the doorman put me in a cab on the way to airport. This will be my last stay at the Allerton.

Reviews.Title: “1-2 star experience at a 4 star price”
Reviews.Author: Tripelocity
Reviews.Content: The Elevators in this hotel made the entire stay miserable. They are old and incredibly slow. This may not seem important but when you are visiting for a night or two and spend literally 10 minutes waiting for an elevator, and another 10 minutes getting from the 20th floor to the ground, that's 15-20 minutes per ride or 30-45 per round trip- a complete waste of time. The benefit of this hotel is the location which is negated by the elevator issue. All of the guests complained about the same thing. The room was old and the decorating all different styles that didn't seem to match. The staff was ok but not overly helpful- not what you'd expect for a hotel this price. We left and went the James which was the same price for an amazing experience. Avoid the Allerton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great for meetings...”
Reviews.Author: LibraryHRGuy
Reviews.Content: I checked out this morning after a 3 night stay at the Allerton. I was there for an annual meeting of a nonprofit organization that I'm associated with. Last year I was here for the same meeting at the Allerton. I have to give the Allerton high marks for both stays. The room I stayed in this year was a king bed room and it was spacious with a good closet. The bath was compact, but with a very nice walk-in shower. The room was very clean and the bathroom was spotless. As someone in the hotel for meetings, I have to say the meeting rooms on the 23rd floor of the hotel are just amazing. The bright modern decor of these rooms in this lovely vintage building is great, but the views from the enormous windows easily surpass the decor. I don't know anything about booking space in a hotel for conference meetings, but for the conference planners out there, I have to say these are the nicest meeting rooms I've ever seen. Even in a lot of high-end hotels where I've attended meetings, the meeting rooms are usually windowless and sometimes in the basement. It was wonderful to spend two and a half days in meetings here enjoying the stunning views. Actually, my favorite hotel in Chicago is the Sofitel Water Tower, but I've really enjoyed my stays at the Allerton. I think the staff is one of the Allerton's great assets. The staff at the front desk, in the restaurant, and in the lounge were all very friendly and welcoming. One night during my stay I had dinner in the lounge. Mark, the barman and server, was very professional and gracious. During check-in and check-out the staff at the desk were very nice and helpful. The staff at the Allerton really seem to get the customer service thing. My one negative comment is about the wireless internet service in the rooms. Downloads were very slow at times and there were constant breaks in the connection. Like far too many hotels, the Allerton is charging premium prices for daily internet service and it's not nearly good enough service to justify the charges. The $!4.95 per day charge is the equivalent of almost $5,500 annually. For a hell of a lot less than that I have much better, much faster wireless internet service in my home. The Allerton, like a lot's of other hotels, need to do much better on this issue. For $14.95 per day, the hotel should be using a provider that supplies super fast, super reliable internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location outweighs downsides”
Reviews.Author: Laurie_B_VA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allerton in Chicago last week, and while I was neutral about the sheer functionality of the motor lobby and check-in area, I was cheered by the lemonade and coffee by the concierage. In addition, not only do they have a machine to do check-in and boarding passes, they have a full departure board (like in the airport) in the lobby so you can see your flight status before leaving the hotel. And, you don't want to leave this part of Chicago early. The magnificent mile and restaurants and sightseeing are literally right there. The Allerton is really at the heart of the shopping district (Near Northside) and just by the Gold Coast. I shopped every evening and jogged by the lake front every morning. And these were good pursuits b/c the fitness room was a bit spartan and my room a bit dreary and dark--both functional but not pleasant necessarily. All of this said, for the price and location, I would probably stay there again. Who needs to be in their room in this fabulous location?!

Reviews.Title: “A great time at the Allerton”
Reviews.Author: pkbnatl
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Allerton Hotel. Its location is great! The hotel was most enjoyable. We especially enjoyed the bar area. We were there for three nights and started each evening by having drinks in the bar. While the drinks are not the least expensive, they are quite good. The bartender (Mark) is great! The room we had was also quite nice. The Allerton is just steps away from the Magnificent Mile for easy access to shopping and dining. It's also within walking distance to Navy Pier. We'd definitely return on the next trip to Chicago. Would recommend it for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Emma T
Reviews.Content: Huge room, great location and friendly service! The price was the icing on the cake....we stayed in a 2 room suite for $99 per night the week after Christmas. It is just for sleeping however, they don't have a pool, restaurant or the any of the little extra's the larger hotels have. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic situation”
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel, ideal for shopping and tourism, just off Michigan ave the main street in Chicago. Bout 40 mins from airport but traffic always bad. Rooms are small and cosy, nice decor. tea and coffee. wifi. Flatscreen teles, iron/ ironing board, staff are pleasant, breakfast is standard US buffet. Nice hotel Lifts can be slow

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MNGreen_Pea
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, rooms were very nice, clean and quiet. So many things within walking distance and if we needed a taxi or directions the doormen were very polite and very friendly and most helpful! The subway is also very close if you want to take that to Wrigley field instead of taking a cab since traffic gets very congested around the fields.

Reviews.Title: “Celebration - The big one!”
Reviews.Author: Alohatexas240
Reviews.Content: My first trip there to celebrate turning 50. My sister recommended this slightly boutique-y hotel. Beautifully appointed. Rooms were small, mine was upgraded to a suite so I definitely made out. My sister did not. They kinda got weird with the crown moldings but really a pretty hotel. Very chic. The bar was pricey but in line with neighborhood offerings. Free coffee in lobby in am. Really a fun trip, easy with Shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal on the Magnificent Mile!”
Reviews.Author: Keven919
Reviews.Content: The location was the best part of this hotel. Right across from the Water Tower and within walking distance to the subway and many attractions. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It was easy to find a good rate (I think we got ours from TravelZoo). We avoided the â€œextrasâ€� like the mini fridge, internet, and parking as they were extremely overpriced. Traveled with my wife and toddler, and we were all accommodated nicely.

Reviews.Title: “DEATHLY afraid, then pleasant surprised”
Reviews.Author: jarhung
Reviews.Content: Note: You must upgrade the room ($15 to queen, $20 to king, $35 to king w junior) if you do not want to stay in a box. A tiny box. That's why I think these reviews are so varied. I was afraid b/c of the reviews and the old look of the outside of the hotel. But inside it's been recently renovated and everything looks new and nice. It may not have all the poshness of a W Hotel, but I found it still pretty modern inside. Downsides: *You must pay for wifi $10 in room (free wifi on their lobby floor tho). * Parking fee is ridiculous (but I didn't drive, so no matter). * You must upgrade and increase your avg expected cost if you want a nicer room * TV too small - and far away from bed. If you plan on staying in and channel surfing, in the King room it's so far away and small from the bed that you won't see anything. * Your experience may vary greatly depending on your room (that's just my guess). * No rooftop bar or pool that other hotels might have. Upsides: * Prime location to magnificent mile * Excellent service. Even when their room service was closed late, they had a partner pizza place that delivered late late. * Nice modern rooms. All in all, I'd definitely recommend staying here if you want a nice room, clean hotel, and don't need the bumpin hotel or rooftop bars that you'd get at your Peninsulas or W hotels. Thanks hotwire. This is indeed a 4-star (IF you upgrade - and aren't staying in a coffin).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Great rooms. Great room service. Great location. Great staff. Stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value would recommend”
Reviews.Author: nivramkoorb
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a great value. The weekend rate was $150 + 16% tax and only $104 during the week. Not sure if this was the normal rate. We were on Michigan avenue and a block away from the Hancock building and right in the middle of everything. The room was large and we were able to get a refrigerator for the week for an extra $25. The staff was friendly, they had free coffee, andn access to a computer(internet and printer) in the business center. The also had a airline system that listing the daily flights from O'hare and Midway. It allowed you to print out your boarding passes. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Katherine--xxxx
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for 3 nights last year, we got a really good deal through a price comparison website. The hotel in situated on the magnificant mile, which is an ideal location- so close to everything! The hotel is very modern and beautifully decorated inside, staff are also very helpful. We stayed in the petite room as it was cheaper, yes it was small, but totally fine! Although we didnt dine in the hotel restaurant, it looked very nice! Overall this hotel is well worth a visit, especially if you can get it at a discounted rate like us!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Excelent location.”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas S
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 2 times and both of them was excelent. The rooms are cleans and it has everything as a good hotel should have. The location is perfect, its over Michigan Av. The only thing i didnt like it was the small windows all over the hotel: in the room and over the lobby. Thats why is a little bit dark, but its ok. I would came back.

Reviews.Title: “A great value, great staff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: khot
Reviews.Content: Ugh, I was so disappointed after getting this hotel through Priceline and reading the lukewarm reviews. I was scared of what we would find when arriving. (This is a 3 1/2 star property on Priceline in the North Michigan Avenue area). I was not thrilled about not having a car and being stuck at a potentially dumpy hotel. But,...after spending the weekend here, me and my girlfriend couldn't be much happier about our stay. We got a great rate for a nice, clean, updated hotel room in a fabulous location. The rooms, yeah, they're kinda small, but it is a boutique hotel that has been renovated. I was also worried about the elevators that people had complained about - really very few issues there. It was a very busy time when we checked in, but Alesia (sp?) was wonderful - patiently answered all of our questions. In fact, at the end of our weekend we discussed how all of the many staff we had come into contact with were really pleasant and genuinely friendly. We are picky girls and there just wasn't much to complain about. I liked the modern decor, comfortable beds and nice flat tv. Minor complaints would be - not a great view, no fridge, not a lot of place to put your toiletries in the shower, but these were very minor obstacles and our room was perfect for the two of us. I've stayed in the cheapest hotels to the most expensive and I would stay at the Allerton again in a heartbeat. Giordano's is literally a block away - within walking distance from Sprinkle's cupcakes, a popcorn place with a line out the door (didn't make it there), Forever 21, Macy's, H&M, and probably a ton of stuff we didn't have time for. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: pagWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: My friend's relative highly recommended this hotel as a good choice to stay for our visit to Chicago- We booked our reservations and asked for a double room. I remember the reservation person was extremely helpful. We used our AAA discount and got what we felt was a good rate. I read some on line reviews about the rooms/bathrooms being very small but because we were sharing a room and got 2 double beds we found the room more than adequate for our needs- Yes, they are on the small side- like in europe- but since we hardly spent any time in the room it was not a problem. More importantly, the rooms seemed to be newly renovated - spotless- with very comfortable beds- Our bathroom had a large shower and a shelf above the sink which was fine for handling a few items- toothbrushes, etc.- Being women we needed some extra space for our sundries- so we put those items on the desk- located right outside the bathroom- so it was not a hassle- We weren't using the desk so it served a good purpose. We did feel it would have been better if we had some drawers to put our clothes away but we kept our suticases (small) on top of the 2 radiators in the room and made due- Our other clothes went into the closet- We requested a guiet room and got one- We didn't care about the view- more important for us not to be woken up by street noise since the hotel is in a great location next to Michigan Avenue- The main street- The one thing we did notice was that it seems the carpet in the hallways needs some TLC but that might be the next project on the list- We liked that the Allerton was not a big overwhelming hotel- as I said- it had more of a european flavor- so we enjoyed that- The Lobby where you register is near the dining room the decor was modern but somehow also has an "old world feel"- The staff was terrific- Very helpful- We ate breakfast out every day but our last day we had a wonderful full buffet breakfast for about $14 each at the hotel- That also included unlimited juice, coffee,tea -which made it quite a deal- We also want to note that the concierge who helped us that week- Mr. Bouchaib Oumelaz was terrific- Very knowledgeable and extremely patient- He even made sure to get us our boarding passes for SW airlines while we were out for the day- He really helped make our visit to Chicago a success!!!!!! So- as long as you are not looking for a big room and are satisfied with a cozy , modern, charming hotel- I think you will be fine with the Allerton- We really enjoyed it- but we really only used it as a place to come back after dinner- go to sleep- comfortably- wake up and leave for the day!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Choice !”
Reviews.Author: thevacationlovers
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel but quite elegant for the price! It is perfectly located at the top of Magnificent Mile (next door to Neiman Marcus, the Apple Store and almost across the street from Tiffanys) and the room is comfortable and well maintained. We enjoyed a nice breakfast buffet in the lobby restaurant and the free coffee until 11 am each morning. The hotel does not have a spa or a pool but the beach is only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. All employees were extremely polite and served us well. Give the Allerton a try the next time you visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: jajbrown40
Reviews.Content: I must preface this review by acknowledging we reserved our room on Hotwire. However, it was disturbing to walk into a room the size of our walk - in closet, and see a "petite double" bed, that was supposed to sleep two of us. When I called the front desk to ask if there was anything else available, she rudely stated this was the only room available. (On a Thursday night - haha.) The room was extremely tiny, had a small desk and desk chair, with a flat screen tv mounted on the wall above the desk. I haven't been in a room for years that did not provide a coffee pot, but you could order a small pot of coffee from room service for 9.00, There were only two towels in the bathroom. TV stations are minimal, and no guide was provided. A breakfast buffet was available for 14.95, with basically scrambled eggs, fruit, cereal, and bacon and sausage. Don't bother. There are far too many hotels to stay at in Chicago, don't settle for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Truly excellent at the time, but sadly lacking in pre- and post-stay service”
Reviews.Author: Dr-D-101
Reviews.Content: This is a really difficult one to rate. I tend to only write reviews if somewhere I've stayed or eaten is particularly good, as I feel that people usually don't get around to commending good service, & only comment when there's something to moan about. I've therefore held off this review for several months, assuming that I'd end up being able to write the positive review I'd expected to be submitting. My experience with the Allerton is a real curate's egg, & I hope that my writing about the good and bad may help future guests to get the good but avoid the bad. The good bits first... The hotel is beautifully designed, in an unbeatable location, & all the staff whom I encountered during my stay were absolutely fantastic. Yes, the room was smaller than many I've stayed in on trips to America, but there was more than enough space (who really *needs* acres of space in a hotel room?!). Moreover, it was beautifully designed - stylish and extremely comfortable. It's true - as other reviewers have noted - that there are high charges for in-room wifi & items from the mini-bar, but to be honest, that's clearly flagged up, so I really don't think that it's a problem. The hotel bar is nicely cosy, & beautifully in keeping with the hotel's fabulous overall design aesthetic, & has a great cocktail list & excellent mixologists. My colleague & I were en route to an annual conference in Michigan - we like to have a one-night stopover in Chicago as a mini-holiday, to recover from the transatlantic flight & to catch up over cocktails & dinner as a treat before the imminent hard work & long days at the conference. We were both delighted with our experience at the Allerton & had determined to make this our regular pre-conference hotel, and strongly recommended it to other friends & colleagues at the conference. But now to the less good bit... when I got back to the UK, I noticed that I'd been charged for a breakfast which I'd not had (we'd gone instead to an excellent nearby diner recommended by the concierge). True, I should have spotted this on the bill at check-out, but I'd asked for a new bill as I'd had a bottle of water from the mini-bar, & as there were also cocktails from the bar on the bill & the taxi was waiting, I didn't register the discrepancy. An easy mistake to make both on my part & the hotel's, & one which I didn't think would be difficult to rectify. Unfortunately, however, I've still not received a reply to my three emails. I'm more than aware that it's not a huge amount of money, but am surprised - given the extremely high quality of customer service during our stay - that nobody's bothered to reply. Even a 'tough, you should have noticed at the time' would have been better than nothing! This chimes with our experience before we arrived - we both booked via booking agencies, & my colleague emailed the hotel to check that all was in order with her booking, rather than risking turning up post-flight with nowhere to stay, but received no reply. Concerned, I also mailed a couple of times, but got no reply. My colleague eventually rang & all was well. We'd have thought no more of it - it's possible, & understandable, that hotels aren't keen to offer the same customer service to guests who haven't booked directly - but the lack of response to my post-stay mails suggests that this may be a more general issue. As it's a silly amount of money, I'm not going to bother making a transatlantic phone-call on my home phone-bill, but as this suggests shoddier customer service than I'd expect from any hotel (let alone one in America), I'm also not going to bother booking here again. I know that I'm kind of cutting off my nose to spite my face - on the evidence of my actual stay at the hotel, I'd rate it 5* on all counts, & would wholeheartedly recommend The Allerton to anyone, & urge them to ignore the negative reviews about room-size & queues for the lift (yes, you may have to wait, but you get to chat to lovely people while doing so!). But as there are so many excellent hotels in Chicago who don't ignore their guests before and after their stay, I'll - reluctantly - be going elsewhere from now on. I really hate writing negative reviews (especially over so small an amount of money), but hopefully this may allow people to avoid a similar error, which could well be for a less trifling amount. Should I ever hear from the hotel, I'll be sure to update this.

Reviews.Title: “good for our stay”
Reviews.Author: soleilk
Reviews.Content: I've been to Chicago many times and got a good deal thru Hotwire and this place served us just fine for our vacation/business visit for a few days. We were forewarned from prior reviews: yes, the room was very small (not to mention the drawers were tiny, there's only about a foot around the end of the bed to get to the other side, had to reach over the toilet to turn on the shower--difficult for a pregnant little person like me), yes the elevators were small and SLOW (we even experienced the elevator competition with the flight attendants=even slower), yes the WiFi is NOT free except in the lounge. Also, check in is on the 2nd floor, although there's a separate elevator for the first 3 floors-otherwise use the stairs between 1 &2. No early check in was available, which i called and asked about the day before, so they kept all our luggage for us, including a bike. Valet and self park next door is $48/24hours! we parked several blocks away at LSD for $31/nite. Location right on the corner of MIchigan ave with and Apple store on the corner--great for shopping, bad for traffic. We had a view of the old Water tower from 1612, but also the fire escapes. We didn't use the in house restaurant or gym. There's free coffee in the am and lemonade in the afternoon. The bed is comfy. Walls are a little thin, although our room was a lockoff--don't know if that makes a difference since there was someone next door. There's a fridge, but stocked with pay foods/drinks and we didn't attempt to take stuff out to put our stuff in. No HBO?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: habibah1
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Chicago so we were unsure of where a great location would be. Well, we picked a great hotel! We were minutes from the Red Line Chicago Stop. We were in the heart of the Mag Mile near all the high end shopping. We were about 15 minutes to Navy Pier and to Millennium Park. 10 minutes to the Oak Street Beach and just a few block from the Hancock Tower. We walked everywhere or took the subway. We also took the subway from the airport to downtown. Very easy and inexpensive. Better than a taxi! The hotel was wonderful! The rooms were beautifully decorated-- modern and chic. The only complaint would be the elevator, but really the longest we had to wait was less than 10 minutes and no free wifi in the rooms. We also were told by the front desk to give the hostess at Gino's East the hotel's business card and we got seated right away while some people were waiting for over 20 minutes. All in all a great stay! Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ncatal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Allerton. Yes, the rooms are small, but that is to be expected in an old hotel. The rooms were clean though...which matters more to me than the size. I was traveling with three other women and the room was comfortable enough for us. The staff was very accomodating and your can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly service, great value.”
Reviews.Author: fiveduece
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an older building, but inside is very nice. Check-in was smooth as could be, they upgraded our room from 2 doubles to a queen for free. Would of went to king but there wasn't any available. Rooms are small but we aren't living In it Just sleeping so it was fine. Bathroom wasn't as small as some reviews made It seem but it is pretty narrow and long. Shower was great. Only complaint I have with hotel is the breakfast. $15 a person for the buffet and it wasn't good at all. Total waste of money, especially when there are tons of restaurants within a quarter mile walk. Rest of our 2 night stay was fabulous. Location was everything.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Experience”
Reviews.Author: GH85
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying I have never written a hotel review before; however, I felt like I would be doing other travelers a disservice by not sharing my experience. My initial room was so small I had to go beg the front desk for a room with double beds, their only solution was upgrading me to a single bed suite with a pull out couch (which they charged me an additional 30/night fee for a 4 night stay) and told me to try again the next day to see if I could get into a double room. I tried the following day and then the following day but failed. I was stuck on the 6th floor facing air conditining units out one window and a brick wall out the other. Cell phone service was almost nonexistent due to this. The sink in the bathroom had cracks, the carpet smelt and the bed didnt sleep much better than the couch. I booked this hotel thru Priceline's name your own price which had this hotel classified as a 4 star, I'd say it's more closer to a 2.5 after staying 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “You are helping feed many by staying here”
Reviews.Author: Beekeeperone
Reviews.Content: OK - location is perfection but beyond that I am unable to offer anything else positive. The rooms were on the small side. Radiator heated and so hot one could barely breath. We opened windows wide which helped a bit but then one had to deal with the street noise. Breakfast in the restaurant was tasty but overpriced. Parking was very expensive - like any hotel in this area of Chicago. In and out was allowed but it involved tipping the valet (in addition to ridiculous fees) and then of course tipping the doorman every time you entered or left the building. When checking out we called for a bellman and assistance - waited 30 minutes and decided to handle the luggage on our own . Made out the room door, down a tiny elevator, thru the lobby. Found a bench to wait for the car (which had been called or a half hour earlier also) and when our car arrived all of a sudden 3 bellmen appeared and wanted a tip to move luggage 10 feet to car! I think most of the staff's main income comes from tips - they are pushy with a smile. So stay at this place and put a gallon of milk on someone's table! I am sure they appreciate the tips but it all seemed like begging with a smile to me - too much push.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: gingerk21
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star hotel. Rooms were very small. We were on the 10th floor noise from outside sounded as if we were on the 1st floor. Would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pinkranger81
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Chicago and at this hotel. It is true that the rooms are on the small side but really when visiting the city you should be out and about and not sitting in the room! It was a VERY convinient location to everything. We walked everywhere! The concierge was curteous and suggested great restaurants for all types of cuisines and price ranges. The vallets were excellent even though we didn't park our car at the hotel - there was cheaper across the street (just no in and out priviledges - we didn't care). I would recommend this hotel to all those couples who are out to have trendy accomodations and don't need a huge room!

Reviews.Title: “King room quite nice!”
Reviews.Author: EClikestravel
Reviews.Content: I booked on a 5 night special ( 40% off) and got a KING room, it was good size and very large bathroom too. Very clean, would stay there again as long as it was King room or larger. Business center is a nice touch to avoid paying the daily WiFi fee. Ordered room service for dessert one night and it was excellent ! Location of this hotel is perfect on Mag Mile, parking at $48 daily is typical Chicago. It is close to the NW hospital so you will hear emergency vehicles at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee_Hotel
Reviews.Content: I've been to many hotels in the Chicago area and this one lands in the middle of the road. The best thing about it was the location (right off of Michigan Avenue). The room was reasonable, but not very spacious. Only there for one night, so it was tolerable. Parking was available from the valet, but I opted to park at Northwestern right down the road - it ran me about $40 for 24 hours, so that worked out pretty good. One last note was in regards to the staff, they were not very friendly. we came and went a few times and were never greeted.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: roseandrie
Reviews.Content: Just spent Friday night with a girlfriend and we could not believe how small the room was. We stayed thinking we booked into the Navy Pier package and I even contact hotel to make sure our tickets and coupons would be at front desk when we checked in. Not only were they not there they never got them in the 24 hour stay. It was to include free parking and breakfast for 4. We had to ask several times to be credited for parking only to find out it still had not been credited when we checked out. It's locationis great just off Michigan Ave. The doorman was most helpful and actually we told him he should be runing the hotel. The staff sure could learn from him. Will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value on Magnificent Mile!”
Reviews.Author: AliceandJiminy
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Allerton this spring! Staff was very helpful from the doorman to registration and housekeeping. The room was clean (there was some mold around the shower area, which is to be expected in humid climates) and always ready when we came back at odd hours. Beds and pillows were comfy. We used the upgrade service on the website, and got a Jr Suite which was a corner and gave a good amount of room with a love seat and coffee table by the TV. Toiletries were different each morning, sometimes brands, some not. For the money, this was a great find for the area, very centrally located. We walked to nearly all our destinations. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hermansen7
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room facing Michigan Avenue. The view was great! We had a room with a queen size bed which was nicely decorated. The room was small, but provided adequate space. The staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, a great experience. Our only complaint was the elevators. Not good if you are claustrophobic!

Reviews.Title: “1920's charm in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: travellerino
Reviews.Content: Booked through a third party reseller for a song for 2 nights and actually through the hotel for one night to arrive earlier than originally planned. The worst was going through the reseller honestly, because what they had booked would not have accommodated our party, though I had specifically made notations on the booking form for them. Thankfully we decided to leave a day earlier which gave me cause to call the hotel a couple of days before to see about the extra night. The reservation agent was a doll, squeezing us into the right sized room and correcting the booking made by the third party. She blocked our room so they could not be reassigned out and gave me detailed instructions on what to ask the front desk for at check in (we needed a rollaway). It was easy to find, cheery and helpful valets and bellman and check in was a breeze. Had seen a bunch of concerns around elevators - this wasn't anything to complain about. In fact, we noticed that on the second day, our room actually shared a wall with one of the elevator shafts. We didn't hear a peep. We LOVED the Allerton and wouldn't hesitate to return for our next Chicago stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta be one of the best bargains in Chicagoland”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoKat23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels downtown, and have not encountered anything like the Allerton. EVERY staff member that I talked to, from making my reservation until checking out, provided excellent service. They were friendly, helpful, and prompt - always - there were no exceptions. The room was clean, ample size, and had lovely linens and toiletries. We stayed for 5 days and literally wanted to cry when we had to leave. This hotel is in the middle of the action! We walked to the Water Tower, Billy Goat Tavern, a fab downtown mall behind Macy's on Michigan, the Signature Room (at Hancock Building), Grant Park (a little bit of a hike) - stopped at all kinds of cool stores, shops, and restaurants along the way. There is a nice breakfast buffet served at the hotel in the morning for a reasonable price, and free coffee for those who just need a pick me up. The only quasi complaint I could summon would be that the elevators are not extremely rapid. I say, who cares? Unless you're a contestant on the Amazing Race, this should not be a factor. The Allerton has been running some kind of magnificent rate special this summer - take advantage of that and have yourself a great time in Chicago. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: PippiMN
Reviews.Content: Perfect location from which to explore Chicago. It is right on Michigan Ave just a few blocks from the Hancock Building. The hotel is great - clean, comfortable beds, friendly reception staff and comfortable reception area. Free wifi in lobby was a nice perk. Parking was expensive (about $50 per day) at the hotel ramp but you can find less expensive self park options within walking distance if you look around. We found a ramp about 5 blocks away for $26 per 24 hours. We paid about $150 per night for the room and were quite satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: travelinmama6
Reviews.Content: I made this reservation through Priceline so the rate for a hotel on Michigan Ave. in July was definitely right, but the service and accommodations were mediocre at best. We arrived early after taking a red-eye flight and were told there were no rooms available until. This may have been true but I couldn't believe one person hadn't checked out. When I inquired about this and said I understood we were early the front desk attendent said housekeeping wasn't on duty? Anyway, we did finally get a room about 9:30 AM and it appeared fine but the floor had a rise in it which was covered with carpet and other small repairs needed,the room seemed neglected. I was glad we hadn't pay full price, I would've felt cheated. This location is perfect and we had a beautiful day in the city. I hope the staff will pay more attention to details and be more courteous in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I fell in love”
Reviews.Author: Mrsjones08
Reviews.Content: Ok guys I love to travel, my contributions are always objective because I am a hotel knit picker so if I say I love it, Believe me I do! Check in: My husband and I visited Chicago for the 1st time on July 4th weekend 2011. This is a big event weekend for Chi town because of the Taste of Chicago, not to mention a holiday weekend in a major city. We arrived way early, like 9:30a.m early. So when we got in the city limits I called ahead just to see on the off chance our room would be available for check in, and it was! Upon arrival we were greeted with smiles & knowledge...nuf said! The young lady asked if we flew in I told her no my husband insisted that we drive (we parked somewhere else cheaper), and she was like well let us feed you then. She gave us comps for their wonderful FULL breakfast buffet, and insisted that we have a great time while visiting her city & the Allerton Hotel. Room Type: I was booked for just a Queen/King I think is how they classify it online. The guest service lady @ the desk observed how large my hubby is (6ft5in tall) and said Mrs. Jones are you aware your room will be a queen bed, I said no mam and asked if a true king was available? She said "of course I will make all of this better" gave us what I would assume is one of the best rooms according to its beauty. It faced Michigan Ave, had a parlor w/ a desk and tv, separate room w/ tv; just lovely! Hotel Convenience: Michigan Ave & Huron on the corner next door to Brooks Bro's, you can walk EVERYWHERE! Take a carriage ride they port right in front of the hotel by the APPLE store. Geno's East is right behind the hotel too. Hotel Staff: AWESOME! I'm objective remember so the ONLY negative things are slow elevator's & expensive parking right at $50 per day, but just relax it's an old hotel with all kinds of charm that makes up for it! O and FREE WiFi on the 2nd floor, which is where their lobby is anyway! Check out: I usually never write about check out since with folio's on your tv and smartphones this process 9 times out of 10 is eliminated, but I had to check out because there was a mix up on my bill when I reviewed it; I was inadvertently charged for valet charges when we didn't use them. I called and it was taken care of NO QUESTIONS ASKED by a staff member over the phone, but i'm a cautious traveler so I went down and got a new copy of my checkout folio just to be safe not sorry! I will be staying here again, soon!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: MzRKO
Reviews.Content: The hotel was one of the first high rises built after the Great Chicago Fire and construction was completed in 1924. The Allerton is a boutique class hotel which means the rooms are very small! In fact everything is small including the elevators, basically they are built for 2-3 riders at most, however as with anything people will try to cram on just to avoid waiting for the next elevator. This is a nice hotel and located right off Michigan Ave which makes it convienent for the tourist like me. The downside like I said is the rooms are small, with little to no walking around room. We upgraded to a suite and it was infinitly better. Another downside to this hotel are the beds and that is a key factor. They are old and you can feel the springs even though they have tried to top with a thick feather bed. There is no restaurant per se, they is a dining room that only serves breakfast, however there is a room service menu that we found to be quite delicious. The bar, as with most hotel bars is expensive, water alone is $4. And there are no vending machines in the hotel The one saving grace of the hotel is the staff. They offer superb customer service and are eager to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming, Unique Hotel on the Magnificent MIle”
Reviews.Author: Libby1979
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in this hotel through Priceline "name your price" for a long wekend with my husband. Priceline rates this hotel as a 3 1/2 star hotel; I would rank it as a 4 star. As soon as I found out which hotel Priceline had assigned to us, I read reviews and freaked out. For Priceline "Name your price" bidders, the hotel offers rooms with only one double bed. I called Priceline and told them that this was unacceptable because the "name your price" bid was for a room that accommodates two adults, and the hotel's website states that the room with one double bed, "the petite classic", is perfect for the single traveler. Priceline argued and argued with me and told me that basically I was stuck. I called the hotel and explained my dilema, and also explained that I am pregnant, so if they give us a room with a double bed, one of us will have to sleep on the floor. The hotel ensured that we would have appropriate accommodations. When we checked in, I found out that the room that was reserved for us was in a location that was usually reserved for airline employees, so it was at the end of the hall, shared almost no walls with other rooms, and was far away from the ice machine and elevator. Our room was AWESOME! The modern furnishings and art in combination with the crown molding really impressed us. The room was in the shape of a "U", so that the desk and sitting area was almost completely seperate from the bed/bath area. The room had a queen bed with enough room for my husband, me, and my baby belly. Our room had an awesome view, almost 180 degrees, with views of the Magnificent Mile, and two views of Lake Michigan. The room was exceptionally clean and we had very good control over the temperature in the room. There were two plush white robes in the closet, furnished by the hotel. In the morning, the complimentary coffee in the lobby was excellent (I had decaf, of course), and the front desk staff, security, and door/bell staff were always friendly and helpul. Before we left, I looked at the Tip Top Tap ballroom, which was stunningly beautiful with huge windows, high ceilings, trendy furnishings, and light fixtures, and saw the gym, which was surprisingly well-equipped. This hotel is very close to Northwestern hospital, so we heard lots of ambulances at night, but it isn't a big deal if you are a heavy sleeper. The huge flat screen TV was very nice. It would have been great if the concierge was on duty for longer hours. 9-6 just didn't meet our needs. Security at this hotel was great. When I checked in, a huge security guard was posted in the lobby and he was taking care of a situation. It made me feel very safe. The hotel door had a deadbolt and a heavy duty sliding lock. The free coffee in the lobby was very, very good and was greatly appreciated. The location couldn't be beat. We were right in the middle of all of the high end shopping, a few blocks away from church, just a street away from Rush Street, within walking distance of several tours and the pier, and very close to fine dining.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, nice staff, internet too expensive”
Reviews.Author: MarPaza
Reviews.Content: The location is great! The staff is very nice! Beware of the internet use fees. They charge 10 dollars per day per device. If you're in Chicago just to relax, I definitively recommend it. If you're there to do work, it may not be your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful Allerton hotel”
Reviews.Author: innominate
Reviews.Content: With apologies to some of the other reviewers, if you don't love the beautiful Allerton Hotel you have no soul. Sure, some rooms are small (we put in for an upgrade but it didn't happen) and the two-floor lobby arrangement is a little strange and inconvenient, but that's all part of the charm of an historic hotel, and unless you're traveling with your son Pantagruel there's plenty of room for you. Certainly there are a few things they could improve: room internet could be free (as it is in the lobby), valet parking could be cheaper (but even the self-park down the street is $36/day), they could re-open the Tip-Top Tap. Other than that, I can't think of anything I'd change. I will stay here every time I can afford to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travellingsooncanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located. We walked to shopping, restaurants, the Navy Pier, Museums and the Beach. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and efficiently laid out. Yes, the room was smaller than what we have normally come to expect, but this hotel has more of a boutique feel. The decor is kinda funky. This hotel has character! We enjoyed it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: laporte1
Reviews.Content: The lobby and bar area have an old hotel embiance that is relaxing but chic at the same time. All of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We upgraded to a king bed room from a full for only $25 per night!! This is well worth it, as the king room is much larger. The location is extremely convenient... Right by Michigan Ave shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly, helpful service”
Reviews.Author: Sylv_Trav
Reviews.Content: The Allerton Hotel is located in a great location right on Michigan Avenue in the middle of the Magnificent Mile shopping district. The staff was very friendly and helpful with any request. Valet parking is expensive - $48/night, but that's typical for the area and does include in and out privledges. The valet is very convenient. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but it's vey pricy for breakfast. Try the Corner Bakery a block away on St. Clair.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dianne1349
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister and her husband, and myself just returned from 3 night stay at Allerton in Chicago. It was great. Room was clean and comfortable, and big. Had breakfast at hotel 2 out of 3 mornings (wished it was 3 out of 3). The breakfast buffet was perfect, and if you wanted your eggs different, they did that too. The wait staff couldn't do enough for you, our coffee and juice cups were never empty. The concierge was most helpful, saved us half the price on play tickets, and many other great suggestions, he couldn't have been nicer. Everyone from checking in, to holding doors, to cleaning our rooms were absolutely wonderful, and should be commended. We would most definitely stay here again, and again. Barb from London, Ont. Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel - UNBEATABLE Location!”
Reviews.Author: martybrookhart
Reviews.Content: In March 2011, my then girlfriend and I took a three day two night trip to one of our favorite cities, Chicago! In our first few hours there, I surprised her with a proposal in Millennium Park (She said "Yes!"). We spent two nights at the Allerton Hotel. It was a very beautiful hotel. It definitely has a historic hotel feel with modern updates. We booked through Hotwire, and I would recommend this. If you do enough Google searching you can pretty much know exactly what hotel you are booking before you book it. The location itself is a good enough reason to stay here. Literally a block or so from water tower place and right on Michigan Ave. Our room looked straight down onto the Apple Store. Also, the overall view from our room was great! The staff is also very friendly and accommodating. We like to venture around the hotels we stay in so we took a trip up in the elevator to the Tip, Top, Tap Ballroom. We ran into a staff member who knew exactly what we were doing so he unlocked the ballroom for us and let us explore by ourselves! The view was incredible and we were able to take some great pictures! We were also very surprised to find out that a friend of ours called the hotel and had a bottle of Champagne and two glasses sent to our room to celebrate our engagement! I also ordered breakfast in bed for us on our first morning. The food was great and the service was punctual. Room size: I was pretty concerned after reading some reviews about the room sizes. Yes, they are small, but this didn't detract from our stay one bit! Especially since we were only staying two nights. This is the absolute PERFECT hotel for a getaway trip to Chicago! I can say that I won't be looking to stay anywhere else when I visit again with my FianceÃ©!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Route128North
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Allerton Hotel while attending a meeting held on-site. My stay was short, only two nights, but the experience was positive. My first impressions, however, were not so positive as registration is on the second floor and I found very limited signage where I entered on the first floor to direct me up to the second. Also, the first floor lobby is quite small, one small room and a narrow hallway for the elevators (I later noticed that this lobby got quite crowded if a few groups of people entered at the same time). Once I got to the second floor, things got better (though the second floor lobby was also small). Check-in was quick and staff were friendly and polite. My corner room was small, about 10â€™ by 13â€™, with nice, up-to-date furnishings in good condition. I would have preferred a firmer mattress on my full-sized bed, but it wasnâ€™t bad. The desk was narrow (some of us still use paper and like to spread our papers out!), and the chair not so comfortable. There was a flat-screen TV. Wi-fi worked well though it was slow (512K). The closet was tiny. I wasnâ€™t disturbed by noise from the hallway or the street. The bathroom had a shower only. Water pressure in the shower was acceptable and there was plenty of hot water. Toiletries were very nice. There was a pedestal sink with just a small shelf nearby so not the best set-up for early morning grooming. The bathroom was very clean as was the room. The meeting rooms were fine and had working wi-fi. The chairs, however, were very uncomfortable especially for all day meetings! I had lunch in the hotel restaurant one day and thought it was fine. The hotel is located in a nice area with many restaurants nearby. It is also five (short) blocks from the CTA, which made travel between Oâ€™Hare and the hotel easy and inexpensive. I was busy with work during most of my stay and happy to be able to relax in my pleasant room in the evening. I would happily stay at the Allerton again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice if you know you are staying in an older hotel and have appropriate expectations”
Reviews.Author: BMIFlyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Allerton for two days on a business trip. I had read many of the reviews before hand, so I knew what to expect. I will agree with many of the negatives, but I just do not think they are big deal. This hotel was built in 1923; do not expect a modern Marriott or Hyatt. Yes, the elevators are small and slow, yes the rooms are a little small, yes there is quiet a bit of road noise, especially with the nearby fire department and hospitals sirens are frequent. That being said, I really thought this was a nice hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again. The staff was all very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were nicely furnished with comfortable beds and a nice work desk (although the desk could use a convenient outlet). The lobby is nicely furnished with a nice bar & restaurant and sitting areas. The location is perfect for access to Michigan Avenue shopping, dining, & Navy Pier. The valet parking, pricy at $48 but normal for Chicago standards, was very prompt and courteous

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, pretty average...”
Reviews.Author: Five15
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes from what we read on here and the location, but the rooms were pretty small and we were next to the elevators and the ice machine and the dreaded Mile on the other side. In the 5 nights we stayed I got about 4 hours sleep each night. I cant see what they can do about the noise on the Ave unless they double glaze, or tell the cops/ambulance to cool the sirens late at night, but the elevators and the ice machine should be quieter in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing really Speical”
Reviews.Author: ThaliaBoy86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to Expedia overbooking are 1st hotel. So this was not our 1st choice hotel. Hotel lobby is on the 2nd floor so a little confusing at first. we arrived around 6pm. we were told the room was not ready and that it would be ready in an hr. They hotel gave us hotel credit to use at the Bar which we did. An hr later we went back up to the desk and were informed that the room was still not ready. we ended up checking in close to 7:45PM.Room was ok. Nothing really special about it. We had a one king suite. I would rate this a 3 star hotel due to the room. In the morning the hotel gave us a folio under the door with a different name. This hotel seems like they need more housekeeping staff. Bellmen were great! Next time we will be staying somwhere else. Like I said It was ok nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “The Allerton is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: ALASKA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after much difficulty finding anything remotely affordable in downtown. Due to circumstances we arrived very late, after midnight and were bone tired. We received a room with 2 double beds and slept very well. We did not hear any noise since we faced away from Michigan Ave, but that wouldn't have bothered us. This hotel is a gem and we will more than likely return. The hotel was built in 1922 and you can imagine, as you walk through the narrower corridors, that in fact people were generally smaller then. But the rooms are stylish, with comfortable beds, decent sized bathroom (ours had walk in shower, very nice) and in general very thoughtfully appointed. The complimentary coffee in the morning was a welcome touch. We did not try the onsite dining but went across the street to Corner Bakery for breakfast. One warning the elevators are somewhat "cozy" but this is really a minor point, and far outweighed by the plus factor of being able to open the windows for fresh air. We opened the window that did not have the spider outside. Every building in Chicago seems to have these outside the windows. But I digress - this hotel is a gem and I only wish we had stayed there longer.

Reviews.Title: “As always, a standout hotel experience on Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: avmiddleton
Reviews.Content: Although I've reviewed The Allerton before, we have continued to have such amazing experiences there, I'm compelled to rave again. Let's get the negatives out of the way first: the parking there is expensive, though comparable to other hotels near the Mag Mile. The hotel now charges for delivery of basic utensils and such from the bar/kitchen (e.g., fee for a wine key delivered to the room). However, the rest of the amenities are stellar. The lobby bar is cozy, with wonderful, local beer options along with an amazing bar food menu (try the sliders). Our room was fantastic, as usual--- spacious enough, comfortable, and modern. Overall, it's hard to beat their rates for such a great location, especially during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you plan to sleep”
Reviews.Author: rkarpel
Reviews.Content: I'm in Room 1803 in the Allerton, which faces MIchigan Avenue. Every minute or two a traffic signal on the street below emits a series of loud beeping noises. It's extremely loud -- imagine an alarm going off in your room. I called to switch rooms but the only rooms left are facing Michigan Ave., so I guess I'm out of luck. I guess I won't be getting any sleep tonight. They brought ear plugs to my room, so that may help. Also: There is a work desk in the room, but there's no lamp on the desk. So it's a desk you can't work at during the evening because there isn't enough light. Argh.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but other reviews weren't kidding about the elevators”
Reviews.Author: Soniab13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights during what was apparently a baseball-frenzied weekend in Chicago. The hotel was completely sold out. The Allerton lived up to expectations based on other reviews. Small but nicely decorated rooms, friendly service, great location and long waits for elevators. Once, after waiting and not being able to get on two fully-packed elevators, I somehow got off on the wrong floor and had to wait yet another 5 minutes. Most people were friendly and good humored about the situation and we became "close" with fellow travelers - some offering their baseball brew in case we got stuck. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. In-room wi-fi was reasonable - $9 a day I think, and they had free wi-fi in the lobby (but I couldn't find a power plug!). Coffee was free down in the lobby - no issues with availability. Bell staff were always very nice and helpful. We used Priceline to book the room (at an okay, but not great, rate), which they did mention at check in, and our room was somewhat near an elevator but didn't seem inferior in any other way. Overall a nice stay - but for a longer visit I'd find a place with more standard-sized rooms (and better elevators).

Reviews.Title: “Cute but small”
Reviews.Author: travelator17
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of many attractions, store, Trader Joe's etc. The standard room was much smaller than it appeared in pictures but kept nice and clean. Beautiful lobby and friendly people. They put the coffee away super early so make sure you're up by 9 if you want some! Unfortunately you can't keep any leftovers- they have a fridge filled with expensive drinks and you get fined a "restocking" fee if they find out you've stored anything else in the fridge. Nice bed, comfortable chairs in room. Nice cozy room for a couple. The bell hops and valet people were sooo nice. They gave us change, directions and advice on good places to eat. They don't have maps available in the lobby so make sure to get one ahead of time somewhere else. They let us check in about 6 hours before normal check in time! All over good experience, they just have a few little things to work on

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vampycat74
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. The staff is very helpful and friendly as well. My room was extremely spacious, and it was offered at a really great price. Their room service was excellent and very yummy as well. Would stay again, for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good locations shame about the lifts”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Gough
Reviews.Content: The longest time spent waiting in line in Chicago was for the lifts in this hotel, I guess it's just a busy place and if one lift is out you get congestion! Overall I liked the hotel but as always they charged way too much for WiFi and it was not that good speed wise - WiFi should be part of the package as in free guys! On the really negative side, I reported our room safe broken on check-in and it stiil not fixed on check-out 3 days later which is a big fail on service. That said, the free morning coffee is a nice touch...

Reviews.Title: “Great location......small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: leetaylor89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on Michigan avenue for dining and shopping it's all on your doorstep but the downside is the rooms are small and if your in a room overlooking the avenue then you may need earplugs for a good night sleep ! The staff can be either great and very helpfull or sometimes quite the opposite.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star..... If you are a Hobbit!”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: Without doubt a wonderfully located historic and charming hotel which screams character. It's a shame it's more suited to Bilbo Baggins then a 6 ft tall Irish man with a suitcase and trolly bag. From the moment you try to get a lift to your floor you realise that this will be a cramped experience.
