I had a wonderful corner room with two windows, one looking directly down onto Mich Ave and the other looking straight at the Famous Water Tower, it's a shame I could have opened both windows at the same time from my bed, one with my toe and the other with my arm and control the tv at the same time. There was just NO room. My suitcase blocked the main door when opened and had to remain closed for the most part and flush against the wall, why they bother to provide a suitcase stand I'll never know. And as someone said in another review, you literally have to climb over the toilet to get in and out of the shower.... The shower is in actual fact the most spacious part of the room! I ordered breakfast for room service. It was the Allerton and it consisted of 2 slices toast, 2 poached eggs, breakfast potatoes and 3 slices of bacon. I also had a tea and OJ. I expected the rather high charge of $34.50 (despite being advertised at $15.50) but what I had not expected was just how meager the portions were, as small as the room! Then the lifts, tiny is not the word, even the doors are too narrow! The wait can be significant, I waited almost 10 minutes at home point. However the staff are friendly and professional and the location is just amazing! I appreciate that the building is old and they are limited in what they do but I really believe that the rooms are just too small. Size is not everything, but it is in this place!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the mag mile”
Reviews.Author: flossy_h
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights following a 2 week trip around the mid west. We arrived late on a Friday night to find a room with one bed which was not appropriate when sharing with my Dad! There were no other rooms available so we opted for a room with a sofa bed. This was not the most comfortable but did the job. Location was great, parking was expensive at $48 a night and no free internet as we gotten used to at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but watch what you are being charged.”
Reviews.Author: michmom_30
Reviews.Content: So my son and I were in Chicago for his 13 th birthday weekend. I have never been to Chicago and booked this hotel through priceline. Got a great rate and the location was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Like the reviews say the standard rooms are a bit small BUT really how much room do you need. The beds were a little bigger than a double. The only thing I would say about the room is that they need to change the carpet it was showing the wear. The only big issue that we had was that when we checked in I was told that there was a 75$ incidental charge that needed to be paid and I would get it back when we check out. That wasn't a problem however I checked my bank the next morning and saw that the woman who checked me in charged me almost 300$ not just the 75$. I was able to resolve it and the front desk was some help. I was a bit surprised however that the hotel didn't offer something for the huge inconvenience. It wasn't a small mistake. So when checking in be sure you are being charged the right amount.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel all the way around”
Reviews.Author: mikeycleveland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. This is our second stay at this hotel and we will return again and again. Everything is perfect about this place..from the doorman, parking valet, front desk staff, cleanliness of rooms, quality of beds, location, there are no negatives about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Jewel in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen2121
Reviews.Content: The Allerton Hotel is a vintage jewel in the heart of the city. THis hotel is old and historic...it has been renovated and the rooms although small are very clean, posh, and comfotable. The bathroom is a bit small and being a woman there was not sufficent space for my layout. The front desk staff was amazing and extremely accomodating. The restaurant in the hotel was fairly priced for the city and had great munchies to accompany that perfect cocktail. It is very central and within walking distance to most main attractions of the city. I cannot wait to stay here again. I was very impressed. Being in the travel industry I look for things that most won't notice and this hotel by far surpassed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: SeasideWonderer
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago and we knew we wanted to stay around the Magnificent Mile area so we booked two rooms through Priceline.com. Priceline doesn't reveal the hotel until you accept their offer and pay for it. When I found out it was The Allerton, I checked Tripadvisor to get an idea of what to expect and found very mixed reviews! I must say our stay could not have been BETTER. The location is central to great shopping and restaurants. One of our rooms turned out to be a very roomy suite with a den, two tvs, a king bed and a BIG bathroom. The other was a small room with a double/queen bed and a small bathroom. The smallness was no big deal because I didn't spend much time in the room. The beds were very comfortable. In fact, my sister in law wanted to know if she could buy the pillows! The only street noise was the occasional emergency vehicle. We found the staff (concierge, front desk,housekeeping and doorman) all to be very helpful and friendly. We will definitely stay at the Allerton Hotel on our next visit to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location - a charachter hotel with attentive,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wab46
Reviews.Content: We hadnt been to Chicago before but knew the hotel was central. It was an excellent location - easy walking distance to the shops and also the Lake, parks etc. Hotel staff were helpful and curteous and there really wasnt anything bad to let it down. The cosy bar was a great place to round off a day of sightseeing and an evening out.

Reviews.Title: “Do not bring a cat....”
Reviews.Author: mintyaero
Reviews.Content: ... especially if you want to swing it. For the money paid, this has got to be the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. It's a grand total of FIVE (yes, 5) steps from the furthest side of the bed to the door of the room. The room is, including the bathroom, about the size of half my kitchen. I can't stress enough how small this place is! I got out of the shower this morning and literally had to climb over the toilet to leave the bathroom. The bed itself is not suitable for two people, unless you both happen to be under 5 years old. The room was clean though, and the room service reasonable. Staff are friendly and genuine. The only problem was, having been inconsiderate and bringing a case when I checked in (how stupid of me) there was no place for the staff member to put the tray - I had to eat my meal sitting on the bed. I really cannot stress how SMALL these rooms are. Please don't come to this hotel thinking it's luxurious or in any way spacious. It's tiny, pokey, dinky, squashed and cramped. I would not stay here again - however if I lose my legs in a freak accident meaning I end up 30 inches shorter than I am now - I'd certainly consider it (as long as I didn't do anything daft like bring a bag, or clothes, or someone else).

Reviews.Title: “Its a good job I am small!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gorfield
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 weeks in America in various types of accomodations ranging from casinos, log cabins, road side motels and chain hotels. This was the most dissapointing stop!! When we walked into the room we wondered where the rest of it was? maybe if we opened the warbrobe there would be a secret door to the other single bed?? but no. 2 of us had to sleep on a bed smaller than one that you would get 2 of usually! with walls on either side. I had to sit on the floor using a mirror on the back of the wardbrobe door to get ready! No tea and coffee, no mini bar, no wifi ( although hotel did have it they wanted to charge you extra for it) the only hotel we stayed at that wanted to charge us for this too! a $30 a night roadside motel even gave us basic amenities and free wifi. Air conditioning unit right outside the window, good job I took earplugs. Location is good but if you are looking for cheap hotel you may as well try the red roof round the corner as your room will probably be better equipped! This room was smaller than the box room in my house. oh and the parking is extortionate - about 50 dollars a day. I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, only minor issues”
Reviews.Author: 1AvidTraveler
Reviews.Content: I got a great AAA rate for this hotel despite staying over a weekend. The room was spacious and clean, the bed comfortable. Check in and check out were easy and painless and all employees I encountered were friendly. In fact, I ended up having to leave a day early due to a family emergency, and despite the fact that I called the front desk after 11 AM on the day I needed to check out, they were more than accommodating and told me that as long as I checked out before 1 PM, I would not have to pay for the second night. The Allerton has a superb location right on Michigan avenue in the heart of the Magnificent MIle, but beware if you have a car - both valet parking at the hotel and parking in nearby garages is extremely expensive. My only issues with the Allerton were again minor ones - the room was fairly warm and despite dropping the temperature significantly, it never really got to a truly comfortable temperature. Also, there was a bit of water leaking from the base of the toilet. Had I stayed the second night I would have called and reported this issue. Finally, there was little to no shelf space in the bathroom for my toiletries (I'm talking one small toiletry bag, a brush and a hair straightener were too much). All that said, if I were to get a similar rate I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “overall good value!”
Reviews.Author: idlehands_2
Reviews.Content: First room was right next to ice machine, so sleeping was difficult with the ice dropping avalanches. Staff was very accomodating and quick in giving me another room. Traffic is loud on Michigan Ave!!!! Many sirens all night long! Not their fault. Room was clean. Bathroom is kind of small, but I was traveling solo, so no biggie. Got a great deal on Travelzoo, so would stay again if i could get same deal! Location cant be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: loverofchocolate
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on account of its location - beside shops and near sightseeing bus. The location was perfect. I had read from previous reviews that the rooms were very small but I was pleasantly surprised to find a lovely spacious room. It was directly across from some of the lifts but I slept soundly. The staff I came across were all very helpful and friendly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “HOrrible, horrible horrible”
Reviews.Author: cdlewis79
Reviews.Content: arrived at 9am told to pay more to check in early, we declined. Was told to come back at 3pm for check in, we did. THEN told it was another 45 minutes before we could get into the room. HEY IF YOU HAD A ROOM FOR US AT 9AM for MORE MONEY, why did it take until 4:30 (1 and 1/2 hours AFTER check in) to get into a ROOM????? Then it took another 1 hour to even get our luggage (that had been in holding since 9am). AWFUL. The room is SMALL and the bathroom even worse a small sink literally HANGS off the wall. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Re: Great staff and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LucyGM
Reviews.Content: Ideal location and staff was courteous and helpful. Everything is within walking distance. Concierge was great and helped us book a boat tour and find tickets to the Dodger vs Cubs game. We found a great pub about two blocks away and there are several great restaurants nearby. The room was small, but the comfortable bed and pillows made up for the lack of space. Got a great deal on Priceline - 4 night plus airfare for $780 for two people. Loved my stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant staff, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: SEEWORLD_11
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate when we made our reservation, so I was a bit skeptical. Not to worry though, the hotel was modern, clean and very well located. The front desk agents were very nice and helpful. Our room was clean upon check-in and we retrieved everything we requested. I'm not sure if all rooms are equipped with this, but we had the best showerhead compared to all of the hotels that we've ever stayed in. If you stay here, please take the time to have a drink in the M Lounge. We spent a couple of nights in there and had a great time. The drinks are a bit pricey (to be expected), but Monday to Thursday they have different drink specials. Like us, you should take advantage of 1/2 price Martinis on Thursday! The topper for me was the Scrabble game they had available to play. Also, if you're looking to work out while staying here, they have a great fitness facility. I was quite impressed.

Reviews.Title: “only hotel I said I would not go back to..”
Reviews.Author: VALERIEJN
Reviews.Content: I was actually quite happy when I booked this through a "blind site" Reviews seemed good overall and I know the location is excellent... well, the only thing excellent about the stay was the location. We arrived and were given our room, what is advertised as a queen is a "european" queen.. a double bed. While I love my husband we do need a bit more space than that. Also the room actually was so small that you had to get on the bed from one side and roll in.... We asked about a room with an actual queen or king bed and were told we could "upgrade' for $30. Okay, seemed reasonable enough since we had gotten a great rate. New room.... did have a queen with exactly 1 foot on either sid, like others said, no dresser, tv did not work properly and window overlooked the courtyard. Bathroom was miniscule and the floor was filthy! ! ! so all in all not a pleasant room but again, could live with it and maybe even consider going back sometime if it was the only hotel available... what really put me over the top though was the so called service, we called for an extra pillow - had to call back again and again - okay, not the worst thing ever but we were there in August during the air and water show, after spending the day outside in 90+ degree humid weather we came back to our room to find out they had turned the air OFF! and when I called to ask if that was something standard got a "nope" not even a sorry, or can we buy you a drink in the lobby while the room cools down, or call us back if the room doesn't cool down quickly ... NEVER AGAIN WILL I SAY AT THE ALLERTON !

Reviews.Title: “Rough Start, but Great Location and Great Room”
Reviews.Author: jmd785
Reviews.Content: Found a great rate on travelzoo, so booked the hotel for a night in the city while visiting my boyfriend. Had been traveling from Los Angeles all day so was looking forward to taking a nap at the hotel before going out for the night, but when we arrived well after check-in time, the room was still not ready. The staff gave us some credit towards the lounge, so least we could get a few drinks and some food, and told us the room would be ready within the hour. Almost two hours later, still no call, so my boyfriend went and talked with the staff. Luckily they were able to move a few things around and we were given a much larger room free of charge. Pros: helpful staff, free drinks (whats not to like about that!), large room with comfortable bed, and great location for wandering around the city. Cons: room not ready until 7pm, parking is expensive (but didn't expect anything else as having been to chicago before) and bathroom had no counter space. But overall a good experience and would stay here again next time I am in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovation”
Reviews.Author: EileenIllinois
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Allerton a couple of weekends ago: one for my husband and me, and the other for my daughter and her husband. We used getaroom.com, which offered the best price I found. I loved the Art Deco renovation of this historic hotel. The lobby area, hallways, and rooms were all decorated beautifully. Although I booked two standard rooms, I was surprised at the difference in their size. Our bathroom and hallway were twice the size of that in my daughterâ€™s hotel room. Both, however, were beautiful, and I would have been happy with the smaller room. If you are concerned about size, I suggest checking with the hotel in advance. I agree with the other reviews about the amazing location. Only downfall is the expensive price for valet parking, but itâ€™s the same price regardless of the hotel in this area of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mastergardnerd
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fantastic location right on the Magnificent Mile. Got a great deal on the room with travelzoo.com. King sized bed was very comfortable. Breakfast buffet slightly pricey but very nice food, and very convenient just having to go downstairs. Cons: One person slept on the sofa bed and was very uncomfortable. Reserved two rooms a month in advance and asked for them to be on the same floor. One was on 4th floor, the other on the 10th floor. The only mirror in the entire room was in the bathroom, made it more difficult for three women to get ready in the morning. Additional daily charge of $9.95 for wifi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location-Some rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: la808
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here previously in a very small room, I was sure to ask for a larger room with 2 beds when I made the reservation although I was a solo traveler. I had room 1618 and it was very good. Their website/reservations are very clear about the square footage of each room - so pay attention when you book so you don't end up an unhappy traveler like other posters. Location: Excellent, excellent. In the middle of the Mag Mile. Can I say more? Rooms: No tub in mine - only a shower. Counter space was very limited - just a shelf below the mirror. Room had 2 flat screen Tvs, sofa, chair, coffee table and desk. Free internet. Mini bar, but no refrigerator or coffee maker that you can use in room. Full length mirror and in room safe. Lobby: Elevators are quite small, but there are 3 available. Check in on 2nd floor. One computer on 2nd floor you can use to print your boarding passes. Service: I had very limited contact with any staff - so I can't venture an opinion. Food: I was so close to dozens of restaurants that I did not eat at the hotel. I would definitely stay here again, BUT will surely ask for a big room again!

Reviews.Title: “Better options in the city”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago and really loved the Allerton, but this time, not so much. This is an old hotel which needs updating, but it seems they are trying to parade as a luxury hotel, where it does not matter. The rooms are drafty, and the lobby turned into a fancy looking restaurant that does not serve past lunch? Did not try it, figured it was a rip off, but I may be wrong. The rooms are TINY and very dated. Old carpeting, lots of exposed wires and peeling dirty wallpaper. Why the $25 fee to use the fridge?? The TINY bathrooms are sparse, with just bar soap, shampoo and conditioner. The tv was strange, was HD, but I think, not a HD connection? I may be putting that wrong, but everyone looked stretched, so made for a strange experience. Also no tv guide provided. One aspect that cannot be denied, is how helpful the staff was!! Every single person was helpful and polite. Too bad the rest of the hotel does not measure up to the awesome staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: gabby45036
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to Chicago in years, but when I return I will be staying at the Allerton again. The staff are amazing and very helpful. The rooms are rather small, but the maid service does an exceptional job keeping the rooms clean. My bed was so comfortable and although Chicago is a noisy city I was surprised at how quiet my room was. We enjoyed drinks in the bar on a few occasions and the staff was great. The location also makes this a great place to stay. You are a short walk to some of the greatest restaurants I've been too. I would highly suggest staying at the Allerton to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Four star? I don't think so!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: I used the Priceline 'Name Your Own Price' feature to book this hotel. We were told by the hotel that all the hotel was 'required' to do with a 'third party booker' was provide a double or queen bed. While I love my sister, I don't want to share a double bed with her. I have used Priceline approximately 75 times in the past and this was only the second time that I have been threatened with a double bed because I used a third party to book the room. We were offered a room with two double beds, provided we kicked in another $25, which we ended up doing. We got to our room to find that neither key card would work so we went back to the lobby and waited behind four other guests in order to have the key card reactivated. The room on the 17th floor was not very clean. There was a Budweiser can in the corner of the room with a bunch of chewing tobacco spit in it. There were a few large pieces of glitter on the floor along with a piece of denim fabric and general linty things. The decorative blue piece of fabric at the foot of the beds had hairs and white linty things on it. Conversely, the bathroom appeared to be very clean. The location is great, though. I liked that there were outside fire escapes for each floor. The hallways were attractive. The TV was nice and the closet was pretty big. The room was very small and a little 'rough' for a (supposed) four star hotel. I have stayed in many hotels in Chicago and this one would not be at the top of my list. It is just OK.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in the great city of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Andy761
Reviews.Content: Arrived before check in and was greeted by the doorman who took our bags. Check in wasn't a problem even as we were early, staff were very friendly and helpful. Was expecting a small room from previous reviews, but it was more than big enough for me and my wife with 2 large cases. Very clean! Hotel makes an amazing base for exploring Chicago, as it's very central and the allerton gets my total recommendation. Dont miss this gem. Great price to match

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad”
Reviews.Author: Catori76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a 4 star but still nice. It is probably more of a low 3 star. The hotel is in an amazing location and the staff is great. The staff makes this place, not the rooms or amenities. They try very hard to ensure that their guests are happy and will go out of their way to help you. This makes some of the problems with the hotel easier to overlook. When we first arrived, our room was so small we literally could not get our suitcases in past the doorway. The bathroom was also very small. My shoulders actually brushed each wall as I walked in, it was so narrow. We explained to the concierge that our room was far too small for our needs and they put us a suite which had more space. The room decor in both rooms and the hotel was nice but run down. The wall paper was peeling off, the bathrooms needed some refurbishment, the carpet in our room had burn holes in it, paint was chipping off and the beds were very poor quality. Additionally some of the public areas needs to be cleaned up. The hotel offers nothing in the way of amenities. They only provide soap and shampoo, no lotion, no toothpaste or other things you might need but forgot to bring. There are also no vending machines and no gift shop. The bar and restaurant are only open limited hours (soft drinks and water are $4 in both the hotel and the bar). There are places nearby that you can go to for necessities but be aware that they are not available in the hotel. The Allerton, while it did not meet our expectations comfort-wise, is staffed by people ready and willing to do whatever they can to make your visit a good one. The location is prime, it is right in the middle of the magnificent mile and only blocks to some of the most famous Chicago attractions. The only thing we could not overlook were the beds. They were miserable. They were old, hard, and the mattresses were in disrepair. The springs had worn through most of the inner lining and they can be felt when you lay down. If the beds had been more comfortable, the other things probably wouldn't have mattered so much. Overall, this is a decent historic hotel in a very good location. If you are not too concerned with the appearance being a little shabby or the beds being uncomfortable this is good hotel. It is close to lots of attractions and historic sights.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommende.”
Reviews.Author: MonroeJabb
Reviews.Content: Great location on Michigan Avenue. We arrived about 11:00 am and they checked us right into our room. The room and bathroom were on the smaller side like some we encountered in Europe, but we didn't come to Chicago to stay in our room. Very clean and well appointed. The staff was always helpful and very apologetic when they were unable to give us a late check-out. As a tip, if you like a great selection of beers on tap, walk out the door and make a left. In about a minute you will see Elephant and Castle on the corner. Try the nachos, too.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry, I just really disliked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayDee28
Reviews.Content: The location is great but I just hated the tiny rooms, although they were very clean. There is no room for anything. The only space to store my suitcase meant I had to jump over it to even open the door. The mini-bar is one of those horrible digital affairs warning you that there will be a $25 'cleaning fee' if used to store your own stuff. There is a large walk in shower but no bath. My room faced Michigan Ave and was noisy day and night. Worst of all, the temperature control in the room is fixed on permanently, no way of turning off, and the room never warmed up. I was cold and sniffly the whole time I was there. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good price!”
Reviews.Author: jgiaccotto
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was definitely on the smaller side, but it was definitely expected for the price and location. Everything was clean and the staff was extremely professional. We were able to check in 4 hours early with no issues, and the staff was helpful. There were no issues with room service and housekeeping at all. I am sure they have bigger rooms for the price upgrade, but for what we paid, it was amazing. The icing on the cake was that it was right next to the apple store on magnificant mile :)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise atop the Mag Mile.”
Reviews.Author: Chstypllr213
Reviews.Content: Service was prompt and very polite. We got the largest suite they had and because they couldn't upgrade us they gave it to us for the price of a deluxe room. View was amazing, looking over the Mag mile south toward the Tribune building. Lounge was intimate enough for a couple but still felt like an upscale lounge where you could meet with friends. Room service was great and willing to pick up the plates right after we were done. All in all it was a great stay with a pleasant surprise around every corner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: SteffanUrkel
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Allerton was better than any I have ever encountered. I have stayed at numerous upscale hotels, and while all were impressive for one reason or another, none come closs to matching the quality of the staff at the Allerton. Checking in was extremely fast, and the woman who helped us was great. Later, when in the lounge, the bartender came over quickly to our sofa and asked if he could be of any service and couldn't have been nicer. Room service was prompt, and housekeeping had the hotel looking spotless. For the price and location of this hotel (N. Michigan Ave, right by all major shops) it cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but don't get talked into the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: coffejor
Reviews.Content: Booked for a steal on a popular "hidden" booking site for a nice relaxing weekend away after the Valentine's Day rush. After some car troubles we got checked in late and went for the "King room on the 19th floor" upgrade. When we got checked into our room, we were disappointed to find that the only view from our 19th floor room was of the fire escape and abutting wall... oh well... The sink in our room had a huge piece cracked out of it (see photo); as we were tired from a long day, we decided to head to bed and bring it to the hotel's attention in the morning. We brought the sink to the desk attendent's attention and he was very nice, moving us to a new room right away. I was hoping the new room (now on the 21st floor) would have a view but, alas, we were treated to view of the 21st floor balcony and abutting wall... oh well... The location was great and well within walking distance from great shopping, food, and nightlife. The staff was absolutely excellent and the concierge recommended an amazing restaurant for dinner, pulling some strings to get us a reservation on a busy Saturday. All went well until checkout when we were notified that we had a $700 damaged furniture charge. Needless to say, we were more than surprised by this news (and so was the attendent). After some very tense minutes, it turned out that we weren't actually assessed the charge, but that the hotel had just tied the repair from our previous room to our account. Moral of the story: the staff was great, the location was great, the room was a good deal when you buy it right (just don't get talked into the upgrade). Would definitely stay here again, thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “We will be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: Hdubs2424
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an amazing experience for us on our Chicago Valentine's Day trip. The staff was courteous, our king room was spacious and VERY clean, the hotel itself was a great surprise, very high end and chic looking without the HUGE price tag you would see from other hotels of that nature. The valet service was great and the location could not be better. We will be recommending this to our friends and family! Thanks Allerton!

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago experience (for right bid price)”
Reviews.Author: brazilflyer333
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first night of a recent week-long vacation in Chicago at the Allerton, and in the end wished we never had to leave for a nearby competitor (which I had booked free nights on points). I'll run down some of the common pro's you've likely heard from others or picked up on from the website: great location right on Michigan Avenue, fairly new interior redesign is hip, stylish and attractive, and history behind the hotel makes for a fun stay. What I'd add to that is how much all of these positives really stood out to me, in just one night at the place. The classy doorman who went above and beyond what's called for to earn a tip; the front desk staff that allowed us an extremely early check-in; a top-of-the-line fitness center; and how truly cool the interior redesign made the hotel seem, compared to other chain hotels we've stayed at. Sure, their lowest-priced single bed room is a bit smaller than you may be used to (a common complaint), but I think that's overblown. It's only an issue if you spend your whole day in the room, if you're extremely LARGE people or if you are nitpicky (in my opinion). We got the room for around $70 total on a priceline blind bid (3 star level, I believe), and think that the most I'd pay here is $75. Maybe I'm spoiled by priceline's "name your own price" feature, but this seems like the fair price for a room at the Allerton, compared to the $100-plus advertised on the property's web site. The cons there include no free breakfast, or a pool/hot tub. The Allerton Hotel is a cozy, stylish place that I would recommend either for business travelers or couples on holiday. I'm a big fan of the Allerton, but there's a ton of hotel competition in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Service + Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: jctaz85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a short weekend getaway last month. The hotel is beautiful... a perfect mix of vintage charm and modern convenience. The rooms, as noted in other reviews, are on the small side - but this really wasn't a concern for us as we spent most of our time out enjoying the city. Hotel staff was top-notch - very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is situated right on Michigan Avenue - location could not have been better for us. We were in walking distance of everything we could possibly need and more. You just can't beat the value and quality of this hotel... we would definitely stay again next time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for a better place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: I love staying in the Gold Coast District / Magnificent Mile in Chicago. I used to stay at the Amabassador East. These hotels were the same price when I booked and with the Ambassador being so outdated I figured I would give the Allerton a chance. I was blown away. I paid extra for a larger king room as I do the Insanity workout DVDs and there was plenty of room. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was big enough. I was on the 21st floor and did not have to wait long for elevators at all. I saw a report that this hotel had a report of bed bugs after I had reserved the room. When I inspected the bed there were not signs of them. If this hotel is in my budget I will always stay there. It is only a few blocks from a CTA Station and plenty of restaurants around. Hotel is centrally located I could walk to most all my appointments.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajklink
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something with more character than the chain hotels, this could be your place. It's a decent location, right off of Michigan Avenue. We were in a North-facing room and could see the water tower and Hancock Building. My brother and fiance were staying in a South-facing room and could see mostly other buildings. The bellmen were a little strange, but friendly. The rooms are small (some smaller than others, even in the same category). The decor is basic, but nice. Although we did not spend any time in the lobby, it looked interesting. My brother arrived by car and parking was incredibly expensive (around $40-something per day). He opted to self park in a nearby garage and paid $40 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Slowhand1527
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and enjoyed it immensely. Company had an annual meeting there and we also had clients stay here as well. Great food in the restaurant, and bar was nice. Hotel staff were very accommodating. Rooms were good, not over the top. Only issues was that the elevators are really small, and reservations that were made received different pricing evening though it was the same company and event.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CSHouston80
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Chicago for a wedding and booked a room at the Allerton Hotel. I couldn't have been more impressed with this hotel and the level of service. It's a great old Chicago landmark with a lot of history, that has been completely redone and is very modern. The location on Michigan Ave. is excellent as you are withing walking distance to many great places. The standard rooms can be on the small side, but we had a junior suite and had no issues with the size of the room what-so-ever. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and would go out of their way to help you. Anytime we go back to Chicago, we'll be staying at the Allerton.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Allerton”
Reviews.Author: eriter10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here right before Christmas. Were very happy with our room, the staff, and it was in a fantastic location. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never stayed,but got charged for it!”
Reviews.Author: HeidiNewYork
Reviews.Content: I never acually stayed..I had original reservations but canceled way in advance due to a illness .Surprise it was on my credit card statement. I called and after much "research" they agreed I was well within cancellation status. and refunded my room..yea..hopefully get to stay in the future though

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly & Helpful Staff, Good Room”
Reviews.Author: Two_Travel_Bugs_WI
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great one-night stay. The room was nice. Clean, well-kept, comfortable bed. As others on this site have said, rooms are tiny. That didn't matter much to us, as we stayed only one night and had only one small suitcase. Also, we were not in the room much at all. For a couple, I would recommend this place for a few nights, but maybe not the best if you're staying a whole week and will probably spend a bit more time at the hotel. Located really in the heart of all Michigan Ave has to offer, the location can not be beat. Step out the front door, and you are on your way to anywhere! Cabs to Field Museum and Shedd were easy to come by and cheap as well. Staff were really great, too. Concierge went out of his way to help us with some arrangements and just overall ideas for both this trip, and our next. We did have breakfast in their restaurant, and must admit that it isn't anything special, and is really, really overpriced. I would not recommend that - but cocktails in their lounge were fun in the late afternoon. We liked it, and we'd be back again.

Reviews.Title: “First class location”
Reviews.Author: wendywuredhill
Reviews.Content: Our trip to New York was cancelled due to the snow. We flew into Chicago with no hotel booked, we were given the Allertons number by another member of BA staff. I'm so gald they did. From the moment I phoned them from the airport nothing was too much trouble. We had 4 adults in one room and did not find it too small at all, in fact the bathroom was very large. The hotel is in the best location for shopping and sight seeing. A short walk to Navy Pier. The hotel is very good value and I would use it again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, friendly staff, and clean”
Reviews.Author: mpharmstrong
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a 2 room suite. Kids thought it was great. Had a great view of Michigan Avenue with the holiday lights. One night, brought back a deep dish pizza from Gino's East and ate in the main room with the kids and watched TV. Very relaxing. All of the staff was very friendly. Would have been nice to have a coffee maker in the room. The location was perfect. One block to Crate & Barrel, 2 blocks from Macy's, 3 blocks from Water Tower Place. We visit Chicago at least once per year and have stayed at several hotels. This hotel was as clean as any, with the staff as friendly as any that we have stayed at. Staying on Michigan Avenue can be noisy. Location of hotel offsets the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- nice but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kayoung1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in Mid December on a Saturday night. The hotel is very nice in the general areas - you can tell it has been redone recently. Our room was very small which did not bother us too much as we were not there to hang in the room. Room was also redone recently. Bed was comfortable and location of hotel was wonderful in proximity to Michigan Ave. The bar was small but cozy. Parking is like everywhere- $48 a night. Pricey but non negotiable. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Allerton Hotel- great location for "everything Chicago", city noise tough on light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: bostontravels1
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Allerton for a long weekend to take in the sites of Chicago as well as attend the Bears game on 12/12/2010. It was our first visit to Chicago and the central location the Mag Mile was perfect- walking distance to everything! PROS: Safe, Central location & walkable to everything, clean rooms, yummy breakfast, GREAT fitness center, Raul -waiter during breakfast was GREAT, Bellhops very cordial, O'Hare travel board with arrivals and departures right in lobby. CONS: Ambulances, police cars going to Northwestern trauma center around the corner with siren at all hours of the night is tough on light sleepers, check-in staff was somewhat lethargic and not exactly eager to please, bar/lounge was sometimes not staffed and did not offer as great of scene as adjacent hotels. Despite the CONS, I would visit again, as it was well priced and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The Allerton Hotel was outstanding in every way.”
Reviews.Author: notpicky032
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for it's location and price, for a group of 8. It could not have turned out better. The location just off the middle of Michigan Avenue was perfect; we could walk to great shopping and restaurants. The concierge was outstanding with helpful advice for all our random questions. The rooms were great, has a good fitness center, fun bar. It was a great value in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Business travelers should look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ptraveler3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alleron while interviewing in Chicago for 2 nights. First off, they charge $10.00 per day for internet unless you want to go down to the small lobby for free internet where there is next to no work space. I could install my own router and pay for a month of internet service for cheaper than the Allerton charges. In addition, I will echo what others have said, the rooms are tiny, I was placed directly across from the elevator (not even 3 ft away from it) and heard people coming and going all night along with the ding of the elevator. To add to it, TWO of the glasses in the room had lipstick stains on them when I checked in. In summary, while the Allerton has a good location, there are cheaper, cleaner hotels in the area with FREE internet ( and not just in the lobby) where you will probably get a better night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “ouch!”
Reviews.Author: Amjam66
Reviews.Content: I am currently sitting on the bed nursing bruises and my luggage because their Petit room is WAY too tiny to house it on the floor. I am on the verge of smashing out the windows in order to prevent a claustaphobia attack from happening so miniscule is this room. I cannot even walk around the bed without banging into the fixtures and the bathroom is so narrow my kness touch the opposite wall when I'm on the toilet.How ridiculous...AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Barbara_Matt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allerton with one of my girlfriends for a night on the town and quick shopping trip. Upon arrival of the hotel, the lobby is trendy, very clean and nice. Then we got to our room. Tiny tiny tiny!!! This is the smallest room I have ever stayed in. Don't get me wrong, the room was decorated nicely, and the bathroom was all marble with a big all glass shower. The room was so small there wasn't really even space to put two suitcases on the floor. The bathroom was also small, with only a pedastal sink, so there was nowhere to set toiletries. For two women, this was a problem. The beds, although comfy, were really short, so tall people beware. Thankfully, we were only staying for one night, as any more time would have been difficult. The room was clean but there were a few things we noticed. The lampshade was cracked and torn, and there was some gouges in the walls...in my mind this is not acceptable for a hotel of this price. The elevators were also tiny, and slow, so we often had to wait if there were people in them. Overall the hotel was nice, just be prepared for the tiny accommodations. If you're only in town for a night or two and won't be spending time in your room, then I would recommend it, but definitely no more than 2 people per room. I do have to say the location of the hotel was perfect for shopping. Right in the hustle and bustle of Michigan Ave shopping, so that was perfect for us. Valet parking with in and out privleges was around 48$ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: carlsontraveler
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a little long trip to chicago. I stayed at 3 different hotels (hilton and marriott) due to the fact that i'm very bad at planin trips at at first i booked the allerton from october 23rd to the 27th, and when i tried to book the days before that i couldn't find rooms available on orbitz, but that's another story. After reading the reviews here, i was a little bit hessitant to stay there, and since i work in the hotel business managing the Front office area, i know what to expect about costumer service, and at this point; i didn't know what to expect after having terrible experiences at the other two hotels. After i checked out of the hilton i called and asked if the room was ready to check in and they said it was (being 10am) Walking in to the hotel was a bit tricky since the loby is on the 2nd floor and you have to take an elevator. Once at the lobby, Lindsey checked us in. Very professional. I had call prefiously to let them know that i wanted to upgrade my room to a larger room with a king size bed at the checked in even if i had to pay for it; so they did upgrade the room to 1219. Big room. The hotel is very nice and ellegant with an excellent location. Is right on the middle of the magnificent mile, bus stop right on the corner and the red line train station is 4 little blocks away so deff i think i made a great choice at staying there. Tthe staff is very professional, Lindsey and Alicia at the front desk, Mrs. Guadalupe the maid, The guy from the minibar department i cant remember his name but he speaks spanish. And 3 of the doormans. To all of them Thank you very much and Thanks to to the management for having such a great staff with you. The only problem i would have to complain, would be the bell man service (not all of the people by the way). There was an afroamerican guy who couldn't understand what we were saying. They kept our bags for a while since we were not going to be in the room and they don't have a key to access so when we came back from dinner and shopping, we explained that to him and he would say different things. Finally we told him that we were back and that our suitcases could be delivered to the room and he just brought the suitcases and handed it to us so we took it. I tought it was funny so i didn't say anything. I should be moving to chicago for school next year, and ill make a couple trips before that so i would deff stay there again. To the people who complains about the noise on the corridors. Where did you stay?

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: chagallvoyage
Reviews.Content: Got a really good online deal for Allerton. The location is excellent! Louis the concierge was fantastic. we chose a larger room based on the previews and it was a great room, well appointed but with little storage in the bathroom. Downside: the elevator and the lobby area on the second floor with people hanging on the first floor as we enter: weird.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but a bit cozy”
Reviews.Author: Rick735
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allerton for a wedding. Location is great, service is great, but being an older hotel the rooms and elevators are quite small. We upgraded to a a room with a king size bed, but is was very tight with just the two of us. The classic room is definitely a one person room. We would recommend but understand because its an older hotel the rooms are quite a bit smaller than modern ones. It has been updated and that was done very well.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent stay on the magnificent mile”
Reviews.Author: LRoseJ
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Cozy small rooms, comfortable bed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Complimentary wine in the evening was an added bonus. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraMc53
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short break at the Allerton and felt compelled to share the experience. I had an accident on the trip over and arrived at the hotel unable to walk. Everyone at the hotel were extremely helpful - they helped us hire a wheel chair for the duration of our stay and the staff on the door always helped us put the chair into the taxi and get it out on our return. Nothing was too much trouble. We were overwhelmed with the friendliness and helpfullness of all the staff we came into contact with and helped us make the best of a difficult situation. Thank you. Without you we may well have gone home early. Before we arrived at The Allerton I read the comments from other visitors who were commenting on the small size of the bedrooms. As far as we were concerned it was plently big enough - even for a folded up wheel chair. Maybe the UK traveller does not expect a very large room! It was very clean, extremely comfortable and the bed was fantastic! Bathroom too was clean and loved the large shower! The only thing which was a little annoying was that the television was on a far wall - not facing the beds. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better - right in the middle of everything! I intend to return to Chicago as soon as I can so I can experience everything NOT from a wheelchair view! Where will I be staying? The Allerton - DEFINATELY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, and Courteous!”
Reviews.Author: twofeebs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel visiting the first time in Chicago. We couldn't have been happier! This hotel was newly remodeled and oh so clean! The staff was wonderful and helped answer all of our questions regarding the city. The location was perfect, right in the middle of Michigan Ave. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located on Magnificent Mile, but good thing I'm short.”
Reviews.Author: akgilbert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allerton Hotel during a three day trip to Chicago in late September. This hotel is in a great part of Chicago, centrally located, enabling you to walk to noteworthy places such as the Hancock Tower, Navy Pier, and the many parks of downtown Chicago. One thing I did notice is that, like many older buildings, everything about this hotel is pretty small. Hallways are narrow, elevators can only hold 4 people comfortably and the room we had was.... cozy small I would say. I'm 5'2 and I didnt have to jump very high to touch the ceiling. I could imagine someone with claustrophobia not enjoying a stay here. For what we were in town for, this was a great hotel. I would recommend walking a few blocks west on Huron to L'Appetite for authentic Italian deli food, or one block east on Huron to Elephant and Castle for great pub-like food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice older hotel”
Reviews.Author: brendgo1
Reviews.Content: First of all there are no bargains for hotels in downtown chicago when the Bears are at home. Booked thru expedia got the bast rate for the area we needed, $48 for valet parking, walking distance from the John Hancock. I believe this hotel has done the best with what they can since it was built in the 1920's, elevators and room are small, lobby on second floor next to M lounge and restaurant. they offered a weekend brunch that we did not try free coffee in the lobby Comfy beds with lots of pillows but can hear any word that is spoken outside your room. heard the housekeepers conversation outside our door word for word while trying to sleep in late in the AM. Shower heads were great. I'd stay here again if the price was right, can't beat the location

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: musicman45
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago. The check in for the Allerton Hotel is on the second floor accessible by elevator. The elevators are small as this is an older building. The front desk people were nice. Hallways looked like it needed to be vacuumed more often. Our room was postage stamp size, double, with a view of a brick wall only a few feet away. The carpet was filthy. The toilet was the industrial power flush type, rather noisy, especially in the middle of the night (think 747 type). One tiny soap, shampoo/conditioner. I was shocked to see drinking glasses for guests. Should be plastic cups encased in a sealed wrapper. The room was fairly quiet. A strange wet spot started to develop between the double beds our first night there. It seemed like water was leaking from under the carpet. Called the front desk the next morning who sent the "hotel engineer" to check out this mysterious large wet spot. He was at a loss. We requested a change of room. We should have been upgraded for the hassle. Instead we got moved two rooms down(same double). The shower of this new room had no shelf to place soap, and other toiletries. Had to place these items on the floor of the shower. Fresh coffee in the lobby is a nice touch. Tried the overpriced "breakfast buffet" off of the front desk. Was not worth the effort. Dining room personnel seemed more annoyed that we were there. The concierge service very helpful. Recommended for the location only. We never did find out what was the cause of the leak in our first room even after several inquiries.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is good but the internet sucks”
Reviews.Author: windbird79
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean, food was wondreful, but the internet was the worst I have ever met. I paid $20/night for "high speed" internet but it took >5 min to open any single web site. The response I got from frontdesk was very irresponsible"you can pay $30/night for an even faster access".

Reviews.Title: “Very very comfy beds and location is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: stephenscreative
Reviews.Content: I've loved the hotel for years even when it was a Crowne Plaza. We did get a pretty good deal which is maybe why our beds faced forward and the TV was to our left. Not a very good location to watch anything. But other than that everything was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Type17
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value. Most of the rooms are a bit small by today's standards (the building dates from the 1920's), and most of them have a poor/boring view, but don't forget, the fabulous city of Chicago is outside - so what are you doing in the hotel room trying to look out the window? Location is superb, hard to beat at any price. Many 'good value' hotels in such central locations often cut corners on service or cleanliness, but the Allerton is fine in those regards - it really is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: Daisiegee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Allerton for 5 nights in September. I had booked through Hotels.com and got a great rate but I didn't realise at that time it was a small room. That's certainly not the hotels fault, and although we may not have had much space, the room was immaculate as was the bathroom. We had a view of the Water Tower from both the room and the bathroom. On checking in we were told of the free wine in the lobby bar mid afternoon--that was a nice surprise. The staff were lovely during the whole stay, I really could not fault any single aspect of the hotel. The location is great, we made full use of the CTA pass and used the buses up and down Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: imemine
Reviews.Content: Our weekend rate in July 2010 was about $160 per night and evne though the rooms are small they are newly refurbished. The breakfast is very good and the location is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “The Allerton is a hidden gem on the Miracle Mile”
Reviews.Author: dms11
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical of the Allerton since it is old with small windows and does not look particularly inviting from the outside. However, I was very pleasantly surprised. It may be the best hotel deal in downtown Chicago. Nearby Omni and Peninsular Hotels are considerably more expensive. My room was only $114/night, although that was a special (Northwestern U) rate. Nevertheless, the room was very attractive (see photos) and clean, bed was extremely comfortable (i.e. very firm), temperature was easily controlled, which includes being able to keep the fan on low (to prevent fan turning on and off during night, which often keeps me awake at other hotels). Room was also quiet, despite being directly across from elevators. And you cannot beat the convenience if you want to be in the Miracle Mile area north of downtown. Maid service was also good and unobtrusive. Hotel drawbacks include tiny and slow elevators; and lobby on second floor that can only be reached by elevator. It would be nice to have a stairway to/from ground level exit. Rooms were small, but that's what you would expect from a hotel of that age. They have made the most of the space they have. Fitness center is well equipped, including personal TV monitors, but a little difficult to get to. You have to take elevator to 24th floor, and then walk upstairs to next floor, which was very warm....but thankfully, the fitness center itself is kept nice and cool. One last point...I had a great view of downtown and Trump Tower from my room, but I did hear some people complain that they were looking at a wall. Best to ask for room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: island822
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Allerton was very nice. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a junior suite which was lovely. The hotel staff was very accommodating. We plan to stay at The Allerton when we are next in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast - Fawlty Towers style”
Reviews.Author: Veritas007
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is one of contrasts and I can only rate my stay as somewhat uncomfortable. On the plus side, the Allerton is located in a central and convenient part of Chicago and has a modern feel. I found the room to be OK and was not troubled by noise from ambulances, lumpy matresses or anything else for that matter. On the negative side, my breakfast experience was straight out of an episode of Fawlty Towers. Let me explain. I hate it when in a roomy dining area you are made sit so close to other diners you do not know that you can see their nasal hair, and this is what happened to me at the Allerton. When I suggested to the supervisor that you shouldn't sit guests on top of one another, she replied; 'it's so that you will talk'. Well, I did try to talk to the guy virtually on my table but he didn't want to which made us both uncomfortable. Note to Allerton; let people have some space in a large dining room. Other unpleasant aspects of my breakfasts included; having to ask if I could have some juice (rather than being offered some juice),being given the bill before even being asked if I wanted a cup of tea and having to plead for an extra portion of milk for my dietary breakfast cereal. Asking for the extra milk was like asking for the waiter for the pin number to his bank account. No, the staff need training and management needs a kick-up the backside for allowing these sorts of things to happen. Other irritating aspects were being told the night before that the tour booking person would be on duty the next moring when they were actually off that day and upon arriving and asking for a good place to eat, being directed to a place that required you to sell a kidney in order to finance the meal. They say elephants don't bite but mosquitos do - it's the little things that get under your skin.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel...its actually 3 star”
Reviews.Author: DeeJayKev
Reviews.Content: Front desk Service is rude....doorman and valet are kool... restaurant service was good..restaurant food was excellent.... This hotel claims to be a 4 star, but it is not, it is a 3 star pretending to be a four star, lobby is nice..fitness center is good....elevator is crowded and small....room is small and crappy for a 4 star....they have double beds only unless you get a suite. I paid 600 dollar for 5 nights for business and they put me in a studio room with one double bed...what the hell..the room are so tiny, and the front desk service is horrible....the hotel s own by the nearby doubletree , so it sucks! never gonna stay at the allerton again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's Ok”
Reviews.Author: ATravelVixen
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are in good condition, the bathrooms are in good condition, the amenities are OK. But, the windows are so small that you feel it's always afternoon. The pillows are so-so. The amenities had no body lotion and only one bar of soap. I like a handsoap and one in the shower. There are five elevators and when one opens you have to sprint because the elevator doors close so quickly that I was hit by a closing door twice (and have the bruising to show). The first night our room was not ready until 8.30PM due to a technical issue on a floor. The next night the aircondition was clacking all night long. They fixed it and gave me free internet for one night. The bartender was chatting each night with guests and was not paying much attention to the other guests. I have never seen anyone eat in the restaurant. But, complimentary coffee in the lobby. Free internet in the lobby but not the room. Fitness center good. Overall I was a little disappointed. This hotel could be great with just a little extra effort but it's just good. If you get a good rate, I recommend it. There are some food options around a great breakfast place (Corner Bakery) around the corner. But not a lot of them. You find yourself walking and looking. CocoPanza is a fantastic Italian place also just around the corner. Trader Joe's a few blocks away to stock up on water. The fridge can't be used for your things, it's a touch fridge that was also a bit dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Boutique size”
Reviews.Author: cndrocks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Allerton on the Miracle Mile for a 4 day get away. Loved it, it was small enough and boutique enough at a great value. We arrived a bit early for our stay before the 3pm check-in and they immediately accomadated us. In fact they gave us a lovely roon on the 24th floor looking out toward the river and Trump tower. Great view, lovely room, and top floor. Bed was huge and comfey and very clean. Marble bath, big screen TV and fast elevators, we never had to wait. The staff was very helpful and even recomended a great steak house the locals know about and got us out of the tourist zone. It is centrally located on Miracle Mile and a short hike to anything. If we didn't walk, we were able to take free transport. One of the best stays in a boutique style, unique hotel we have had in some time. We'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Right on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: ctbeachbm
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, small, boutique hotel right on the Magnificent Mile. It's very close to the wonderful Chicago subway system and major bus routes. Tourist attractions are a short distance away, and if you have kids the Navy Pier is less than a mile from the hotel. I paid approximately $130 per night, which is close to my max when staying alone. Not sure this hotel would be worth their rack rates. It's small with few amenities, but the 24 hour fitness center is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, tiny rooms...”
Reviews.Author: M.Photog.
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute trip so we decided to go cheap since we didn't plan to spend much time at the hotel. Booked the Allerton through Hotwire for $89 per night for two nights. Parking and check-in were reasonably efficient and courteous. Room seemed a bit musty, a call to the front desk resulted in the quick arrival of a housekeeper who seemed concerned and offered to send someone to check the AC. We discovered that the window would open and in no time some fresh air solved the problem. The house keeper even checked back to make sure the problem was solved. Again the rooms are small as are the halls and elevators but the property is reasonably well kept for a property of this level. I would give it 3.5* Concierge was helpful with directions and suggestions. I can't speak about the restaurant as we had other plans. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would consider another stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location....”
Reviews.Author: Arraminta32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allerton for one night, choosing it for the location (which is great) and the 4* rating. I booked directly with the hotel, after checking the prices on Expedia. I was offered a king room for the price of the petite room that Expedia was quoting. Check in was very quick and the staff were friendly. On entering the room we were pleased to see the large king sized bed with good quality sheets. Disappointing to see there was no bath and only a large shower cubicle (however the bathroom was very nice) I had to phone down for more showergel as we were only given 1 tiny bottle to use between the 2 of us! There was no tea/coffee making facilities which I thought was poor also the walls are paper thin and you can clearly hear the conversations going on next door! This hotel is in a great location, however there are several short falls which for a 4* hotel are disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, poor service, great location - not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: iambatgirl1027
Reviews.Content: We got a king suite through a really good deal on Expedia, but wow would I have been disappointed if we had paid full price for what we got. The hotel itself is nice (but very small - it's easy to see it's from a different era). When we checked in, the worker said, "I'm going to put you in a suite with two beds." I replied, "King suite?" and she said yes. We got up to our room to find they had put us in with two doubles! When we called the front desk, they said that was an "upgrade" because the room is slightly larger. Yes, it was, but a double bed is no substitute for a king. Eventually we got a new room. It's a cute boutique hotel, but nothing about it screams luxury to me. The front desk was snotty both at check in and check out, the room service was very limited (although that worker was extremely nice), the bellhop/doorman/valet wouldn't help us find a taxi, and it took almost 20 minutes for the valet to get us our car!! It wasn't even like it was busy or check out time, and the parking garage is right next door. We got a good deal and had a fine time, but definitely not returning back to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, great fitness room and location”
Reviews.Author: abbyy2000
Reviews.Content: My opinion of the Allerton started out on a very sour note, but I blame Priceline more than the hotel. This was my first time using Priceline. I asked for a 3plus star hotel and ended getting a very good deal in my preferred location. However, when I called the hotel to make the room request, I was shocked to discover that I had bid on a "petite" room with one full bed. The thought had never crossed my mind that I wouldn't be able to get a room with 2 double beds or a queen. As I was traveling with my teenage daughter, who is a very restless sleeper, this was disturbing news. I asked for an upgrade but they said that they could not guarantee anything before check-in. When I arrived at the hotel, after initialing saying there were no upgrades available, a very helpful concierge and desk receptionist searched the computer and found a junior suite at a very reasonable extra charge. The room was very nice--2 double beds--, 2 flat screen tv's, a couch, clean, roomy bathroom (shower only). I am a fitness fanatic, so I was thrilled with the fitness facility, which had several treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, multi-stations and free weights. The hotel is also just a few blocks from the river, with great running/biking trails. The hotel itself is right on the Magnificent Mile, a shopping heaven, which made for a very happy teenage daughter. In retrospect, I would've preferred to be a little closer to the loop and Millenium Park, but we had no problem getting to where we wanted to go-Museum of Science and Industry, Willis Tower, navy Pier. The transportation system is easy to navigate and reliable. My one complaint about the Allerton is that housekeeping/maintenance was not very attentive to our requests-we had several light bulbs missing or burned out but they never fixed it. We ended up having an enjoyable stay (thanks to the suite), but I'll probably stay somewhere else the next go-around. This was my first trip to Chicago and I'd like to go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: crystal027
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allerton from July 9-13th. I surprised my boyfriend with a trip for his birthday. At first everything was wonderful! They upgraded our room to a suite with no charge and the concierge recommended wonderful places to eat! The location is great if you're there to shop. So basically everything was great until we got home & got our bank statement! They charged us $250.00 for a smoking fee in a non-smoking room! Funny thing is neither of us smoke!!!!! So we got the bank statement & called the hotel who supposedly has pictures of this & still haven't gotten a call back so they can show us these so called "pictures"! So now we have to go through the entire dispute with our bank because they won't call us back! Right before we went there the only bad thing I heard from people is that charges have appeared on peoples credit card on "accident". I didn't think this would be a problem considering we booked through Expedia. I recommend if you stay at this hotel, book through a travel agency & give them a fake credit card to hold when you check in because from what it sounds like 95% of the time they will overcharge you! I am appalledthey would charge us with smoking when I think smoking is absolutely disgusting! If you like taking risks with your money then stay here! Otherwise I would recommend a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money - smallest hotel room I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: EPmom13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Allerton because we wanted an older, historic hotel with some character. It is a beautiful hotel that has been remodeled. My main complaint was the size of the room. I have had some small rooms, but this was, by far, the smallest. My best guess at the dimensions of the room - which included 2 double beds - is approximately 10-12 feet wide and 18-20 feet long, not including a large bathroom off the entryway. There is a small desk, but that unfortunately blocked the entrance into the room, so it was extremely difficult to get our luggage into the room. There was no coffeemaker or refrigerator, either. And as with most downtown hotels, parking was $35 per night. It is a beautiful hotel and has a wonderful location, but for the money, I would try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: recorder
Reviews.Content: We came here because we too found that our internet reservations were non-existent. We got a room and were told we could have four people, they just didn't tell us that two of us would have no bed. However at that late date we were glad not to be sleeping under a bridge or 10 miles out in the suburbs. We payed rack rate plus and will figure how to pay for it later. The hotel is conveniently located, clean, rooms are large enough, staff is pleasant. Our room next to the elevator enabled us to hear many conversations all night long as revellers came out of the elevator in high spirits. Are manners completely gone?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: OhioSuzy
Reviews.Content: I went here for a two day trip with my daughter. We got a great deal through Expedia. The hotel was easy to find. Make sure that you are prepared to wait to pull into the drop-off area. I was thrown a little when all three places were filled and I had to pull over in the road as far to the side as I could, meanwhile there was traffic all around me. It worked out and they parked the car for us in the parking garage. Check-in was a breeze. We did pay the $48.00 a day parking,but if you come in a car you really have no choice. Parking is very expensive in the entire city. Our room was a king bed room. It was very clean and comfy. We had a perfect view of the Water Tower. The bathroom was small and had only a shower, but that worked out just fine for us. Some other reviewers have complained about how small the elevators are and yes they are small, but there are five or six and we had no problems with waiting. One must remember that this is an older renovated hotel which adds to its charm. The hotel maintenance/staff were super friendly and helpful. Everyone who worked there made a point to say hello or ask if they could help us. The location and price cannot not be beat. I will definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming with great location”
Reviews.Author: meow55
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this wonderful hotel through an Internet deal. The hotel has a fabulous location, right in the heart of the Mag Mile. Also, the service was excellent- we had some challenges with an error that I made with the reservation (accidently selecting the wrong month), and they were very helpful in assisting us in working it out. I would certainly stay there again, and recommend it to others. The location alone, not to mention the charming atmosphere, makes it a great choice for a downtown Chicago experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: 3fivesix
Reviews.Content: Be careful when booking with any internet hotel site and/or this hotel. I showed up to my prepaid stay at the Allerton only to be told that since the site I used didn't pay in time there was no room for me - they were completely booked- and my room (which was paid 5 weeks in advance) was not available, in fact no room was available! This has never happened to me and I travel often! Perhaps it was not the hotels fault that the site was in breech of contract, but in the interim they had released my room without contacting me. And I was told that the city was "sold out" I should head back to the airport to look for a room. Really awful customer relations! After prolonged negotiations, I was given a room (which I had to put on my credit card) and of course I had a chargeback placed on the original booking. If I had not stuck around and demanded that this be fixed, they would have sent me out to the street. No excuses for this kind of sloppiness.

Reviews.Title: “Great European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneDoeOntario
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at the Allerton with my husband. The lobby and rooms were beautifully decorated in a modern style. Check-in was fast, efficient, and friendly. Contrary to many reviews, front desk staff were friendly throughout our visit, and very helpful (e.g., re: directions, "El" train information, etc.) Perhaps they have changed in response to some of the poor reviews? The room and bathroom were small, but what we were expecting. This worked out fine for us, but if you are a larger person the bathroom may feel quite cramped. The bathroom only had a shower - not sure if some rooms are different. Again, fine for us but might not work for everyone. They were a little stingy w/ towels, just one set (bath, hand, facecloth) per person. The room was very clean. I may not choose to stay there if I had to spend a lot of time in the room - the only seating was a single desk chair, but it was fine for our purposes and what it lacked in space it made up in style. Gorgeous white leather headboard. iPod dock alarm clock was a nice touch, too. Had drinks at the bar one night - good drinks and service, comfortable, stylish atmosphere. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant one morning - good food but a little pricey for what we got. Good service throughout the meal but very slow with the bill - had to ask several times over 15 minutes. Used the fitness room one day - good basic assortment of cardio and some weight machines and free weights. Water dispensers and towels (both room temperature and wet refrigerated) were provided. Overall, I would stay here again with my husband in a heartbeat. I would probably not stay here with kids because of the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: NatalieT22
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Good service & available staff (although staff at reception can be harsh/snobby). Great amenities (gym, restaurant, lounge, wireless internet, free coffee at lobby level in the morning). Good decor. Clean. Comfortable. Small but practical rooms (European concept) because this is a historical building that has been modernized.

Reviews.Title: “Room not as expected”
Reviews.Author: tripleplaz
Reviews.Content: We requested two double beds. When we checked in we were given a double bed and pull out couch and were told this was all they had. We went out for the evening and when we returned we found that the pull out couch was not made up. At 3 a.m. we were not calling housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “We will NEVER stay at the Allerton Hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: I_love_beaches_2
Reviews.Content: First of all, I will say that we went to Chicago to stay overnight before my husband was to have outpatient surgery at Northwestern Memorial Hospital on the morning of Monday, July 19, 2010. He had to arrive at Northwestern at 6:00 a.m. for a 7:30 a.m. start for his surgery. We had our two teenage boys (ages 16 & 14) with us and wanted to be in a hotel that was close to the hospital since we were letting them stay and sleep while I got my husband checked in at the hospital. The location of the hotel in proximity to the hospital was excellent, but that was the only positive thing about our stay at the Allerton. We arrived about 10 minutes or so before the 3:00 p.m. check-in time on Sunday afternoon. I attempted to check in, but the young man at the front desk, Alex, said that our room (I had booked a King Junior Suite) wasn't ready yet. He said it was clean, but still needed to be checked before we could use it. I was fine with that since we were a few minutes early and it wasn't a problem with us to wait a little while. After we had been waiting in the lobby for an hour, I went up to the front desk and spoke with Alex again, asking him if he had any news on our room. He said that he kept calling to see if it was ready, but it wasn't yet. I went back to sit with my husband and two boys, but I could tell that they were starting to get frustrated as well. Another 45-50 minutes passed before my husband, who isn't in the best health right now and was a bit nervous about his surgery the following day, went to the front desk to inquire about our room only to be told that it wasn't clean yet. This was disappointing news to hear, especially to my husband as he really needed to lay down and rest after the trip to Chicago and the situation was stressing him out. He even tried calling the hotel to speak with a manager, but was directed to the front desk and wasn't offered an opportunity to speak with the manager.
