About 10 minutes or so after he called, a person came up to my husband and finally gave him key cards to a room and said that it was an upgrade. We got to the room (#1514) and it looked just like the picture I saw online of the King Junior Suite (which is what I had booked), so I called the front desk to see if it really was an upgrade and they said, "Yes, it is an upgrade. You have one of our specialty suites." I said okay, thanked the gentleman on the phone, and hung up. The room was definitely on the small side and I didn't feel that we got a good value for the $299.00 that we paid for the room, including the dismal check-in events. The bathroom was small and, considering that there were 4 of us in the room, it would have been nice to have something more than a small shelf above the sink to put our toiletry items. After my husband rested a bit, we headed out to dinner at Gino's East on the next street over from the Allerton. It was nice that the hotel was close to the restaurant and we loved the pizza and appetizers (calamari & spinach and artichoke dip with crusty garlic bread) we ate there. The service was wonderful as well...we would definitely eat there again!! Our oldest son and my husband went back to the hotel to rest their full bellys after dinner and our youngest son and I ventured out on Michigan Avenue to find the movie set area where they were filming Transformers 3. After we saw the movie set and took some pictures of it and the Transformer cars we headed back to the hotel. The boys were going to be sharing a pull-out couch to sleep on that night, so I told them to get it ready for the night. They pulled out the bed, only to find a bare mattress. I started looking around the room for sheets for the pull-out and was only able to find an extra blanket and a pillow, so I called down to the front desk to request some sheets for the pull-out and they said that housekeeping would be up right away with the sheets. I thanked the gentleman, hung up the phone, and waited...and waited...and waited. After about 30 minutes, I called down to the front desk again to say that housekeeping hadn't brought the sheets and that I had two boys that needed to get to sleep and it was getting late (11:30 at night), so if they could bring the sheets soon, I would really appreciate it. It took another 10 minutes for housekeeping to bring the sheets to our room. The gentleman did offer to put the sheets on the bed for us and I told him thank you, but it wasn't a problem for me to do it, so I took the sheets from him and made the bed myself. We did have to put the coffee table in a corner of the room in order to be able to give the pull-out enough room on the floor. Also, there was only about 6 -8 inches between the end of the pull-out bed and the wall to walk, which I thought was pretty narrow of an area to have to navigate in the dark. The next morning, my husband and I took turns getting ready in the small bathroom before we headed to Northwestern for his surgery. On the way to the elevator, my husband noticed something in a corner and pointed it out to me. I looked down to where he had pointed and saw a huge brown cockroach that was about 1 1/2 inches long! That sealed it, we decided at that moment that we were never going to stay at the Allerton Hotel again! The check-out process did go smoothly and an extra charge for internet use (we only had 1 use, not 2) that was on our bill was promply removed without incident. I was disappointed with our stay at the Allerton Hotel, partly because my husband and I had stayed there for a getaway 11 years ago and had loved the hotel and staff when we were there before and we were looking forward to that experience again. Sadly, we didn't get to have that same experience with our boys this time. Since my husband's medical team is located at Northwestern Memorial Hospital and we will be making frequent trips to Chicago for his care, we will occasionally need a peaceful place to rest and stay overnight. Unfortunately, due to our most recent experience there, it will not be at the Allerton Hotel. For his next appointment, which is this coming Tuesday, July 27, 2010, we will be spending the night at The Avenue Crowne Plaza, which is next door to the Allerton Hotel and is just a bit closer to Northwestern Memorial Hospital. Plus, The Avenue gave us a reduced rate since my husband is a patient at Northwestern, which the Allerton was unable to do for the night we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but very very pricy for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: CRO_10
Reviews.Content: Bedroom is extremely small, you can barely move inside it. Overal the place is pretty but staff are VERY VERY UNFRIENDLY. I asked the receptionist a couple of questions and she was extremelly impolite and rude, had no patience at all to help. When we checked-out, we had over charges on our bill, SO MAKE SURE YOU CHECK YOUR BILL! They corrected what was wrong, but again in a very impolite way, instead of apologizing. ROOM WAS EXTREMELLY EXPENSIVE FOR WHAT YOU GET (we payd $206/night). Very expensive vallet parking service as well. Another bad point is that they say you can get free internet at the lobby, but there are almost NO PLUGS THERE! So to me is the same as saying: "we don't want you to use internet in the lobby". I stayed in another hotel in Chicago/Magnificent area for the same price, and was happy with that hotel (Marryot), but not happy with Alerton.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel takes "boutique" to another level”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_savannahga
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we found out that the Allerton charges double the amount for valet overnight parking ($48.00 p/night) then any other hotel located in the Magnificent Mile. I've stayed in plenty "boutique" hotels before but this one is so small that the guest check-in is located on the second floor, the bathrooms are very narrow and smaller than a walk-in closet. The room is so small that my favorite word for the trip was "excuse me" because that's what I found myself saying over and over again to move around the room, my husband & our luggage which couldn't fit into the tiny closet. The pictures are very misleading!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - nice hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: TN-Bill
Reviews.Content: A co-worker of my wife comes to Chicago several times of year and recommended the Allerton. I normally like chains for their consistency, but I called the hotel directly and got the best rate in the area. I had read some reviews that made me a little nervous, but we knew folks that had stayed. We couldn't have been more pleased! Pluses: (1) Location, location, location! Right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile shopping area (even though we didn't shop). It's very close to the Hancock building and about three blocks from the Red Line Chicago street station. (2) Price. (3) the room was very comfortable and sized as advertised "Petite" with a double bed. But we really used it only to sleep and shower. It was also very clean (except for a little mold in the shower). Our room was right on Michigan Ave on the 13th floor, but it was pretty quiet. Minuses: None really. Things we did: Hancock building observatory (great), double-decker bus tour (good, would have been great except for getting caught in traffic due to a parade and something blocking Mich Ave and it was HOT), boat ride from the Chicago River out to the late to see Navy Peer fireworks (good), took Red line to Wrigleyville and was able to get $10 Cubs tickets from a guy on the street (at our own risk, but the tickets worked). Transportation: Don't rent a car! Take the train from Midway or O'hare. $2.25.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: finesilver
Reviews.Content: Lots of choices nearby, saw the Allerton had a suite at a decent price, much more reasonable than any of the nearby hotels. We stayed one night, nice location, cool room and great service. Expensive 24 hour parking, but comparable to all others in the same area. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,tiny rooms and the beds are bad”
Reviews.Author: mbcge69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allerton this past weekend and wasn't that impressed at all. The hotel itself is pretty nice. It had a nice bar and a nice looking restaurant,I didn't go into either so I cannot give a review about service or food. The first room I stayed in was VERY tiny,the bed was a double and had no frills. The room itself was decorated nicely and the bathroom was nice,but the bed was terrible. Part of the reason you stay at a hotel is to sleep,right??? Well I didn't get any of that to speak of. The next morning I complained to the front desk and talked to the reservations manager and she was very nice. She offered to switch me to a bigger room with a King size bed and an actual view. Seemed nicer upon first glance. But after going to bed that night it was the same story with the mattress. I could feel the springs and didn't get any sleep that night either. Needless to say I got up the next day and checked out early to go home, not the original plan, all bleary eyed and sleep deprived. I almost forgot,the hotel itself is located just off Michigan Ave. Northwestern hospital is located just 1/2 block east and the roar of ambulances can be heard at all hours, it seemed like just about every 20 minutes or so you would hear one screaming past to get to the ER. I would skip this hotel for sleeping and maybe have a drink to check out the old building and that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: lec1727
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 2 nights at the Allerton for a weekend trip to Chicago. We had never been to Chicago before, arrived after dark, and for simplicity, valet parked in the garage next to the hotel. We were quickly checked in and had a room on the 15th floor with a king bed, desk, tv, and a view of the fire escape. There was nothing spectacular about the room & it didn't seem very modern or contemporary except for the Ipod docking station that is too small for an Iphone. The room was nicely sized but the bathroom was very very tiny. It is adequate for 2 people that don't plan on spending much time in the room because the location is excellent. The beds are firm, but I like firm; pillows very lumpy, and the walls very thin. Or we could have possibly just had loud neighbors. When I got into bed it looked like there was a smudge of makeup or something on the coverlet. I just moved the sheet over it. The problem we experienced was at checkout. We had booked the room by calling the hotel after researching prices online at expedia.com & at the Allerton's website. Their website advertises best price guarantee. Well we found a significantly cheaper price on expedia, called and they agreed to match it. On our confirmation email, it had a different price, but at the bottom was a notation with the guaranteed rate that was found on expedia. The bill that we received under our door on the day of checkout had the higher price and at checkout we mentioned this and asked for the bill to be corrected. The employee was not very friendly, made us wait while he shuffled through a number of other papers before he tapped the employee standing next to him to look at our email confirmation. The other employee then asked us for proof of that price and told us we needed a printout of the expedia rates. After explaining that nothing like that was mentioned when booking the room and if it had been we would have just booked through expedia to simplify the process, he told the employee that had been helping us at first to change it. This took at least 10 minutes, we received no apology for the inconvenience, weren't asked about our stay, and were not thanked for staying there. I feel that this is very poor customer service. We won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!! 5 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: bdoll2324
Reviews.Content: We attended the ASTD Conference this week and stayed at the Allerton. Our experience was outstanding from the moment we checked. The hotel is centrally located to everything. The front staff is great with warm greetings. The rooms are adorable! They are not the biggest but who stays in the room all day! Even the bar was wonderful! Next trip to Chicago- the Allerton will be the hotel I stay in. Thanks for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “A solid start to our holiday.”
Reviews.Author: babydinosaur
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel on the Magnificent Mile. Beautifully decorated and very clean. Staff welcoming and helpful. Only niggle was that we booked via Expedia reserving a room with a view. However found ourselves on the 7th floor with not much to look at. We were told no other rooms available and that Expedia often offer such reservations that the hotel itself can't promise on your arrival. Not too bad as it turned out because the room we had been put in was an upgrade to a suite anyway. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Greenie21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allerton for a week's sightseeing in the middle of a business trip. As a female travelling alone, I never felt less than safe at this hotel, which is very important to me. I preferred the reception area on the second floor for that reason. The room was plenty big enough and I had a great view up Michigan Avenue, which, considering I got the room through Priceline, I wasn't expecting, especially as the hotel was more full than it expected to be, due to the volcano in Iceland disrupting travel. The location is ideal - close to the main shopping areas, with bus and El routes very close. If you're travelling from O'Hare, the best route seems to be taking the blue line to Jackson, then the red line to Chicago, or catch a 66 bus. The buses are modern, and the stops are announced, which makes it nice and easy. You need Michigan and Huron, if you're taking the bus. When I asked the route to the attractions I wanted to see, the desk clerks were friendly and helpful. My room was a little more stylish than the average hotel room, and wasn't that depressing brown many hotels use. Black, cream and blue were the main colors. I did have some problems when I arrived - the window in my room wouldn't close and the TV didn't work, but an engineer arrived within half an hour and put it all to rights, and I didn't have any more trouble. I had to use the Internet to keep in touch, but didn't use the paid version in my room. The lobby area was comfortable, but I have to say that the signal was lousy. If you want an anonymous hotel with a bland presence, stay somewhere else. If you want somewhere a bit more individual and quirky, the Allerton's for you. All in all a pleasant stay and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: njp313
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and the staff is just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms have an odd layout”
Reviews.Author: jerseyshoredeb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely appointed but I did not find the rooms to be functional at all. The room was small, the closet so small I couldn't fit my carry-on suitcase in it and pants could not hang straight down without hitting the safe. Besides the desk, there are really no places to put anything since the nightstands are so small and with the lamp on each one leaves no room for anything else. No dresser - the only drawers were in the tiny nightstand. There was no space in the bathroom for toiletries. Somehow I got a handicapped bathroom, so it was huge but had no space at the same time. I do have to say that the water in the shower/tub was really hot. The menu in the restaurant didn't look all that great to me and was slightly overpriced. There is a wine reception from 4:30-5:30 each day and the bar/lounge area was nice for a drink. The location is great - right in the middle of Michigan Avenue. This is my new corporate hotel, so we'll see if I got a flukey random room this time and will get a better room next time. I'll be visiting the Allerton often in the future.

Reviews.Title: “LESS THAN IMPRESSIVE...WILL NOT RETURN”
Reviews.Author: Tsaksa
Reviews.Content: Went on a girls weekend with my sisters and stayed at The Allerton on friends recommendation. First service oops was a huge black hair ball crawling out of the shower drain. I must say though, housekeeping was up to remove it right away. The shower was also full of black mold and mildew. We booked a double room with two full size beds and the room was just big enough for the two beds, they also stuffed in a desk and armoire. Could barely move around and the beds. Our "city view" was a Dentist office, for $350 for two nights we would have liked a more interesting view. The second evening after a day of shopping we came back to drop off bags and found that our key cards had been deactivated. The concierge brought up replacements right away which didnâ€™t work either. After all that we found that they had failed to swipe our credit card on arrival and had deactivated our cards due to their error. We wasted about 30 minutes trying to sort this out. All they could offer was an insincere apology. On the morning of checkout we opened the door to leave and found our room service bill thrown the middle of the hall with personal information on it by security none the less. Again all the front desk had to offer was a pathetic sorry. I must say the concierge service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice staff, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: schinvst
Reviews.Content: The travel agency or the hotel screwed up the reservation but the staff at the front desk were on it and got it handled. Not a big deal, could have been. As soon as my son hit the room he reorganized the refrigerator. The desk cleared the incidental charges up right away. Staff, bellboys, super nice, lots of good information. Hotel put Mom & Dad and kids on different floors, per request by both parents and kids, which was a real winner. Parked the car in a garage a block away for $20 a day less than valet, did not use the car at all. Small rooms, but who stays in the rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Location Great - Rooms Very Small -Gym Awful - Not Terribly Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisSharon
Reviews.Content: A great location - especially if you're staying for a Magnificent Mile shopping trip. Love the decor - very cool. I read all of the reviews about small rooms --- they are right. This is definitely more suitable for a solo traveler. My check-in experience was below average....they did not have record of my reservation. Desk clerk assured me she would look into the "lost" reservation & make sure I'm not double-charged & my reservation would be well documented. Upon check-out - the new desk clerk knew nothing about this & there were no notes on file. The person who checked me out was darn-right rude. The gym -- first, it is very difficult to find & walking up the back stairway by the boiler room is quite unsettling. Secondly, the door was wide open - a room key was not necessary to enter, which I feel is a serious security issue. You are isolated on the 25th floor & there is nothing to prevent someone from walking in . If something did go wrong --- no one would know! Very scary. Lastly - the air conditioning made an awful sound during the night --- I kept telling myself...it's a historic building, so I tried to ignore it. But - it really did make for an uncomfortable night since it was very warm, windows did not open & the air conditioning was incredibly loud. :( Would I stay again? No.

Reviews.Title: “For the location, a fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: avmiddleton
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Allerton--- I keep coming back because the location along Mich Ave is really key. For what you can spend at larger hotels a few blocks away, The Allerton is a steal (though their rates skyrocket during big events in Chicago). If you are traveling with a spouse/partner, skip their smallest room and bump up to the larger king bed option. The only downside to this hotel is service--- they improve every time I am there, but they've yet to fully master the art of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “price/value ratio and more”
Reviews.Author: GMGMissouri
Reviews.Content: Reservation/Arrival Unfortunately there is not much room when arriving with a car. Unpacking, and in our case with 2 children and lot of luggage was very rushed and unsafe. Also, I have to question that we had to leave our car key on the dashboard of our unlocked car for the valet to park it later (anybody could have jumped into the car and driven off). Meanwhile, our luggage was more or less sitting unsupervised in the foyer. The doorman and the other person in the foyer were never really able to keep total control over our property. My husband and I had to separate in order to check-in and keep our property (luggage and car) safe. A better solution needs to be developed. I give very poor marks for this part of the check-in procedure. Check-out/Departure Car return and luggage pick-up was efficient and staff was courteous. Guestroom We had booked a double room. The decor was pleasant, but the set-up was poorly planned. After a long day I would have liked to lie down in bed and watch some TV. Due to the set-up that was not possible (bed faced the windows but TV was on another wall away from the beds. I had to sit at the desk in order to watch TV. I changed rooms explaining my disappointment and was given promptly another room. Thinking this resolved the issue, I gladly accepted, only to find out it was the same kind of room (set-up) only several floors up. I checked with the front desk again and only then it was explained to me that this type of room has this particular set-up. When I reserved the room on your website there was never the mention of such an awkward and inconvenient design. If I had known I would have never booked this type of room. Also, the bathroom had no bathtub and most importantly, hardly any space to place toiletries for all of us. I had to keep everything in the room on the desk. Even my husband had no room for his few items. Decor was nice but the room has a poor layout and not enough room. The room is more adequate for one person than for 2 adults and 2 small children. Hospitality of Hotel Staff The concierge at the time of our check in didn't explain certain room arrangements right away to me and therefore I spend almost 45 minutes until I was informed why I didn't get the room I had anticipated. The bellhop was very patients and very courteous the entire time and expressed his sympathy. Overall Stay Overall, I expected much more for the money I spent. The location is great and the decor is wonderful but there is more to it. The price/value ratio is off. Also, standard these days is at least a coffee maker and a small refrigerator in the room (even cheap motels have that), and $3.00 for a bottle of water. Wow. Thank goodness there is a Walgreens just around the corner!! ! For a hotel in this price class, that should have been complementary and is not acceptable. Overall I am disappointed with my stay. I expected from a hotel in this price class and your history more. Chicago is also a tourist destination and not only a place for business travelers who might not see what I have seen in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for location”
Reviews.Author: bobcatts
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for a mid-week stay through Priceline. It is true that the rooms are tiny but the decorations were nice and the rooms were cleaned daily. There were Bath & Body Works shampoo and soap. We had a room right on Michigan Ave. If you have the chance to go up to the work out room on the top floor (a little hidden and hard to find), it has one of the nicest views. The entrance is on a side street and the check-in is on the second floor. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a nice time. I'd recommend this hotel for the location. It is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “insanely cluttered closet-sized rooms, not the cleanest”
Reviews.Author: Jazykoved2
Reviews.Content: OK, so this is an older hotel and the rooms are small. I can live with that. But then why cram the room with inappropriate and useless furniture (do we really need an ottoman?), and arrange it so that the TV can't be pointed at the bed. Not to mention hanging a bizarre piece of white cushioning in a frame behind the head of the bed -- guaranteed to get dirty and vaguely disgusting. I've stayed in worse, but it would have been so easy to compensate for the small rooms with appropriate modern and minimal furniture that could have made the rooms pleasant. And it would have been easier to keep clean as well. The bathroom is the size of a phone booth. OK, I'll survive. But then why put in an oversized shower, leaving so little room that you can hardly use the toilet, since it's underneath the towel ring and hemmed in on one side by the shower door and on the other by the train-compartment-sized sink -- which has no usable ledge for your stuff because there's no room! They have to place the towels on a chair outside, since there's no room in the bathroom itself. I also didn't appreciate the squished bugs on the ridged wallpaper, the kleenex box with three kleenex left in it (never replaced once there were no kleenex left), the dirty cushion they kept placing on the (I hope) clean sheets of the bed each day, and so on and so on. Not the worst, as I say, but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Cublove
Reviews.Content: The Allerton was all that I thought it would be. Unique, huge, and super tiny rooms. I was told by multiple people how small the rooms were, but got this one on priceline. I was not disappointed b/c I knew what to expect. It was very clean, with nice urban decor. I had a great view over Michigan Avenue, so certainly can't complain about that either. For anyone wanting to experience Chicago through Michigan Ave, restaurants, shopping, etc...it's a very ideal location. Just remember, if you are traveling as a family, or with friends, you may end up in a room that is about the size of a closet.

Reviews.Title: “Stop being such cheapskates”
Reviews.Author: Jill7394u48
Reviews.Content: I went to the RSNA medical congress last December and stayed at the Allerton for about 7 nights. The hotel was disappointing on arrival, nothing at all like a 4-star hotel. All my colleagues were complaining about the size of their rooms, I was ok since I was alone. On the first night, the hair dryer blew up the first time I turned it on. I had to call four times for it to finally be replaced. It took well over an hour. On the first day, the bathroom had one tiny soap (for the bathtub and the sink) and one set of shampoo/conditioner little bottles. Naturally, I was expecting that these toiletries would be substituted every day, little did I imagine that they would NEVER be replaced, for an entire week. Luckily for me there was a drugstore just a block away. I didn't even bother to complain. They weren't worth my time. I had never seen anything like this at any hotel. Anywhere in the world. What can these people be thinking? The location is excellent. The view was nice (I was above the 20th floor). Everything else about the hotel was just passable. The business center consists of two computers and two very dirty mouse pads. How about changing them once a year, guys??? Maybe, huh? Or is that too much to ask? I might stay there again (I'll try to remember to take my own computer) , only because of the location, but I will probably prefer to try another hotel in the area, if available.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: jgall311
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the Allerton for a romatic weekend in downtown Chicago. I reserved a king junior suite and that is not what I got. The room did not match the discription of the room at all, It was so off we took our luggage back down stairs to let the hotel staff know that they gave us the wrong room. The staff told me that the room was correct and that it was a good room. I have never been more dissapointed in hotel in my untire life. Two of the three mornings there was a bug in the shower and when we checked in there was a dirty towel on the floor in the bathroom. The location was great and within walking distance of everything you could want, but that does not make up for the $150 it cost to park for three nights. Also the room discription said that we would have a view of the mag. mile but the only thing we could see out of our small window was a fire escape and the other wall of the hotel. So to recape, the hotel is in a good location but it is not the cleanest or do you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave anything in your car for valet to steal”
Reviews.Author: jimcubs1379
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok but I had my corporate laptop stolen by valet. They of course pretended to know nothing about it and even told me that there are "blind spots" where the cameras in the garage probably wouldn't see an individual in my car? When I got into my car there was loud Rap music playing that was obviously not being played by me and my wife on the radio when I left them the car. . . unexectable. What gives these people the right to change channels on my radio and steal my possesions when I trust them w/ my keys???!!! I'll leave it up to Chicago PD to check the cameras because I filed my report this morning and someone needs to be held accountable. NEVER valet your car with these criminals if you even want to risk staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated older hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: eastleland
Reviews.Content: The service was good, particularly the entertaining and knowledgeable bellman. The room was comfortable if small, but I do not go to Chicago to sit in the room. I did not eat breakfast there so I cannot comment on that. There is a large pricy parking garage up the street that primarily services nearby hospitals.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully updated historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKim59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a girlfriend to celebrate my 50th birthday. Staff could not have been nicer. We were upgraded to a suite and the beds were so comfortable. Cabaret music on Wed & Saturdays - great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Style, Great Location, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michigan_Traveller72
Reviews.Content: Situated on the corner of Michigan Avenue and Erie, with a view of the Water Tower from our room, I couldn't have asked for a better location. I truly enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The decor was chic without being overdone. The room was also tastefully decorated, although incredibly small. Having stayed in many hotels in Europe, I'm used to small rooms, but this felt especially cramped. We had ordered room service for breakfast the first morning and quickly realized how much of a mistake that was. We were balancing plates on our laps on the bed in order to eat. For two people it just really didn't work. I think the room would have been perfect for one person. I was also a bit disappointed in the charge for internet in the room. With two people, both with laptops staying three nights, that would have really added up. While wireless was free in the lobby, it is inconvenient to pack up the laptop and bring it down there. Plus it was a challenge to find an outlet near seating areas. I would have rated it a five on cleanliness except on the first morning that I woke up, I went to throw away something in the trash bin under the desk, and there was a pop bottle and chip wrapper in there that did not come from us. Overall the staff was welcoming and helpful. My one complaint would be at the bar in the lobby where the bar tender acted as if he were doing us a favour to wait on us. I wasn't too impressed with that. Nor was I impressed with the 18% gratuity automatically added to our bar tab. The tab accidentally got charged to our room twice, but that was quickly remedied upon check out. I did like the hotel and would definitely stay there again, but would try for a larger room if I'm travelling with my partner again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Slow, and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: PinotNoir25
Reviews.Content: After hearing such great reviews of the Allerton I was disapointed in my stay. The rooms were shockingly SMALL as were the hallways and restaurant/bar area. The elevators are VERY small and VERY SLOW. Once one elevator arrived only 3 people could fit into an elevator, or one person and some luggage. With 28 floors and only 3-4 elevators, you can imagine how tedious this becomes. There were several snafus with my billing and check-out, I was accidently charged twice for parking among some other mess-ups. Two personal items of mine ended up missing -- and the housekeeping staff denied ever seeing them... hmmm... and down the hall from us there were dirty room-service trays of food that sat in the hallway all weekend with no one bothering to clean them up. GROSS! The only highlight of the stay was the bathroom -- which was nice. Unless you don't care a dime about good service and a relaxing hotel stay, than the Allerton is for you because even though it's cheap rates are alluring, you truly get what you pay for at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome manager Tracy”
Reviews.Author: pixelrenderer
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to this Hotel by my friend who lives in Chicago. Got really good rates from Expedia. Had an issue to deal with and the manager Tracy solved it effortlessly and instantly. One person can make a big difference with your stay! Pros: Good service, good manager, great location. Cons: Have to pay for wireless (except on 2nd floor), small room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: mjhd
Reviews.Content: Booked a stay here through an ad on travelzoo for $89 w/tax. Mostly clean rooms, friendly staff, GREAT location! Room was small but I was expecting as much. The location was absolutely perfect. My only complaint is that my friend dropped my parking stub at the front desk for me at 10:45PM and when I went to pick it up at 7:45AM, they could not find it. I had to wait 30 minutes for the parking garage to locate my car. This leads me to believe their front desk is poorly managed. Also, it was busy and their elevators are SMALL! Sometimes it took us 10 minutes to catch one. Would definitely stay here again though!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: copans
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. When checking in, the front desk manager (Tracy Hunter) selected 3 other rooms for us to look at because the "petite room" wouldn't fit 2 people and our luggage. We got the room through priceline and we've never had a problem with any room until now. Tracy told us there would be an upcharge to change rooms. She also told another group checking in they would be charged more for their room. Other than the experience with Tracy the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price, it's a fairly good hotel with some oddities”
Reviews.Author: UChicago74
Reviews.Content: This is a great location, in terms of shopping and seeing the most attractive part of downtown Chicago. The hotel itself is relatively inexpensive for this part of town and for overall quality. There are a few aspects of the place that are a drawback, as has been noted in prior reviews. First, the place is hampered by its inadequate elevators. Even though it has five, you find yourself waiting a fair amount, including just getting to the lobby from the street level. Second, the rooms can be small. I had a corner room on the 11th floor, which measured roughly 9 x 11, leaving little room beyond that taken by the bed and desk. There was virtually no drawer space, and the closet and bathroom were also tight. For one person, it was acceptable, in a European/sailboat kind of way. The room itself was nicely done, with fairly good quality bedding and finishes. In talking with other guests, I got the impression that other rooms were somewhat larger, though not expansive. As for other aspects, breakfast was an anemic buffet priced at $15.00. The hotel has a large workout area on the top floor. Overall, I think the Allerton is a fairly good option, especially at the price.

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldCityReviewer
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row we stayed for three nights at the Allerton Hotel; the fact that we came back speaks highly of the property. We really like this place. It's funky, though. When you enter from the street level on Huron (even though it is a Michigan Avenue address), you are greeted by a doorman, but need to take an elevator to the second floor to check in. There really isn't a hotel lobby there either, but there is an understated check-in and concierge desk. The bar and small restaurant are there as well. The elevators are the smallest in North America, but the rooms are sweet and comfortable. This year we reserved the Jr. King Suite for a great price. The room had a living room with a TV and a bedroom with a TV. The bathroom is definitely tiny, but clean and in working condition. The Allerton is very much like the many hotels you would stay at in New York City. It's an older hotel in a great location that has been modernized, thus the rooms are relatively small, but they have been updated nicely. It has the feel of a Kimpton property. We like it, but you have to be able to go with the flow here. It's not a grand hotel with a lobby and a lot of staff. Rather, an older hotel with small windows in each room, but modernized for great comfort. The location cannot be beat; literally steps to Michigan Avenue and all that Chi-town has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: atl-travel-guru
Reviews.Content: Great location and great value. Room was clean and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Suprised!”
Reviews.Author: Peanutfly
Reviews.Content: I always do my homework when it comes to booking hotels. After reading a mix of good and bad reviews on this hotel I booked anyway, because I couldnt beat the price. $150 night. And after spending 3nights there I have no complaints! Checking in went smoothly, staff friendly. Room was clean, fresh and suprisingly lots of room! The bathroom was small, but clean. Great location, we always walk everywhere. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: evalano07
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from Chicago to attend a friend's wedding. In searching for a place to stay, I found a great deal on expedia.com for $89.00/night I couldn't pass up. I booked the Allerton on the spot then started reading past reviews on this forum. I became very skeptical about my choice based on everyone's complaints on the size of the rooms, elevators, service, etc. But based on the price, I figured how bad could it really be? Boy was I pleasantly surprised! The hotel is in an awesome location. The entrance is on Huron Street but N. Michigan is just to the right. We stayed in the standard room. A bit small but perfect for two.. no more! Loved the Bath N Body products! We had a view of N.Michigan Ave. I could see the Zara store just outside my window. They were having their grand opening that night, red carpet laid out and the whole nine yards! Everything is in walking distance, to the right about two blocks is the Hancock Observatory, the Navy Pier is probably about a ten minute walk to the left. So many shops in between to window shop. The red line CTA station was also just a short walk away! Yes the elevators are very small, occasionally had to wait awhile for one, but figured I'm on vacation, what's the rush anyway?! Didn't eat in the restaurant, prices are steep esp. for a cup of coffee. But complimentary coffee is available in the lobby every morning. There are also tons of restaurants nearby, we ate at Giordano's on Rush St., just two blocks away, Great stuffed pizza! Also in the evening, carriage rides are available just outside the main entrance of the hotel. Service was wonderful, we had a problem with the safe in the closet, but help was on the way in less than five minutes. Overall, our experience at the Allerton was wonderful and I would recommend it to anyone visiting the Windy City!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: beachlover21Usa
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a junior king suite (pictures listed under executive suite on the Allerton website) after finding a great deal online. This room has a bedroom and separate living area, with a t.v in each! I enjoyed having the extra space knowing that the petite and standard rooms are quite small, but this is a boutique style hotel, and that is what you should expect! With that said, I could have not been happier with the hotel and the location of it. The staff was nothing but friendly and helpful. For example, after hours of sightseeing the first day, when we arrived back to the hotel our luggage was still not brought upstairs. When I called down to the front desk they apologized and immediately had someone bring it to us. The man that delivered the bags then gave us tips on where to go for some decent Chicago pizza! The concierege made reservations for us and always helped with directions! The Location was also great...entrance is on Huron Street, Michigan Avenue is to the right of it. The water tower is a 2 second walk as well as the Hancock tower, Lots of great stores along the miracle mile, navy pier about 10 minutes, less than 5 minute walk to the red line which can take you into the loop where you can easily walk to other great destinations. Bathroom had bath and body works shampoo and conditioner, both smelled great, wish they'd add a lotion to the mix! Never ate at the hotel, breakfast prices were too high, but everything else seemed reasonable for a hotel......they had different drink specials each night in the lounge...free coffee in the morning...Our room had windows on three sides...in the bedroom we had a view of Michigan Avenue, and partial view of the water tower...the other 2 sides were of buildings. In the living area we kept the blinds closed because we were right next to an office building and I could practically read what was on the persons computer screen (but it is a city, and buildings are close together, can't always have a great view)...I do recommend going up to the fitness center at night...small windows, but great view of the water tower and hancock tower out of one of them, and they look beautiful at night... I have no complaints about the hotel, but will list some things that maybe could have been a little better, but did not at all make my stay any less special or comfortable! 1. bathroom was small, toilet takes up too much space next to the shower, there is only a small shelf above the sink for toiletries, and a magnifying mirror poorly placed right behind the door, so it got hit every time we opened the door!.....shower head was a little low for a person above 5'9..but great water pressure! 2. elevators were slow at times, and smaller than normal (but could easily fit 5 people or so)...if you've been to a small European hotel, these elevators will seem huge :) 3. breakfast menu is ridiculously overpriced 4. internet is NOT free in rooms, but FREE in the lobby and business center. 5. towels and bathroom were not very soft. 6. Pillows a little too soft as my head would sink right through them...I found bed to be comfy but my friend hated it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in 5 years”
Reviews.Author: dryfly13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights, Nov 2 and 3 and it was BAD. A conference rate of $157 appeared cheap enough but considering the hotel, service, etc it was WAY over priced. The rooms are just right for 4 shoe boxes. on the upper floors the hallways are about 90 degrees. Food is weak to average. Bartender in the evening was the most helpful person on the entire staff but the lobby bar is not very comfortable either. One Star is too many.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganized and Unapologetic: Beware of room 512”
Reviews.Author: lanitdelfoc
Reviews.Content: In keeping with other reviews, we did not receive the room we were promised: a deluxe king with a water tower view. Instead, we had a bed that was as wide as a king but extra short (perhaps a queen turned sideways?). Better yet, our "water tower view" was a view of the LOUD heating and ventilation system in a side alley (see picts). To cap off the cave-like aesthetics, the ceiling of the interior half of the room was so low that I could place my hands flat against it (Iâ€™m 5â€™4).What ticked me off the most, however, was the snitty way the Allerton staff dealt with us: we were treated as if weâ€™d wandered uninvited into someoneâ€™s home and refused to leave. On the upside, this is an incredible well-located hotel. Then again, so are a plethora of others.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: CUinCO
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Allerton and everything about the property exceeded my expectations. The rooms were recently renovated, stylish, clean, and the hotel could not be in a better location. The service was excellent. I have stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels in Chicago and would put the Allerton at the top with the best properties in town.

Reviews.Title: “You can dress up a pig, but it is still a pig”
Reviews.Author: deebee10
Reviews.Content: They tried hard to dress-up this hotel to make it modern but the pretty look doesn't make-up for the quality of the hotel and service. If I hadn't booked on hotwire for a lower price I would have been even more furious with this place. The concierge was the worst one I have had on the magnificant mile. One incident, on Sunday we asked for breakfast spots and the woman conceirge didn't know of any so she asked someone else, who directed us to 1 restaurant that had an hour wait. After 20 minutes of roaming we finally found somewhere else to eat. The elevators were too small and slow to accomodate all floors so we were left taking the dingy smelly staircase. Luckily we were only on the 5th floor. We booked 2 rooms, my sister called ahead of time to make sure she could get a cot in the room for my neice who came at the last minute. They said it would be fine on the phone. When we arrived they said that the cot could not fit in the room we booked and that they had no rooms with double beds. The only option was to upgrade to a King room for $25 and get a rollaway for another $25. My sister decided to squeeze into the King bed with 3 people. Last but not least our rooms were not cleaned well and had a funny smell. The beds were not four star beds, they were so rock hard it felt like we were sleeping on the ground and the were only full size, not even queen. The bathroom and TV were the nicest part of the rooms, but when your in Chicago on vacation you really need a comfortable bed since you spend most of your time walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad staff”
Reviews.Author: SAM231
Reviews.Content: The location is great. However it's difficult to believe it's a 4 stars (the room was not better than some 1 or 2 stars I experimented)... The staff was not friendly. I would not care if they didn't charge us for an expensive room service we didn't order. At first I thought the problem was resolved with the concierge. But finally we saw in our credit card account they still charged us. After email, phone call and fax, we still don't have any answer after 2 weeks...my advice is: be carefull and check your account after your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Silvamint
Reviews.Content: The Allerton is in a perfect location on the Magnificent Mile, especially if you're in Chicago to see the major sights and/or go shopping. I was afraid to approach the front desk after reading some other reviews, but the staff were perfectly friendly and the concierge very helpful. I was given a king-size room even though I was alone, which was roomy, clean, and nicely decorated. I had no view--just one small window that looked out onto a fire escape--and the room was dark with the lack of sunlight, but in a building that large and old there are going to be some rooms like that, and they might have moved me if I asked. I got the room very cheaply through Hotwire, so I didn't feel comfortable complaining! The hotel restaurant is open only for breakfast and lunch, not dinner (the information book in my room said otherwise). A jazz singer performs in the lounge on Wednesdays and Saturdays, which is nice, and the entire second floor, including the lounge and check-in area, has free Wi-Fi. If you like to channel surf, this is not the hotel for you--there was a nice big TV in my room, but I was surprised to find that it had ONLY pay-per-view programming. And one movie costs $15.00. It seems ridiculous to provide rooms with such nice televisions and not equip them with cable--it would have been nice to at least watch the news. But this was my only major complaint with the place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_Shopper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here via a win on Priceline - good thing i didnt pay full rack rate for this hotel! I had one night that I just wanted to relax after a business trip in Chicago and should have continued my stay at the Affinia around the block! I arrived on a rainy Friday, tired and exhausted from the work week. I was here alone, just wanted to chill and relax and take in the Michigan Avenue sights. The hotel has a very odd entrance. You arrive into the hotel to the bellman's area - - the bellman gladly took my two bags and gave me a ticket/receipt. I figured he would just bring the bags up to my room. NOT. They were SO busy with hundreds of bags in this small area -- and then that particular area leads you to a whole other section of elevator banks -- taking you up to the lobby on the 2nd floor. I figured that out....went to the registration level and checked in. (Check in process took forever - the line was very long). While i was there, this poor guy, (father of the bride) was already complaining about his very small room. I was thinking...OH NOOOO - i just got here and there are problems already? I got to my room on the 19th floor and it was TINY. Very poor layout, not very updated just a little box and a very small bathroom that was just looked like they attempted to renovate it, but it was still old. Only one person can fit i there at a time, put it that way. The noise level wasnt bad at all compared to the Affinia around the block. My room faced Michigan Avenue and not the hospital down the block...that was THE only good thing - the room was quiet and i managed to sleep well. The bed was just OK - -nothing ultra comfy/modern. Oh, and internet was additional at $9.95. This was the first time that Priceline has ever disappointed me with a hotel. I wouldn't ever stay here again. And, if I paid full price for this hotel, I would have been really angry. Do yourself a favor, find another hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tiff0000
Reviews.Content: I had arrived in Chicago very early on a Friday morning and dropped off my luggage with the bell service. I knew that I wouldn't be able to get a room right away, but the front desk attendant that morning called me on my cell as soon as a room became available. I thought to myself, "what a nice gesture!?!" Unfortunately, the front desk attendant who helped me check-in Friday morning was not the same attendant during my stay on Saturday and Sunday and I didn't receive the same courtesy from the other attendants. The weekend front desk attendants weren't very pleasant, weren't helpful, didnâ€™t smile, had no personality and when I asked to speak to a manager regarding a concern that they couldn't help me with, I was told the manager was on break but would call the room once they returned. The manager never called. I even left my cell number and they didn't bother to call that either. Then, I requested a late check-out on Sunday from an attendant that worked Saturday and was told I could stay till 2:00 p.m. Then when I reconfirmed the late check-out with the attendant working on Sunday, she told me that they werenâ€™t honoring late check-outs to anyone. I told her that the attendant I spoke with Saturday told me I could I stay till 2:00 p.m. And she said, â€œWell, I guess I canâ€™t tell you canâ€™t stay till 2 if someone else told you it ok.â€� And then rudely dismissed me for the next customer standing in line. I wish the lovely woman who helped me Friday morning, worked on the weekends, because I have a feeling I wouldn't be writing this negative review. I chose The Allerton Hotel because it had a great location, but I now know, why bother with a great location if the front desk attendants aren't pleasant. Yes, the rooms werenâ€™t very big, the elevators were tiny, and the hotel charges you to use the internet in your room, but I could overlook all that. But what I canâ€™t overlook is bad manners. I would not recommend staying at this hotel if you have any questions or concerns during your stay and need to speak with the attendants. P.S. â€“ The bell service was fabulous. They were a great group of kind men who helped with our luggage, hailed down taxis cabs for us, and one of the men even suggested a great breakfast spot a few blocks from the hotel. The front desk attendants should learn something from the bell men â€“ common courtesy!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch experience; the room, the atmosphere, the food, the event space.”
Reviews.Author: bellabelle
Reviews.Content: We held our annual user conference at The Allerton Hotel. The staff is attentive and the hotel seems to have low turnover as we see the same faces year-to-year. The food is excellent and the rooms are small but well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: HeleneStiphoutNL
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is super, the doorman and the bell boys were very attentive. The only minor is that you have to pay ($ 9,95/24 hrs) for wireless internet connection. It surprised me as we stayed in various hotels/motels during our 4-week trip through 13 states in total (including cities like NYC and Boston) but everywhere the internet was for free. No, correction: at the Motel6 you had to pay $ 2,99/24 hours. But hey, at a nightly rate of $ 60,- what can one expect. For the rest it was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Miserably disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: Branchtraveler
Reviews.Content: I visited the Allerton this past weekend for a girls trip. To say we were disappointed is an understatement. I visit Chicago many many times a year and often stay at many other fine hotels on the Magnificient Mile. I had yet to stay at the Allerton, and can tell you it will be the last time. I can say one thing..it is in a great location. That is the extent of the pro's. This was my girlfriends first time to Chicago and I was so excited for them to experience an old hotel like the Allerton, however now I am embarrassed. From the time we arrived (it was pouring down rain) the valet and bellman could not be bothered to help us. We had to unload our entire car ourselves, and then actually yell to get their attention to come and valet the car. You would think at almost $50 a night for valet they would be somewhat attentive. They did not offer to take our bags to the room or even hold the door, the bellboys continued to have a conversation amongst themselves why they watched us struggle in the pouring rain. We then went to the 2nd floor (odd for checkin) to the front desk, and was greeted by a lady whose name escapes me. She was pleasant enough, but seemed uninterested with the problems we had. I explained to her what had happened and she offered us a "free breakast" which was insulting as it was only the smallest continental breakfast I have ever seen, toast , crossaint, and juice and coffee. But for $5 additional you can upgrade to an even more disappointing buffet. So back at this point, we had found a "great rate" on priceline.com in which I had paid full price or I would have just left right then out of sheer principle,. but we couldnt. Once we got in the tiny tiny elevator, and made it to our room I was fuming. I have never had to drag my own luggage, soaked by rain to my room at a hotel of this caliber on a Thursday evening at almost 9pm. We opened the room, and I thought it was a bad joke. There were 2 double beds, in which you could barely walk by them., The tv was in a position that you could not watch from bed. The bathroom was a larger joke, no counter space and the shower had ZERO pressure. It seemed like I was in a bad movie. The beds had feather mattresses and were extremely uncomfortable. One more pro for the hotel was that they offered 2 glasses of wine in their bar for happy hour, but the bartender was totally aloof and arrogant. Then the topper was there was one tiny bar of soap in the bathroom for the shower, but none for the sink. They also wanted to charge for internet access in the room. But if you want to drag your laptop to the lobby you can have it free there. The hotel has been remodeled, and is very clean. But it is clear that management allows customer service to be at the very bottom of their priority. I have traveled extensively for business and leisure, and am accustom to hotels that appreciate our business and treat us as guests. Unless this is the last available hotel on the magnificent mile, I would recommend NOT giving them your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great service”
Reviews.Author: Christina926
Reviews.Content: Three friends recently stayed at the Allerton for fun. The other reviewers are right on the mark when they say the location is great - right in the middle of everything. We were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. The metro is close too. We took advantage of the upgrade opportunity we received in advance. For just a few dollars more, we were able to get a small suite. It was the perfect size for three people. Two nice sized rooms, with a sleeper sofa and 2 queen sized beds. Even though they knew that 3 of us would be staying in the room, we consistently were given only enough towels for 2, and there were no linens on the pull-out sofa. But we called housekeeping, and what we needed was delivered very quickly. So it wasn't a big deal. And I don't know what elevators one of the previous reviewers was taking, but we were on the 18th floor and breezed right up there every time. And the free wine in the bar from 4:30-5:30 was a special treat! We had a great time at the Allerton. No complaints from this trio of friends!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room but big comfort”
Reviews.Author: ritan1
Reviews.Content: The Omni across the street was booked solid, so I looked across the street and saw the Allerton. So while my friends stayed at the Omni, I took a room at the Allerton. The two could not be further apart. Although my friends and I waved at each other from our rooms, the feel of the Allerton is decades away from the upscale chain Omni. The Allerton's sign at the top of the building gives a traveler a hint of what the Allerton is - the Tip Top Room used to be one of the hottest clubs during the big band era and the hotel retains much of that Art Deco feeling. It has real character. But, built for single travelers, the rooms are tiny - "petite classic" was the description of my room. It was bijou, but spotlessly clean, nicely laid out and with all of the upscale amenities - lcd tv, wireless internet, robe, room service, etc. The fluffy comforter on the bed was perfect for a chilly Chicago night. Despite the small room, it looked out over Michigan Avenue with great views of the Magnificent Mile. The bathroom was beautifully done with retro style tiling and fixtures (great showerhead), but there was no shelf or space for toiletries which really undermines the feeling of luxury. Still, the location can't be beat and for the money, it is a great value. My next time in Chicago will be at the Allerton

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, unbelievable location”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo27Madison
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend anniversary on Sept. 25 and had such a positive experience. From the valet parking (pricey but worth it) to the staff to the guests, everyone was incredibly helpful and good natured. The hotel has good vibes. Tip: Apply for the optional upgrade, which means if they have a suite available they will upgrade you for $15. (The standard room was only $99.) We got one it was indeed first class. The hotel is classic old architecture, restored to perfection so if you love the details and don't mind smaller spaces, it is a real joy. We were twenty floors up, so street noise, (right on Michigan Ave. was not a problem. On site restaurtant is expensive but worth it. With the valet parking and room, it came out to about $150 a night, great for right on the avenue, much more expensive hotels are right across the street. Do yourself a favor and check it out. We plan on returning each year.

Reviews.Title: “Allerton Hotel, New York in Chicago...”
Reviews.Author: lani927
Reviews.Content: Chicago: The Allerton Hotel - Chicago. September 17 - 19, 2009 My husband and I were visiting family in Chicago and wanted to spend a couple of days downtown and booked our trip online. The Allerton came up as a four star and because of the location, I thought it would be a good deal. Our experience left a few things to be desired. The hotel is older but the renovations were nice. The valet and bellmen were very accomodating and could not have been more wonderful. We had a pleasant greeting at check-in and that's pretty much where the good times ended. We arrived in our room and the standard room was smaller than hotel rooms I stayed in while visiting New York and I didn't think that was possible. The bed must have been a full size bed and there was very little walk space on either side. The bathroom doesn't have any real counter space so all toiletries must be left on the desk. I turned the bed back and the linen was filled with soiled spots. When I called to inform the front desk, the woman was short, didn't apologize and let me know she would send housekeeping up. I called back 35 minutes later when no one showed up and spoke to the manager who was very apologetic and sent them up immediately. She assured me she would follow up with me to make sure things were satisfactory but never did. Welcome to The Allerton! The hotel was clean and the location couldn't have been better but if you are looking for comfort I say, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay-Loved the Art Deco Feel”
Reviews.Author: MOKenzie
Reviews.Content: We took a romantic trip to Chicago for Labor day weekend. The Allerton was in the PERFECT location. We walked almost everywhere in the city. I could not recommend a more wonderfully situated hotel. The decor is splendid, it is art deco and very chic. I loved the lavender smell in the entry and lobby areas. Our room looked over MIchigan Ave. We stayed on the 6th floor. I believe the previous reviewer maybe a little misinformed because this floor was beautifully remodeled and it was only one floor higher than the 5th. I have to disagree with the previous reviewer in their negative rating of service as well. Anytime we requested a service or information it was prompt and the whole staff was very informative. The rooms are small, so I recommend upgrading to a larger room. I believe that their smallest rooms are called "Petite" so try to upgrade from that. They have blow dryers, high end shampoo and conditioner and body lotion. Also, you can dock your IPOD on the alarm clock. Beautiful decor, great service, and a perfect location..I highly recommend! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal Service”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticNVirginia
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Allerton for location, but even a Motel Six beats it for customer service (or at least the service I received). When I arrived, for a business trip, the distracted and seemingly unhappy desk clerk put me in a terrible room, tucked behind the elevator...tiny...dark...bed went from one wall to the other, so you had to climb across it to cross the room. I called and requested another room. I was put on a different floor in the SAME TYPE of room -- only it smelled dank and unpleasant. It wasn't until I went back down to the desk and demanded a better, sunnier, room that I got one. The desk clerk didn't look too happy, however. That indifference (it even felt like hostility at times) characterized the service during my entire four day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, great quality, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: citymom5
Reviews.Content: We did not know what to expect for the reasonable price we paid. Would it be a dump? As it turns out, the rooms were impeccably decorated - though quite small. The location could not be beat. Right in the heart of the Magnificent Mile - walking distance to many attractions. The breakfast at the hotel was quite expensive, but there is a lovely irish pub called The Elephant and Castle right on the corner which has a plentiful and reasonably-priced breakfast.. We traveled with our 5 children, and had a lovely stay. Would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “great stay but had some issues”
Reviews.Author: reynavivi
Reviews.Content: i had booked my reservation through a website and when we got to the hotel late at night the lady at the frontdesk informed me that our room was overbooked and the only thing available was 2 rooms on opposite end so my husband had to sleep in one room with 1 of our kids and i had to sleep in the other room i was furious i had paid in advance fofr a junior suite and she just apoligize and thats all she could do after a few minutes of telling her that was not going to work all of the sudden she said that a specialty was out of order because the bar sink didnt work so agreed to take that room as long as all my family was together i agreed and she said the next morning we would have to move to the room we booked,so when we got to the room we find out it was not the bar sink but the bathroom sink that didnt work the next morning i called the front desk to ask them if our room was ready and the gentleman i talked to said that we didnt have to move if we didnt want so again i agreed to stay in the same room but i mentioned to him about the bathroom sink and he said that was no problem he was going to send someone to fix it the same day well we stayed 4 days and that sink was never fixed i never complaint again because i thought well maybe they will fix it tomorrow my husband was not happy at all we had to brush our teeth in the bar sink for 4 days and he had to shavewith no mirror but other than that our stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Location and breakfast buffet are great, but that doesn't make up for the other issues”
Reviews.Author: tallandsmiley
Reviews.Content: My stay was to take the IL bar exam, and about 10 colleagues of mine stayed as well. I specifically requested a room on the 4th floor when I made the reservation a month before. When I checked in, the lady tried to put me on the 16th floor, and argued with me when I told her I had the email they sent me stating the details of my reservation and my specific request. She eventually put me in a room on the 4th floor after I refused to take anything else. I have no clue what the rigamarole was for. I would have had to leave if I wasn't on a lower floor. The elevators are a total JOKE. After waiting over 10 minutes for one the first day, I took the stairs for the rest of my 3 day stay. I always saw a bunch of people waiting for the elevators. The stairs are cool, but for women staying in a city alone - probably not the safest. You can simply walk in off the street and up the stairs to the rest of the hotel floors. No locks to the doors leading to the stairs. Yes, your room door is locked, but would you want to take the chance of being on the hotel floor by yourself with an intruder? Cleanliness is not their forte. The seating area by the check-in desk is nice, but when I sat down, I noticed the buildup of dust on the mantle behind me. When I checked into my room, the TV remote on the desk was FILTHY. I had to clean it before I used it. On my final day there, I dropped something by my bed and when I bent to pick it up, I saw cigarette butts, hair and dust bunnies under the TV stand. Clearly, someone is just cleaning what can be seen and letting everything else get GRIMEY. And, the hotel is supposed to be completely non-smoking as well - so you would think they would clean up cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected!!”
Reviews.Author: jazminko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the allerton on 7-27-09 for one night and we had to wait for our room and also gave us the wrong room i biiked a double suite and they gave me a king so my 2 kids had to sleep in the sofa bed, whe we ask for sheets no one came and gave it o us I had to go find the house keeper and get them my self. The hotel was nice and clean and a very good location if you like to shop, i guess my only complaint would be the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Big Location”
Reviews.Author: CaseyMD
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago for a conference, which was held at the Sheraton and we were looking to save some money on the room. The location of the hotel was excellent, easy walking distance to lots of restaurants and stores. We walked to the conference and back daily. I have stayed in many a small hotel room in big cities, so opted for the upgraded room size when I booked the Allerton. Well, I would have hated to see the smaller rooms! We were in a corner which was nice, but barely had room to move around the bed. I even went back down to the check-in desk to make sure I got assigned the upgrade, and they were not very nice about it. Well, the upside was the room was clean and convienent. The elevators were very slow and cramped. Good hotel as a home base for sight-seeing or buisness trip, not good if you want to lounge in your room or are traveling with a family. Worked for us for the money, overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: ln899
Reviews.Content: I stayed six nights for a conference held at the hotel. The location could not be better, right on the "Magnificent Mile," near the Omni and Peninsula hotels. The service and staff attitude was among the best in any American hotel I've experienced. The room was renovated, spotless, and comfortable, with flat-screen TV, etc. The only problem, and they forewarn you about this on the web site, is that this is a historical hotel. The the consequence is that the rooms, though renovated, are quite small by contemporary American standards, rather like a hotel in Paris or Tokyo. And I was disappointed that there was no coffee machine in the room. Otherwise, the stay was great. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value...will stay here next time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jamielaurenhunter
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic rate at this hotel for an overnight stay in Chicago. The reviews seemed kind of mixed to us and it only rates #90 ish on TA, so was kind of concerned. We checked in late, around 11 PM and the agent was unable to upgrade us as our reservation promised so she comped us a free bfast. The concierge, the bellman and the check in agent were all tremendously pleasant and helpful. The mext morning, we had a fantastic bfast. I travel extensively on business and have stayed at all of the best hotels in most major cities in NA....this bfast was as good as any and the staff were very attentive and friendly. AS stated already, the location is excellent. Our room was very clean, smallish that is true. The acid test for me is always how clean the bathroom is and most importantly does the shower have good pressure. We were in a King Jr. suite on the 22nd floor and the water pressure was good. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: warrenj04
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was a little concerned when reading some of the reviews. We booked the Allerton through Priceline for 5 nights in July. When checking in we were offered a free upgrade to a larger room. I must admit that this "larger" room was still quite small, but this would be expected from an older hotel in downtown Chicago. The key for me is the hotel and the room were exceptionally clean. The staff was friendly and always greated us when we walked in. Parking is quite expensive when using the vallet service. I recommend parking yourself. There is a parking ramp that is $13 cheaper per night a block away. All around a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerplus77
Reviews.Content: Stayed there only one night in Nov - thank goodness, the room was so small, I wont rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and nice”
Reviews.Author: monique1990
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Allerton for Valentine's day weekend 09'. I must say it was a very nice hotel. Although small, staff was very friendly and accomodating. We originally booked a; I believe they refer to it as a "mini" room.. (dont quote me) but they upgraded us free of charge to a normal size king bedroom. The hotel is located in a GREAT location! Michigan Ave. Shoppers paradise. Nice restaurant, nice staff, nice room service. reasonable price for a short notice trip.. (booked with orbitz.com) Would stay here again, would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: PhillyItalGal
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I were looking so forward to this trip , but were sadly disappointed. We were greeted with rotting food in the refrigerator. We called down to the front desk and they sent up a maintenance person, who cleaned out the refrigerator, and sprayed what appeared to be Febreze. No offer of a new room whatsoever. No apology. We settled in and realized there was no hairdryer. Our problems seemed to be over until we were greeted at 3 a.m. with the smell of cigarette smoke in our bathroom and hotel room. Regardless if it was a smoking floor or not, we were not notified. Other guests on the floor clearly took "smoking floor" literally and two afternoons in a row, the smell of marijuana smoke poured into our room.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmc9
Reviews.Content: Great location. The rooms are small and the hotel itself is stylishly decorated. There are some cleanliness and room maintenance issues that need to be addressed. Overall I was satisfied and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ridge4me
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a recent business trip. Room was small but nice. Location was convenient to Michigan Ave shops and Rush Street restaurants. Staff was pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Fuzby
Reviews.Content: Was booked here for a meeting - the organizers thought we would like the historic aspect of the hotel. The lobby and public areas are indeed stylish, as are the rooms. But rooms are REALLY tiny. Only one wastebasket, so I had to keep moving it between the desk and bathroom. Lots of hall noise, the A/C was also very noisy and the bathroom fan was deafening. Neither my room phone nor remote control was working during my stay, and the staff were cool and not very friendly. Parking and food are very expensive. The hotel is in a great location for downtown attractions, but the overall experience was not impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, shame about the service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuggleLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a one night stop over before catching a flight to NYC the following day. The hotel was fantastic, the room was big, with a separate lounge area, great bathroom with big shower and two big televisions. Eventhough we had spent the previous 36 hours on a train, the bed was sooooo comfy! The only thing wrong with the room was that either i couldn't find a safe or there wasn't one. If i was staying there longer than one night i would want a safe in my room. Location was spot on, we walked everywhere the evening we visited. The service at the front desk, not so good. We went to enquire about a shuttle to the airport for the next morning on our way out to dinner, the lady gave us the phone number, explained very badly what we needed to do in order to arrange it and then instead of offering the phone to us or calling for us, we were made to take the trip back up to the 9th floor to make the call! I wasn't particularly impressed with that, especially as the hotel itself wasn't a cheap one to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Best place on Magnificent Mile, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bbasu27
Reviews.Content: It is a decent Hotel offering great location & great value for money. It offers very fast wifi, which is great help for persons on business trip. The rooms are small & the food in the cafeteria is poor

Reviews.Title: “Neutral - some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Hiro_Jen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Allerton for a few nights during the Easter weekend. To sum up our stay: Good - location, price (got a great package deal from Orbitz), and cleanliness. Bad - room size is small but sufficient (mind you, we apparently got upgraded to a Queen bed but I am not convinced since my double bed at home is the same size as their queen size) and no coffee maker in our room so we went to the lobby and asked where we can get coffee and they directed us to the lobby bar where they charged us about $5 for a cup...now that's a bit ridiculous considering Starbucks was located across the street. Would I return again? Yes - only if I can get the same deal. I'll just have to remember not to ask for coffee the next time around! = )

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: SpreeBee
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 3 nights. As it was our first time in Chicago, we wanted something with easy access to shopping, lots of things to do and places to eat. The Allerton did not disappoint. We were able to walk to almost everything we wanted to do (parks, navy pier, shopping, restaurants, etc). We did have to take a bus to Bucktown, but the stop was right near the hotel. The staff were friendly, though we didn't interact with them too much. The room was in good condition and clean, but the layout was awkward, not allowing the person on the far side of the bed much room to walk to their side (less than a foot). As two girls, we didn't mind sharing one bed, but it was hard to get around without disturbing one an other. We were very impressed with the fitness center. There are several cardio machines (bikes, elliptical, 4 treadmills) each with their own tv screen and weight machines/ free weights. It was clean and there were always plenty of towels. It is bright and airy and wasn't overly crowded when we were there. The restaurant in the hotel was ok. It had good food, but not really a good place to have a 'night out.' Overall, we would happily stay at the Allerton again; It was the best value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great quality, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: juliaxix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the centre of the Loop - the heart of Chicago. Within a walking distance to the Theater District and all of the museums. Great spot, excellent bathroom (all walls in marble).
